text: During a recent stay at the Rio, my girlfriend and I decided to do Martorano's for dinner.  We are vegetarians, so there were only a handful of options for us,  but enough that we felt there was at least some choice.  She had the gnocchi which was quite good,  I had the pizza which I also greatly enjoyed.  I expected a 10" pizza as most places have for single servings... but this was a 12" and half of it was our breakfast the next morning.  The meals were good, but the prices for the food and wine were very Vegas, and by that, I mean over priced.  We're both very snobbish when it comes to food, so while the meals were very good, they were certainly not the best we've had.  Dessert was another story.  We decided to split the tiramisu... we were not prepared for this.  Previously the best I've had was at a hole in the wall in Rome where the staff did not speak English (a requirement if I'm going to a sit-down restaurant in a city with lots of tourism).   This tiramisu was leaps and bounds better.  Perfect is an understatement.  When I return to Vegas, I'm coming back to Martornao's just for this, and you should as well.

I don't hand out five stars often - but in this case, I think they are warranted.  We can't say anything bad about this place.  The food is not typical Italian - it's Italian, but with a South Philadelphia flair.  Everything was very good - I don't know how much else I can say.  The tomatoes in the Caprese tasted like tomatoes.  The cheese (both Mozzarella and Ricotta) are made in house.  The meatball is to die for.  The desserts were good.  Our waiter, Ben, was as good as they come - really - his service made our experience perfect.

It was painful to eat here.  The music was so loud that you could not carry on a conversation.  My ears hurt by the time I left. I may have been able to overlook that if the food was somewhat palatable.    I personally am not a fan of violence so when the music was lowered to turn up the volume on the movies playing I did not enjoy watching and hearing people get beaten up.  Again I could overlook that if the food was at least good.    Never again

If i could give this a 1/2 star I would, but not an option I have to give it a 1 star - so not deserved.  We went to have dinner there after my brother got married. we waited for about 45 min for a table, considering we didn't have a reservation that was ok. when we finally sit down at our table, wow we couldn't even hear the waiter ask us what we wanted to drink. Then when we finally order the time to get our food was average wait time I guess. the waiter brings out our food except for my new sister-in-laws food, she ordered her food specifically a certain way, about 10-15 min after we all had our food the waiter comes up and states there was a mishap with the first order so they had to re-do the order. when they finally bring her food out to her it was totally wrong and had ingredients that were not even asked for (allergies toa certain ingredient) that just made it worse, he then offers her a salad instead, she respectfully declined.  My aunt's food needed salt, and all they had was sea salt, with her medications she can't have sea salt, so he states let me see if there is regular salt in the kitchen, the idiot waiter grounds the sea salt and puts it into a bowl and brings it out to her and claims it's regular salt. we all looked at it and it was sea salt, had she used it she would have had an alergic reaction and would have gone into shock. Most italian restarauts i go to they always have nice music playing very low where tou can hear the person across the table talking in a regular voice, this music was on like if we were in a club, and we had to yell to the person across the table and they still couldn't hear you. this was just such a horrible experience, and will never go again.  I would not recomend this place to anyone even if it was the only place open in the casino.

What an excellent Italian restaurant! At first, though, you have to absorb the mixed atmosphere of a disco ball, tv screens, music and wall of glass overlooking the pool. Once you adjust to the atmosphere, you realize that the owner Steve Martorano is sharing with you his background of food and culture, and it's quite good. But the most important point here is the quality of the food. Fresh mozzarella with prosciutto- excellent. Meatball with salad- excellent. Homemade lasagna- excellent. The special "pescatore"- excellent. Then, of course, an Italian dinner isn't finished without a homemade ricotta stuffed cannoli and cappuccino. Also, I want to give a big shout out to Tara the restaurant director.  She answered all of our questions and her passion for the food and restaurant was obvious.   Our server was attentive and made us feel comfortable while we were eating our wonderful meal. So if you're looking for delicious tasting italian food, white tablecloths and a lively atmospere, you gotta' come here "yo cuz!"

I ate here back in June 2013, the night before I competed in a World Series of Poker tournament.  Since it was located at the Rio, it looked like a good choice.  Having been in the air for over 12 hours that day, I was looking forward to eating something not in a box.  Martorano's really piqued my interest is I am originally from Philly and so is the owner and namesake.  I've tried New York, and the Boston North End, but the Philly Italian restaurants are supreme. Will Matorano's be the same?   After a consult with my very helpful and friendly waiter, I opted for the $50 prix fixe menu, which was Caesar salad, Veal Cutlet, and dessert.  I also had to try the Meatball appetizer, the true acid test of a good Italian restaurant.  Everything I had was outstanding.  The veal was tender as butter and was seasoned perfectly.  But the meatballs were the high point of the meal.  The blend of meat and the succulent marinara sauce were exquisite.  The server filled me in on Steve "Cuz" Matorano.  He is a character -- like something that fell out of a Rocky movie -- but his food is the real deal.  Although I busted out of the poker tournament the next day, I still felt like a winner after eating at Martorano's.

This restaurant I came across after trying to get into another. It has a nice bar in the middle so sat there to dine. Bar tender was nice but talked to much so service was slow for all of us. I ordered the Cesar salad which was good. Then the veal Piccata which the Veal was good but the sauce was a little thick and sweat. They suggested the fried peppers as a side dish which was really bad and as a presentation looked the part. Also they were playing a monster movie on all the tv's that line the walls and it was a scene of a guy getting his face shot up which made eating pasta interesting. I would pass on this pace.

Bottom line don't go !!!  They push the over priced specials.  Will not serve plain old tap water then charge you big time for bottled water.  And the owner says don't break my balls this is the way I cook.  Well first of all your not there cooking.  I'm Italian the food has to much Garlic and to much salt. OVER PRICED OVER PRICED OVER PRICED .  My recommendation go some where else.

Nice view but a very far walk into Rio.  Shrimp scampish bread was great but probably is only enough for one.  Dinner was overpriced and slightly bland.  Wasn't terrible but wouldn't go back for the price.

My husband and I love this place!!!! The amazing food and awesome bartenders and staff you can't go wrong with stopping in here!!!! We always try different dishes and everything is amazing!!! As Vegas locals we frequent here because everyone here is so friendly and helpful!!!

Let me premise this review with the following: (a) my wife and I regularly eat at fine dining establishments; and (b) we ate here on Valentine's Day.  We came to Martorano's with what we thought were realistic expectations based on the restaurant's own comments as well as others.  We knew it was going to be a loud, fun atmosphere, and we knew that the chef himself markets the restaurant with the tagline that he is not a celebrity chef, his food is "just famous."  Well, the restaurant is loud.  We were surprised that for Valentine's Day at 6pm it was not crowded.  However, it was still loud.  TVs all over and music playing throughout.  Not really romantic but we expected this.  The wait staff was very pleasant.  We truly did enjoy our server.  The food, however, was only average.  We tried the meatball appetizer and while the meatball was good, it was not the self proclaimed "best in the world."  For dinner my wife had the lobster and I had the fish of the day.  My wife originally wanted an item which was listed on the menu online but the waiter said they had removed it from the menu.  Her lobster, while tasty, was a half tail portion the size of her finger.  My fish was very good, but again, for the price, not worth it.  Our dessert was probably the best part.  Cheesecake was marvelous.  Fortunately for us, the waiter directed us to this.  When we were stuck between two choices, he mentioned that the cheesecake was "100 times better" than our other choice.  All in all, it was an average meal, but for $250 (we had wine) and on Valentine's Day, in retrospect, I would have passed.  Disappointing.

I had a caesar and the bucatini with meatball.... it was good. The sommelier was well informed and let us taste a couple of reds before we made our selection. It was a little loud but i loved the oldie songs being played and the oldie movies being shown on the lcd screens!
The employees and manager there were complete snobs. Had a drink and left, super unpleasant experience.

I ate here last Saturday night.  While the food was all tasty (we cleaned our plates), I cannot say that I was amazed- I have definitely had better Italian food.  I did appreciate that you could see right into the kitchen, and they even had seats surrounding the kitchen area if your heart so desires.  This gives me a little more confidence that I am eating quality food that was not premade or thrown around in a dirty kitchen.  For me, what really killed this place was the atmosphere.  There are TV's surrounding all the tables which play scenes from famous mafia-like movies.  The restaurant blasts (I repeat, BLASTS) iconic tunes from these movies, but will occasionally put the sound clips of the movies for particularly vulgar scenes.  If the incredibly loud music/clips does not prevent you from having a conversation, the fact that you are surrounded by distracting TV's certainly will.  As a side note, please do not take children here- the restaurant has made the poor decision of  showing very violent scenes (yes- while people are eating?) and does not bleep out the curses when they play sound clips.  Not very tasteful if you ask me.

Frank Sinatra on the sound system, The Godfather on the TVs...  spare me, please.  I particularly enjoyed the 10 or so photos of the owner with d-list celebrities that kept scrolling on the TVs that weren't playing the Godfather.  The food was decent but the whole "Staten Island via South Philly" ambience pretty much ruined it.

I stopped by this place with my girlfriend as we wandered through Paris. The food was great but the service was phenomenal.   We had the shrimp bibsy special (shrimp with a sweet and slightly spicy caramelized coating), the chicken parmesan,  the gnocci, and dessert.  My favorite was easily the shrimp and I am definitely coming back at some point for more.   The service was top notch from start to finish.  I was surprised every time i needed something it was already there before i could even think to ask.  It was truly amazing.

What started out as a sub-par experience turned into a fun night.  We had reservations for 7:15, and the restaurant was absolutely packed when we arrived.  We waited about 45 minutes to an hour after our reservation time before being seated.  We actually had decided to leave because we had tickets to a show and were afraid we'd miss it.  Upon discussing the situation with the manager (or perhaps owner?), he promised to make it work.  We were assigned a manager or some type of higher-up as our waiter, and he was wonderful.  Bread with oil and vinegar was served (one of the things I miss most about Italy!) as an appetizer.  I ordered the tagliatelle alla bolognese and a red wine that the waiter suggested (which paired nicely).  Our food arrived promptly, and was flavorful and authentic.  The other two people in my party enjoyed the meal as well.  We had a great time and made it to the show.  They even gave us our meals on the house!   I deducted one star mostly because of the hostess.  She kept quoting huge parties a 20 minute wait time when it was clearly going to be over an hour.  She seemed quite inexperienced.  That aside, I would definitely go back next time I'm in town, but maybe on a night I don't have other plans.

Let me start by saying- if you want a quiet, candle lit dinner- this is not the place. Martorano's is the "go-to" place for a true Vegas experience! They have a great Vegas atmosphere- very fun and vibrant! In the middle of my dinner, a screen dropped down and played a movie scene from Austin Powers. Then a while later, there was dance music and a disco ball!   Food was AMAZING!!! I had the Veal Cutlet Martorano- I mean the guy's name is on it- of course it was freaking delicious!!! I also had the meatball which did not disappoint, but I'm telling you- the Veal Cutlet Martorano is one of the best Italian dishes I have EVER had!
Stay away. Large portions of mediocre food, and expensive. Staff nice but doesn't make up for the food.
Fabulous.  Best Caesar salad and Carbonara I have ever had.  Excellent and attentive wait staff.  Will go again next time in Vegas

If you've stayed at the Rio then you've seen the posters for Martorano's.  Big guy, shaved head, tribal ink, and a scowl.  I stay at the Rio 4x or so a year and it's their posters that have helped me resist eating at the restaurant.  As a marketing guy, it was clear that the strategy was to promote this guy's persona and DJ skills rather than focus on the food.  It was a free sample that drew me in.  I was waiting to check-in when a pretty girl came around offering samples of a Martorano's meatball.  I was shocked how good it was...really good...the best I've ever had good... and it was certainly enough to make me want to give the place a try.  Thirty minutes before dinner, I began to have doubts. The reviews for this place were so spotty, I have never heard anyone say anything good about the place, and I wanted to have a great dinner.  Should I risk it? Maybe I should take one more look at the menu.  It all looked good and I was fired up to go there again until I read the end of the menu: ABSOLUTELY NO CHANGES OR SUBSTITUTIONS. JUST LET ME DO WHAT I DO AND DON'T BREAK BALLS.  The "balls" thing was kind of Philly-clever and I liked it, but the "absolutely" thing reeked of immature hubris. If you're giving it to me, I'll accept that, but since it's my nickle and if my request is reasonable, then it's my way or the highway.  Despite this nagging "don't do it" feeling, I decided to give it a shot. Should I have listened to my instincts?  The entrance to Martorano's opens to the bar where it's intimate with a clubby feel.  Before being seated I took a look at the dining area.  Gone was the low light and rich feel of the bar and instead you're treated with a stark open plain and uninteresting room. There's nothing noteworthy about the decor other than there really isn't any. Pretty bland open room.  What I gather is supposed to pass for some kind of industrial minimalist effect simply looks unfinished and incredibly boring. The awesome news is that the dining room blares dance music at ~2 little notches below club volume.  The other reviewers weren't joking; it's loud.  The only other time I've heard music that loud at a restaurant was at a "rock n' roll" teppanyaki place where the cooks fling rice at the kid's mouths. BTW, that restaurant sucked as well so I opted to sit at the bar.  Wow, only one other customer at the bar and he's getting his check.  I'm gonna get great service, right?  Hang on....the bartender...let's call him "Dick"...wants to bus the guy's area before he acknowledges me.  A long 4 minutes later, Dick comes by to get my drink order.  I get my drink and my menu and try to decide what to eat.  I had a few questions about the menu, but Dick is still really busy...intensely focused...tending to his empty bar.  I called out my questions and he yelled back his answers OVER HIS FREAKIN' SHOULDER.  You see, Dick was far too involved going thru the day's tickets and lining up glasses etc to actually look my way, let alone stand in front of me. Clearly I was an interruption to him.  If I hadn't been starving I would've bolted, so in an attempt to minimize my time here I decided to have just an app  - the meatball with a salad.  While I was waiting for my food, Dick continued to amble about behind the bar, not once coming by (and the waitstaff wasn't keeping him busy). The food came. I ate it.  Dick continued to personify his nickname while doing his busy work.  Wait...2 girls just sat down...busy work is over and he's got all the time in the world for a 10 minute flirt session.  Ah...Dick wasn't that busy after all, was he?!  He was just being Dick.  The meatball was again really good, but a gristle in a meatball is JV and I found a gristle in my last bite, so it wasn't that damn good after all.  I got the hell out leaving a far too generous $2 tip...wish I'd left the goose egg.  This is an odd review but it's an odd restaurant.   The dining room ambiance is such an anomaly that the only crowd I believe this restaurant could appeal to are perhaps some teens and young twenty-somethings that like the loud music and probably haven't had a lot of (any?) fine dining experience.  I'm certain this place thrives on Vegas first-timers and unsuspecting others since I can't imagine anyone enjoying an expensive dinner in their dance floor environment.    Trust the 1 and 2 star reviews.  The bartender appeared to be some sort of manager and with his kind of skills, I'm sure the rest of the food sucks as hard as the service.  A final note:  this is definitely NOT a $$$ restaurant.  If a couple each has a cocktail and splits an app, has a salad and a mid-priced entree with a glass of wine and no sides and no desert, it will cost upward of $180 before tip.  The only way to get out with the $$$ rating is to have no alcohol or under-order.

I dined with my brothers and sisters and got charged twice for the same meal !  Don't trust these people and review your bill very carefully.  The prices are high and the atmosphere way too loud to talk to your table mates.  The salad was dripping in its dressing and the food way over spiced.

Was looking for a place to eat in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. Didn't really want Italian but it smelt good from outside. So glad we decided to go in. We had Salad, Chicken Parmigiana and a Cannoli with chocolate chips. We shared this and had plenty of food. It was so good. It all tasted very fresh. I don't like cannoli's but this was the best I've ever tried. The service was very good as well.  I totally recommend eating here.

This restaurant was a complete disappointment. Disappointed because it wasn't very good. Disappointed because so many people told me that they HEARD it was good. AND most of all. Disappointed because we did not go to Carmines in Caesars Palace.    This is Vegas. This restaurant should be good for a few basic reasons.   1. It's Vegas and it's a restaurant in a hotel on the strip.  2. It's in the Paris hotel. This is a nice hotel (for the most part) and to have an Italian restaurant of this nature in this hotel is a shame.   3.  This restaurant is not to far from Gordon Ramsey's steak house. Have you been there?  It's amazing. If I were Gordon Ramsey I would not want to be in the same building as this so called Italian restaurant.     OK. Enough rant. Now the facts. Here's my review.   This restaurant su*ked!!  Plain and simple. I ordered a Cesar salad. If I order a Cesar salad at the Olive Garden I know what I am going to get. I am going to get a mediocre salad with bottled Cesar dressing. Oh.......and not only will I not get anchovies in my Cesar salad, I think most olive gardens do not have anchovies anywhere in the restaurant. But this is not the Olive Garden. This is a fancy Italian restaurant in Vegas on the Strip in the Paris hotel surly they will do a Cesar salad right?  Won't they? .............well......the answer is no. And not only do they do it wrong. They do not even realize it. The Cesar salad at this Italian restaurant doesn't come with anchovies. That is the standard Cesar salad. (I should have left at that point). But.....unlike the Olive Garden you can request them. ....  yea........When my Cesar salad came out, it came with a side of anchovies. ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME. That is not how you do it. You do not add the anchovies that way. Even I know that. What a joke.   OK. One more food item. I know I have rambled on.   I love nochie. It is my very favorite Italian food. Being Italian my self....(well, mostly anyway) I fell in love with this dish when I was a kid and my friends mom in Upper Darby, Pennsylvania would make it from scratch when I would go to his house on the weekends. WOW!!! It was amazing. This was not the same experience. This nochie tasted like chef Boy-Ar-De  make it last March and was kind enough to put it in a can for the Cuz that runs this restaurant. It was hard. It wasn't dumpling like and tasted blan. Yuk!!   A lot of words in this review I know. But in Vegas at a hotel like the Paris the food should be better. I have had a better Italian meal at the Olive Garden.   Stay  away!!!!

I went there last night. We sat at the bar to eat because the restaurant was full. Which was okay with us. The bartender was great. But the food was not the greatest. We had a salad which was tasty but the spaghetti and meatballs were awful. The noodles were under cook, the meatball tasted like they were raw and the sauce was to bland. I'll never go back to this restaurant.
appetizers were really good! meatball salad & mozarella stack. entrees were salty as all hell... cut back on the sodium, cuz!

I am in the Paris Hotel every weekend, so I thought I would take family there to try it.   Very underwhelmed and can't really see what the hype is all about.   Service slow (Sunday night in December) we ordered the Calamari as an appetizer (which was OK) and literally a minute after another waiter showed up with our Entrees! The look on his face when I asked him to come back later was priceless!   We both had the Veal as Entrees, when It came back the second time, I was very unimpressed. It was just a piece of Breaded Veal with a thick sauce and sliced Parmesan cheese.  No Veg, no sides, nothing.   The sauce had huge pieces of a very spicy pepper, I love hot and spicy food, but this didn't go with the dish at all.   It's an expensive place, my wife works for Caesars ent, so we got a discount. To be honest.... There's far better Italian restaurants in Las Vegas for the same prices.

Incredible.  I was expecting good, old school Italian. But it was so much better.  Mozzarella made to order. Sunday gravy, best chicken parmigiana ever, and carbonara served with fresh egg yolk cooked into the warm pasta at the table.  One word of advice: as good as the bread and two types of olive oil (plus pecorino Romano) are, skip them.  You will want every bit of your appetite reserved for the main courses.  Definitely a new favorite in Vegas (and we live here).

4 of us just dropped $500 (five hundred dollars) for dinner and a bottle of wine. We're going to a show @7:00, so we decided we would return and have dessert after the show.  When we returned we were refused a table for dessert and drinks. Plenty of tables available. It was 9:30 pm, restaurant doesn't close till 11:00 pm. They wanted to put us at the bar with music blasting behind us. Are you kidding me? We just spent $500 there 2 hours before.   We travel often and know tons of people that travel also.  We will NOT be recommending this place because of this treatment.    I would think twice about putting my name on a restaurant that treats you're guests this way.

I'll start by saying that the Service was excellent.  Our waiter was super attentive and extremely friendly.  We ordered the salad and meatball as the appetizer.  It was excellent.  For the main course I ordered the Spaghetti di avolo and my finace ordered the lamb Bolognese.  Both dishes were extremely salted.  It pretty much ruined any flavor of the herbs and spices that the sauce had.  I couldn't even finish half of my plate.  The drinks were good.  Overall, the service is top notch but the food was borderline inedible.  Just like anything in Vegas, this was expensive, but I think I would have gotten something better tasting for the money we spent there.

Overall, horrible experience, but let's break it down:  Food - good. Ambience - horrible. Waitstaff & service - slow and unrefined but responsive. Value - 0 stars. Bottom line - never bring a large group here.  My job had me in the Vegas area and we (about 10 people) decided to go for some fine Italian cuisine on a Tuesday night.  The guy heading up the evening's plan picked out the place.  I had miss-givings about the ratings on Yelp, but went along.  At around $50-$100 a person, our expectations were for a trendy but refined Italian dining experience.  We dressed in suits and expected a 3-4 star dining experience (formal dining rating system).  Ambience - promised to be great, but collapsed.  Initially, the light effects, soul / R&B music, and classic Casino movie were all positive.  Upon seating, I noted to my wife that we overdressed for the restaurant (2 stars on the formal rating system).  As the evening progressed the ambience went from interestingly artistic to overwhelming and lewd.  The music got so loud we couldn't hear the waiter.  The movie changed to something that should have been X rated (lots of bare breasts and explicit sex scenes.)  There were 5 TVs in sight; all playing the same show.  We all commented on how distracting it was.  The lighting was so dark that they gave out pen lights to read your menu with.  Between the darkness, overwhelming sound volume, and explicitly distracting TVs, the cacophony was at best poor taste.  Wait staff and service - responsive but not refined.  We made reservations for 7:30 and were seated at about 7:45 (not bad for a group of 10.)  The waiter took our drink orders and explained the specials using an iPad (all good.)   The drinks came and we ordered our meals.  About an hour later we noticed that the bread was gone, the wine and water were empty and still no food.  A little after this the waiter came up and apologized for the delay.  The establishment was not busy, but we were a group of 10, so we were not upset - these things happen.  What happened next was odd:  the waiter brought out 9 of 10 entrées.  The missing meal had accidentally been delivered to the wrong table.  We waited 15 minutes for us to all have food before starting.  At this point the ambience was also starting to collapse (see above).  Once we all had food we started to eat and I ran across a 10 inch hair in my otherwise tasty lasagne.  I lost my interest in eating my entrée.  The waiter was apologetic, made my entree complimentary, and offered free deserts for the table (good comeback move).  He also offered drinks "to compliment the desert".  The volume level of the music made us mistakenly think he said "complimentary".  Unfortunately, it gets worse.  My desert came out first ... then we waited for 15 more minutes for the rest of the deserts to arrive.  We were not amused.  At this point it was 10:30pm.  The evening was shot.  We left around 10:45pm having paid over $900 for the evening's disaster.  Food - good.  Even though the rest of the evening was pretty horrible, I thought the food was good tasting.  The appetizers were tasty with a nice twist and the wine pairing complimented the lasagna nicely.  The deserts were authentic and also good.  Unfortunately the food's taste lost focus when it became cold from waiting and I ran across the hair in my entree.  Value - bad deal.  For a meal in the $90 range, I am looking for a good experience and great food.  Loud music, porn, and clumsy service heavily detracted from what had potential.  Bottom line, don't go here with a large group or high expectations.

Went to this restaurant before seeing Penn & Teller.  Didn't have reservations, so we sat at the bar.  Bartender was taking care of at least 15 people at the bar plus drinks for the rest of the restaurant.  Service was slow, but the bartender had a lot to do so it was understandable.  I got the linguini with clams, my husband had mixed seafood linguini.  The food was good, but on the salty side.  We each had two mai tais with dinner.  Surprised to see that they charged $14 each for the mai tais which were small and unremarkable.  Total bill was over $160.  I wish we had noticed that we could have saved 25% by showing them the stub of our Penn & Teller tickets.  Won't be going back there again.

Had a very good meal here about a month ago when I was in town on business for a restaurant conference  (Eggplant Parmigiana and a house salad).  Thought I would give it another try this week when I was back for another restaurant related convention. this time, the meal was terrible and the service was indifferent.   The bartender raved about how great the Philly Cheese Steak was and basically told me to order it. when it arrived it was so salty it was not edible. don't misunderstand, I love Philly Steaks and I like salty food as well, but this was disgusting. After he saw I couldn't eat it, he asked if I wanted something else. I ordered a salad and decided to call it a day and chalk it up to a bad meal. However when I received the check, I was amazed to find that the overpriced $18 sandwich  (of which I ate less than half) was on the bill along with the salad.  Bottom line I will never go back. Bad food and Bad service is a lethal injection in our business.

Obscene and disgusting!  Had a reservation at 9:30.  Sat down and the volume of the music from the video displays was so loud that we had to shout at each other at the table.  Asked manager to turn volume down.  He said, "his owner wanted it that loud."  Sat back down.  Video screens switched to a movie trailer.  So now we had Eddie Murphy screaming obscenities: "c**k s****r  &  m****r f****r at mach 10 volume in our ears.  We got up to leave.  Told the manager.  His response to the obscenities was, "that's just who we are".  Really, How sad!  Went across the casino to Mon a Mi Gabi and had a great meal.

A few things  Tile on the floor is the exact same as the bathroom in my house that was built in 1905. True story,  exact same. This part is not a knock, just truth.   Appetizer bread frozen in the middle,  what the heck  Pasta subsitution is apparently a chore, and was looked down upon.   Angelhair pasta not offered here.  Al dente only, dont ask for anything else.  No parmesan offered with pasta  Beer selection limited, bummer.  Table service limited,  meh  Basically, i expect this level of selection and service from fast food, not a restaurant.  Very disappointing.  Asked for refund on entrees, received.   Very disappointing

Amazing! But be warned it is pricey. My grandma ordered the pig feet and pig skin as an appetizer and I thought omg that is gross but our waiter explained to me that it gets cooked/marinated in a red sauce for about 10 hrs. I ended up eating more than my grandma did lol it was so good. I ordered the eggplant stack which is a caprese salad and geese it was absolutely amazing! The mozzarella was extremely fresh and the balsamic vinegar was aged so it had a sweet taste(i would say this is the best dish I have ever had in my life hands down) my grandma ordered the riggatoni and liked it but said she wouldn't order it again for $28. They also bring you out complimentary bread (which is also awesome) and it comes with a dish of olive oil, balsamic vinegar, and red pepper flakes(i also enjoyed this immensely). So it is a bit pricely but is a great choice if you want to splurge for amazing food!

i feel bad for those that didn't get the good experience.  i was there w/ a bunch of guys so we mingled at the bar before we got seated.  if you want to a nice quiet romantic date don't come here because your eyes and ears will be occupied by music, tv, and lights.  once our table was ready the waiter greeted us and placed wings on our plates.  we sat and started to grub on our free wings... boy was it good!  they only offer a verbal menu so you have to pay close attention to what the waiter says.  ok, make sure you order their philly cheesesteak appetizer cuz it's freakin awesome!  that thing seriously melts in your mouth.  i ordered their lobster thing w/ risotto and again.. super yummy.  their portions are HUGE so make sure you go on a empty stomach.  chef martorano was there that nite so it was coo to see him in action.  i dunno why people are hating on the location just cuz its at the rio... it might look ghetto but my room was awesome.  maybe they were staying at the cheap towers.  have fun at cafe martorano!

The atmosphere was definitely different. Every few minutes they play famous death scenes from popular movies at an extremely high volume ... a little ironic in a restaurant that is all white and (sort of) fancy looking. It was interesting to have the entertainment while waiting for the food.    The food wasn't that great however. Steak was boring. Not well seasoned. Sweet and sour calamari was a joke ... completely unoriginal. The gnocchi was good though. Its better with the marinara sauce than the alfredo.  There are so many other great places in Vegas. Martorano's is not worth a second visit when there are so many places I have yet to try.

My family ate there on 4/19, we ordered egg plant stack app.  It was good but a bit unrefined, too thick slices of cheese and tomato. For dinner chicken parm, no pasta...  Was deemed good. As well as pasta marinira. My father and i both ordered the clams in white sauce, we couldn't eat more than 3 bites as it was way too salty and spicy from the chilis..  We sent both entrees back and didn't order anything else.    Unfortunately we will not be ordering any pasta dishes from this resturaunt again...
Food was ok, host was  horrible and mediocre, slow very slow server even the place was empty, meatball salad is good as reviewed in this site.

I am very confused as to why this place doesn't have a 5 star rating. We went here for my best friend's wedding reception and fell in love with the amazing Italian food (some of the best I've ever had) and the fun atmosphere! My friend and I were singing along to all the songs. :) They really impressed me too when the chapel she got married in was running about an hour behind schedule and I called the restaurant to push back our reservation ON A FRIDAY NIGHT- they were so accommodating and understanding! The service was so great too. I wrote in the Open Table reservation notes that we were there for a small wedding reception and 2 of the staff came by and told the bride and groom congratulations! We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas. Thank you so much, Martorano's for helping us make October 2nd such a memorable night.

Avoid this place. Seriously. My group wanted to get dinner before a Penn and Teller show, and this place looked promising. My first red flag should have been when we walked in at 7pm on a Saturday night and there were five people in the entire restaurant. We get seated and order. The food was DISGUSTING. My husband got the linguine with clam sauce: clams were horrifically overcooked to the point where they were hard and the broth was bitter and soapy tasting. MIL got penne with sausage and mushrooms. She look about three bites and couldn't eat anymore. Sausage was like hockey pucks and sauce was too sweet. SIL got the baked lasagna. Between and sauce and pasta it tasted like they had dumped a pound of sugar into it. Lastly, I ordered the rigatoni with Sunday sauce. The chunk of pork wasn't pork at all, it's was a fist sized piece of fat. Zero meat. MIL complained to the manager and they gave me a meatball instead, even though I insisted I wanted nothing more to do with their food. The only plus I can give to this restaurant was that the waitress and manager were very nice and apologetic. Service was superb, but that doesn't trump the awful food.

I came here a few weeks ago for a some appetizers and a drink. The bread and chili oil was a really nice start with the Martini that I had. The meatball was flavorful and tender, I would definitely come here again to try one of the entrees.

We had dinner here for my husband's birthday.  I usually stick to cream sauces because I'm picky about red sauces.  I ordered the tagliatelle classic parmigiana cream with chicken and peas which was excellent.  The pasta's had great texture and flavor, definitely handmade, I love that it was thicker than other pastas I have tried.  After getting our appetizer meatball I wished that I had ordered a dish with the red sauce, it was so flavorful and zesty.  I tried some other dishes that my family ordered too, the bucatini carbonara with pancetta was rich and wonderful also.  I liked the very modern decor and loud music.    ****If you are a local show your ID and players card and get 25% off****   The reason's I did not give this place 5 stars: I don't like that the soda comes in bottles.  I'll be forever spoiled by the endless refills that practically every other restaurant offers.   My husband had the orecchiette with hot and sweet peppers which did not look appetizing at all, I didn't even try it.  He thought the restaurant was "OK" while everyone else loved their food.
Incredible Food, Service, Ambiance and Drinks!  Louis our server and the entire staff were fabulous!

Only giving this three stars because I didn't order dinner here so can't comment fully.  I will say the service and friendliness of the staff was first rate -  The place was loud but they have TVs at the bar and cool movies running in the background - lots if DeNiro. For obvious reasons.   I DID order the calamari which gets rave reviews by locals here.  Instead of being covered in batter and deep fried - it was more sauteed and then mixed with both sweet and hot peppers and this great sauce - delicious!  The app portion was pretty big too.  I would definitely return - and FYI - to give you an idea of prices - my app and one glass of port (Taylor 20 year) was $42 and change - place was crowded - reservation recommended for weekends -

Excellent staff and service. The food was outstanding and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The eggplant Parmesan was large enough to share so you get your money's worth. A Notable wine list was also a nice compliment. This place is worth a try. Not to mention, for a more upscale place they were not pretentious and also were reasonably priced.
We loved the food here! Very pricey but well worth it! We even had gluten free pasta and it was to die for. If you are looking for a fancy, romantic place? Go here!

Got there at 9:50 pm last night and they said the kitchen was closed. I told them that I was a tired and hungry traveler and that their posted hours are until 10 pm. They said their last customer came in an hour ago so the kitchen closed early. Is it that hard to stay open 5 hours per night?   This same thing happened last time I tried to eat here but they had closed down even earlier. There won't be a third try. I feel sorry for the chef - his staff couldn't care less about his business or his customers and their indifference is hurting his bottom line whether he knows it or not.

Martorano's in Vegas was the worst restaurant I have ever dined in any where in my life!  The place was way too loud to have conversation, the wait staff were arrogant, condescending, & the rudest ever (turned our backs for a few minutes to talk to the guests at the table behind us & when we turned around again our appetizers were gone without us even finishing them), they tried to up charge us on bottled water & other items and when we said the regular water was fine they gave us some hokey excuse about it not being filtered, etc. & appeared pissed off that we didn't order bottled H2O, the food was horrible & over priced, (veal parmesan floating in a plate of oil). YUK, This place is a sad excuse for supposedly an upscale/pricey dining experience, especially with so many terrific places in town to choose from.  Don't waste your time & money!
Awesome food and Sunday Gravy!!!  Meatballs are the bomb.... Yo Cuz!!! A must when in Vegas!

Went there this past week, stumbled upon a great Italian restaurant in Paris...who knew?  But the food was great!!!  We started by splitting the eggplant stack, highly recommend and I had the veal marsala, tender and delicious and my friend had the chicken parm which she said was great.  Super attentive waiter and manager checked in on us, great hospitality.  Check it out!

Some of best Italian food I've ever had. Some reviews here seem to disparage the place with insinuations about off the shelf ingredients, etc. I don't know and I don't care. The food was top-notch. Three of us each tried different pasta dishes. Ravioli with hot/sweet peppers, the Pork Gravy pasta, and a veal dish. Each was excellent. Larger portions, but not overly so. Also had the calamari with spicy peppers/sauce. Best version of calamari any of us ever had. Excellent wine list for Italian wines.  I rate the food 5 stars, but deduct one star for the "ambience" factor. The restaurant in the Rio doesn't seem to know what it wants to be. Nicely spaced tables with white tablecloths, fresh flowers on each table. Pretty classy, but then you see all these flat screens everywhere you look playing gangster movies (Godfather II was playing while we ate), and Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin blaring in the background. We didn't like that.  Food? Fantastic. The room? Not so much. And the disco balls gotta go.

Some time back, my wife and I were staying at the Rio, and went here for dinner, Tuesday night about 7 PM.  Walked in and was told that, since we didn't have a reservation, we would have to wait, which was cool with us.  So, we're in the waiting area, and we see two different parties walk out within 10 minutes.  Within those 10 minutes, we see another couple walk in.  I couldn't hear whether or not they had reservations, but they went right in.  After waiting another 5 minutes, I decided to just stand at the hostess station, thinking that maybe we had been overlooked or forgotten.  Oops, a family comes in (three small children and their paternal units), and gets seated.  I'm standing RIGHT THERE, no meniton of a reservation.  I walk to my wife, sit down, and tell her what happened.  I'm telling her that I'm ready to bounce to eat anyplace else, but she's pleading that we're already there, and to just give them a few more minutes ...  And here comes the hostess, "We're ready to seat you now." Really?  You mean a table just somehow opened up?  Would it be next to that lovely family that just came in?  Because I would love to use some colorful metaphors.  Bottom line for me was, the front of the house really spoiled my appetite. As the first person to greet your mostly out of town guests, why would you want to want to alienate even one?  Is the place really that fiscally sound that they can blow off customers?  Since then, my wife asked me once if we could go eat there but I told her I refuse to go back.  First impressions, indeed.  Yo cuz, mangi questo.
Wanted something to ease our hunger pains,  but now wanting a full meal.  Ordered the risotto at the bar and it was HEAVEN!  Melted in our mouths.  Looking forward to my next visit!

No. No. No.  I was so hungry and craving spaghetti and meatballs, so since my husband and I were staying at the Rio we decided to give Martorano's a try.  Our server was so terrible.  He was visibly frustrated with us when he asked whether we wanted extra plates and we didn't answer right away (because we were both in the middle of eating).  Our meals came out at different times, so my husband sat and watched his food cool off (I told him he could eat, but he's polite enough to wait).  Then my plate arrived with fingerprints along the edges.  My waiter just stared at me while I wiped down my plate and acted like he was doing me a big favor when I requested another napkin.  At the end of the meal, I mentioned that being served on a plate with fingerprints all over it was very unappetizing, and he just mumbled a completely insincere apology as he walked away.  My husband backed me up by leaving just enough cash to cover the check.  On principle, whenever I don't tip, I always talk to management.  I explained that when you're charging $25 for spaghetti and meatballs, the meal should be served on a clean plate.  I also said that I could even get over that, but when the server doesn't care whether you had a good experience then he doesn't deserve a tip.   I felt better for speaking my mind, but still not so good about dropping $100 for such sub-par service.  Another pretentious restaurant in Vegas.
Excellent Italian. Had the Short Ribs and Pasta. Sounds wierd but was outstanding. We will definitely come back next time in LV.

Unless you have money to burn on "just ok" food, skip this restaurant.  I ordered the chicken Marsala that came with no pasta.  I asked for a side of pasta and they brought a minuscule plate of spaghetti.  The chicken Marsala was $38.  The minuscule plate of spaghetti was $12!!!!  TWELVE dollars!  Enough said.
Food was excellent. The service was the best I've ever had or seen. They really combine excellent together. Had Chris as our waiter. The food was outstanding

I ordered spaghetti with salad. The dressing was too sour and the meatball was salty. For our main entree, we ordered seafood spaghetti and a special item which both were super salty that we didn't finish. We drank so much water! The music was too loud that we have to yell across the table to talk so we didn't say much.  2 stars for the ambience of the restaurant. I will not be coming back!

I have lived and dined in Vegas for over 10 years now, and I have never experienced such a complete joke of an experience as I had when dining here.  I don't believe for an instant that I can adequately convey how disappointed I was or how many horrible attributes this place has.  The nightmares started when we first sat down and didn't stop until we were out the door, and unfortunately there was a long gap of culinary torture in between.  Most of all, this restaurant is the epitome of a "tourist trap."  It features an extensive yet grossly overpriced menu and a service staff that was obviously hired based on looks rather than on ability - the two main "tourist trap" requirements.  The atmosphere is unlike any place you've ever been, but that's not necessarily a good thing.  It's different because nobody in their right mind would ever build a restaurant like this.  Loud, overpowering music and movie tracks that keep you from being able to have a conversation (and likely designed to also keep diners from being able to complain about the food) combine with disco lights and uncomfortable chairs to make sure there's no way anyone could ever experience a moment of peace while dining.  It's like trying to eat in the middle of a dance floor of a Vegas club, except that people on the dance floor would notice you more than the staff at Martoranos does.  Incredibly slow service, requests that went unanswered, one entree served cold and another served only half-cooked (pasta too, not meat) and all the while an unbearable atmosphere that made us all want to jump up and leave at a dead run.  We should have, because when the bill arrived it was completely outrageous even after they took off the half-cooked spaghetti.  If you go, bring earplugs, aspirin, dark glasses, $200 more than you would expect to spend on any meal, a microwave or warming plate, an air horn (to get the attention of the staff or the person across the table from you) and, most of all, bring a whole heck of a lot of patience.   I love the Rio and everyone and every place in it, or at least I did until they put this dump in.  Let's hope people start realizing it for what it is and the Rio replaces it with a real restaurant that's not run by an egocentric maniac who thinks that people want everything his way.  Don't believe me?  Look at the menu carefully (both comments and prices) then ask to walk through the "dining" area before you agree to sit down.  I wish we had.

Martarano salad was delicious. A bit pricy, but the food is pretty damned good. Ate at the bar, bartender was very attentive and the food came very fast. The linguine and clams was legit. Giant clam meat within the pasta. Delicious. Some might find it salty, but that dish is supposed to be. I would totally eat here again.

I've been ordering calamari as my favorite appetizer for decades and the Calamari Bisby is hands down without question the best I've ever eaten. It is the most tender bite of calamari you can imagine. The flavor profiles boasts a slightly spicy and sweet Kung poa style  taste leaving you wanting more.  Next time I come to Vegas I will be back for the appetizer alone. I ordered the veal Parmesan for an entree.  My companion ordered  the chicken parm. Both met and exceeded expectations, the chicken outweighing the the veal in tenderness and flavor. I will make an effort to return here next time I come to Las Vegas. The service was above par.  The waiter was helpful and the delivery/bussing service staff was borderline entertainment for the evening.  I can't stress enough to get the calamari Bisby even jf that is all you come for.

I went for dinner at 5pm, sat at the bar and ordered there signature dish, rigatoni with sunday gravy. I thought it was really good, but for $28 I expect a larger portion of pasta. Pasta is not expensive, so they should load all the plates up like many other Italian restaurants do. If so, I would have given a 4 star rating!

My boyfriend and I went to this restaurant last night and will NEVER go back.  It is outrageously expensive for what you get.  Our waiter was arrogant.  The music was so loud that we couldn't speak and when we asked if it could be toned down, we were told no and to be happy we were sitting where we were since it was louder in other areas.  When the music wasn't playing they were showing an old Rocky movie (again so loud that my ears hurt).  With all the other good Italian restaurants in Vegas, do yourself a favor and pass on this one.

An unexpected find for amazing veal and chicken Marsala! Portions were great and the side of pasta and Caesar salad easily shareable. The atmosphere was fun but not overdone and our waitress amazing. She was so helpful with suggestions and attentive. The wine options also very good.
The absolute best Italian food anywhere!  We go to the one in Ft. Lauderdale often and the Vegas location is just as amazing! The meatballs, the Calamari Martorano, the Sunday sauce!  Just go!!!

I gave it two stars for the food. When we got seated, we got the iPad with the drinks. The waiter then gives us a spiel about the owner, food served family style, so if one dish is ready and the others are not, you must serve that dish and wait for the other dish to come out. If your other party doesn't want the dish you ordered, they sit and wait...and wait. They brought the appetizer, after yet another bus boy had brought the wrong dish, and we said we were splitting it. The assistant said he would be back to serve it to us. We waited   and waited while he went to get plates. Then waited some more. Finally he came with some plates.  THREE times the "assistants/bus boys" brought us the wrong meal to the table. They gave our food to the table next to us. They did let us keep one misplaced dish, but only after our waiter finally showed up and I told him we didn't order this. He said "yeah, the other table got your food" so we had to wait again for the food that we ordered. Since there was only two of us, the waiter was doting on the other table with four people. Bigger tip, I assumed. I ordered ice tea, and got a bottle of Chinese tea and a glass of ice. I guess they have various favors of bottled Chinese tea. Once the correct food finally arrived, it was ok. I've had better, but it was adequate. Will I go back? NO. No excuse for a restaurant that has been open for 6 months for the service. If this chef is so great, I suggest he hire a manager who knows how to staff a restaurant. The service was absolutely terrible and totally disorganized, and we were there on a night that it wasn't busy at all. I shudder to think what happens when that restaurant gets busy. My suggestion, go to Buddy V's at the Palazzo for good service and good food and walk past Martoranos at the Paris Hotel.

Cafe Martorano was probably one of my fave dining experiences I have EVER had.    It was my first time in Vegas, and we asked the concierge at the Palms for a good Italian restaurant nearby.  She suggested Cafe Martorano, and I am soooo glad she did!!    As soon as I entered the Rio, i'm not going to lie, I was turned off.  It smelled like a dirty diaper, and could not have cheesier decor or people roaming around.   But, as soon as we walked into the restaurant... it was an experience like none other.    I was with 6 of my girlfriends, and we sat down at a beautiful table, it was quiet, there were a few other people in the restaurant... and all of a sudden BOOM! Disco balls came down from the ceiling, GREAT old school jams were playing, the waiters were wonderful and super fun, the FOOD was amazingggg (make sure to get the eggplant stack as an app).    Then, two men came up to our table, chatted with us for a bit, and then bought our entire meal, multiple patron shots, and 2 bottles of wine.  All we had to do was give our waiter a great tip.  It was a fabulous time, great food, and I am going back in a week.    Don't let the Rio turn you off... this place is a MUST!

Cliche Italian atmosphere, flatscreens playing various ratpack and bloody action movies which doesn't make the food any more appetizing. Speaking of the food, if you like too much garlic and way too much salt you will love this place. The service is terrible in terms of getting your food. We were sat in a nearly empty room, ordered and a few more tables came in and ordered.. most of the new tables were served long before us. It's not like I ordered something complicated, just spaghetti. The price is laughably high for this food, if you want the same kind of food head to the Olive Garden and save $50.
Jeremy, the bartender, was awesome. The food was awesome. We'll definitely come back. A great experience while watching the Cubbies win!!

I love Italian food and really wanted to enjoy this place but I didn't like it. The bread they brought was dry and tasteless. It came with olive oil or cheese or spicy olive oil and none of that helped it. Just gross. For my main meal I got the veal piccata and risotto. There was two big pieces of veal and plentiful sauce but just not much flavor. And by the time I was halfway through the sauce was cold and it was congealed into a jelly like sticky glue. Risotto had zero flavor. It was supposed to have fresh veggies and cheese but veggies looked and tasted canned and it was just blah.  I did have chocolate cake for dessert and it was very moist and good. I saved more than half for next day but unfortunately got very sick to my stomach about 30 minutes after this meal so I ended up throwing it away because I don't know what I ate here that did not agree with me.  Service was fine.

STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!  This place will not last long.  The servers act like frightened dogs.  The management is argumentative.  Your soda comes in a plastic bottle.  The music is so loud it could make a Slipknot fan complain about auditory pain after dining there.  The server tries to force you to order your entree at the same time as your appetizers and when confronted as to why you need to order our entree right away they smugly answer like mindless buffoons "Cuz that's the way we do it here".  By far the worse dining experience we have ever had in Vegas.  We didn't even get past the drinks before leaving that abortion of a restaurant. If you want a comparable dining experience for a lot less money, then do yourself a favor and go to the Double Down on Paradise and scrape the dried sputum off the floor and put it on a plate.  You won't even be able to tell the difference between that and  Martorano's complimentary bread with ground rat meat they place on the table prior to cattle prodding you into ordering.  I know it's an Italian restaurant so mind my French when I say this place SUCKS!

5 stars for service and food quality! Jessie was our server and she was outstanding. Super friendly, accommodating, and made us feel welcomed. All of her menu recommendations were spot on. For appetizers, we had the Famous Meatball and Eggplant Stacked. So delicious, I highly recommend both appetizers. Perfect sizes for sharing. For dinner we had the Veal Marsala and the Carbonara. So flavorful and authentic. Nice size portions as well. The atmosphere of the restaurant is really cool too. I'd definitely eat here again not only because the food is so good but the service we received was impeccable!

One has a circus of choice for dining in Vegas ... BUT why in the F*** would you not have a true dining experience.  The Chicken Parmesan is heaven wrapped in the most amazing gravy and fresh freakin' mozzarella.  Not to mention, Paul, our server  sat with us for a true  heart warming chat and laugh. My Silican Great Grandmother will disown me from the grave for this ... Love you Great Grandma Orlando ... The greatest Italian dining experience ever!  You must dine here!    Why are you not here now!
We thoroughly enjoyed our meal at Martorano's. The food was excellent and the portions were very generous. The servers were friendly, professional, and attentive. We'll be back!

Crazy expensive, poor quality.  That $30 veal parm?  Comes with no sides.  Expect to pay $6-10 add'l for a side.  And it's just ok.  The calamari is horrible.  The best part of the experience is the R-Rated movies on the TV's so you occasionally get to see a topless woman.  Skip this dump.

My husband and I went there for dinner and it was great! The best calamari I ever had. We sat at the bar, and the service was exceptional. We ordered what she recommended and it did not disappoint. The only drawback was the price. It was pretty expensive, but not any more expensive than the other dinner restaurants there in the Rio.

Restaurant was very nice although they play old gangster movies on several tvs throughout which makes it hard to pay full attention to the table... Service was top notch and food was delicious. Had the meatball to start and shared the rigatoni and the chicken parmigiana. The chicken was huge and tender but a bit too much cheese on top. Everything was going great until approx 9:15pm the music went from Sinatra style dinner music to blaring R&B and disco. It was quite strange and took away from the ambiance and the meal. The music was loud and awkward and with poor transitions. Great food and great service - just go before the 9pm discotheque starts!

Omg! This was my 1st visit and it did not disappoint even the bread was good. I the chicken parmesan and a side of fresh veggie risotto and I highly recommend both! I will totally be coming back next time I'm in Vegas. The atmosphere was energetic and it's a great place to people watch. The music is vibrant and therr were tv's with sports and movies on. The service was also superb.

Looking for italian restaurant? This is the place to go. Great view and place. Servers offer you variety of pasta to chose from and wine, great choices. If you are looking for a first romantic dinner date, this is the place. Great staffs too and very friendly.

Wow. Amazing meal. Read the reviews 1st and they were spot on! Do not miss the meatball and fried mozzarella appetizer and the egg plant app! We were getting full so we split the Rigatoni Sunday Pork and it was AMAZING!!!! Do not miss these 3 dishes. Our Bartender Evis recommended it and he was spot on. Had an wonderful glass of wine with it! We will be back every time we visit Vegas!

There is not too much to complain about here. Yes there are over priced items from on the menu. Stay away from them. The Carbonara Pasta dish is the BEST I ever had. And the meatball and Salad app was amazing. My Italian grandmother would be jealous of the Sunday "gravy" (We call it sauce).   Stay with the classics and you won't be disappointed.

Truly disappointing experience. From the blasé  greeting by the hostess to the rudeness and sloppiness of the bartender to the exorbitant prices for average food and drink, this was the low point of our week in Vegas. We really enjoy Italian and the quality here was unremarkable yet for top dollar. Mr Martorano has his picture prominently displayed throughout the restaurant. One would expect that he would take more personal pride in the delivery of quality and the hiring of professional staff.
Nice decor, cool music. The tv screens were a little distracting for my other half lol The food was great. Had the pizza and it was really tasty. Would come here again.

My wife and myself were looking for a nice Vegas dinner during our stay at the Rio. So we finally decided on this restaurant.  We previewed the menu prior to entering the establishment willing to pay the inflated prices but for a nice Italian dinner.  We were seated and sat there at least 10 minutes without aknowlegement from the staff,  then tha loud music became unbearable.  Couldn't even carry on a conversation with my wife.  The music they think is innovative and customer friendly  " SUCKS".  It drove us out.    We took our cash elsewhere.   We'll never return to that restaurant....

Booked here because the experience in Florida was epic...food, service, atmosphere...well, this was the antithesis, as the restaurant was about 1/2 full (Tuesday eve) and the service was slow.  Food was not nearly as flavorful as I recall, and the portions were overly sauced.  Thumbs down.  Bummed I burned a Vegas meal, and in a gross hotel to boot.  I'll certainly give FL another shot.

Some food is good, some just ok. But the service is slow. Very slow. 35 minutes from being seated to getting our first drinks. This has happened on both occasions I've visited. The servers are friendly, at least. The atmosphere is also very Jersey Shore. If you're in to that, you might enjoy it more than I.

Holyyyyyy Shitballs. This place sucks. (Note: I start every review at 3 stars. You get three stars for existing. Good service? +1 star. Bad food? -1 star. Etc.)  Alright so: The food? Actually not that bad. Pretty decent meatballs, sauce that apparently is called "gravy." (Dear Steve Martorano: it's called sauce. Gravy is what you put on turkey on Thanksgiving. It's made from the juices and drippings of the bird. Look it up, cuz.)  So yeah, food was alright. That's as far as this review goes for positive feedback. Go to Martorano's if you enjoy the following:  - LED backlit menus - an iPad drink menu that gets taken away as soon as you order your first drink (want to peruse the drink menu? Good luck tracking down your waiter to get it.)  - Disco lights that rotate over your table constantly, changing the color of your food from pink to yellow to green to bright white.  - the same 10 loud songs that totally don't fit the meal playing over and over again because apparently whoever is in charge of the music found a mix CD from 1997 in the trash outside of Bally's (Hope you like Doo Doo Brown and Jock Jams vol. 3 while you eat!).  - American Hustle playing on the TV's all around the place. Now listen, I'm into film, I'm a grown ass man, but I don't really appreciate watching permed-up Bradley Cooper mount Amy Adams while I dip my bread in olive oil, ya dig? But apparently they have also been known to play The Godfather pt. 2, which totally fits in with the music. NOT.  This place is what I'd expect from a guy with "Yo Cuz" tattooed on his arm. It's like a 14 year old kid tried DJing for 3 years, had no talent, stole his grandmother's sauce recipe (not gravy. SAUCE.), and opened a bunch of restaurants with shallow decor, a limited menu, and ZERO imagination. This is a perfect example of good food with piss poor execution. Slow it down, Steve, ditch all of the flashy crap, and dedicate the place to serving good food. Because the food isn't worth shit when the dining experience is akin to root canal.   I'm looking forward to heading back next year, when this place is out of business and is replaced by a decent Italian restaurant, just like the one it replaced.  Final Verdict: +1 Decent Food -1 Music -1 Lights, TV's, General Atmosphere -1 Service (Wait staff is alright. But ordering from an ipad that you share with other tables? Not so much. Oh and be sure to fill out the survey on the ipod touch when you get the bill! It's SO hip!)  I won't say avoid at all costs - but get the food to go. Do not eat in the dining room.

Simply stated, everyone should be aware that this establishment refuses to accommodate any food allergies or food related diseases.   While I have a number of food allergies, I am definitely not one of those individuals who asks for outrageous customizations to the menu in order to be accommodated and I have never had to walk out of a restaurant due to a refusal to be served - not even in France, where I had to ask (in English!) to have my meal prepared without butter. So, imagine my surprise when I sat down with my extended family, for a birthday dinner for my aunt, and the waiter flat out refused to serve me one of the salads on the menu without dressing and a side of olive oil and vinegar. I did not ask for a dish to be prepared differently, only to not have salad dressing. I explained to the waiter it was a severe allergy and that I would only be ordering wine and the salad and he was so rude and obnoxious in his refusal that he reduced me to tears in front of 8 family members.   Needless to say, my fiancé and I left the restaurant and my aunt's celebration and will never return to this establishment. From what I understand from those that stayed, the salads were all prepared with far too much dressing, their version of "al dente" pasta is literally a workout to chew and is really nothing more than under-cooked and the service and attitude of the staff never improved. With so many options available in Las Vegas and even just within the Paris, I would be surprised to see this place still in business when I next return.
Came here for a bachelorette party dinner and it was so yummy. Perfect portions and the menus lit up. So cool!

I can hardly believe there is only one review on this place! (Forgot to publish this back in February so it  might not be true anymore) Amazing meal. Atmosphere was fun and festive. Service was really good. Food was delicious. We will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas. Location is perfect - right next to Chippendales (here for a bachelorette party) and the voodoo lounge, and if you have a good table you can watch the Carnaval parade go by...  A+

Played good music - however the food was overpriced.  Whenever I go out to eat, I like to go to places that are unique.  I've had better Italian food at other chain restaurants.  The chicken parm wasn't crispy at all.  The Marsala was to salty.

Where do I begin with this review. Wow is the first word that comes to mind! My family and I had a 8pm reservation. As soon as I gave our name we were seated immediately. The ambiance of this restaurant is FIRST CLASS! The decor, the service, the music, the menus that light up, everything is NEXT LEVEL. We had a wonderful server who came over and seated us immediately. We started off with the Famous Meatball & Salad and Fried Calamari Martorano. One word: AMAZING!!!! The meat ball had SO MUCH flavor. It was very tender and rich but not overcooked at all. It spread apart with a slight push of the fork. The gravy, very flavorful and rich. The salad was fresh and very flavorful as well. The Calamari....seasoned and cooked to PERFECTION along with the sauce and green peppers, hands down the best calamari I've ever eaten, PERIOD! I had actually stopped eating calamari the past 8-10 years because it simply wasn't prepared right the past few times I had eaten it(restaurants should take notes from Steve). These were our appetizers.  Next up, entrees! The kids kept it very basic, spaghetti with sauce(no gravy, sauce) and salad. My wife ordered Linguine in White Clam Sauce and I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak. I didn't try any of my wife's but she said it was fabulous. I was nervous about the cheesesteak because I don't like a lot of bread, especially if it's hard and firm. My plate came out and the sandwich was PIPING hot. So hot I had to allow it to cool down. I finally took my first bite and the flavors oozed inside of my mouth. The cheese, the steak(SO tender and juicy) and the bread roll was not too big and it was beyond soft. The meat and cheese seemed like it sank into the inside of the bread and it made a perfect fit! The peppers on the side were spicy(exactly like I like them), juicy and fresh! I only ate half of the sandwich and I was stuffed! The kids finished their meal off with cake that I didn't try ONLY because I was too full. Steve and Marsha treated us like family! Steve is one of the most humble, authentic people I have ever met in my life. What you pay for when dining at Cafe Martorano is a EXPERIENCE, period! Its truly entertainment: the music, the movies on the big screens, the decor, the service, the food; it's simply on another level. When we visit Vegas again in a couple of months I know exactly what I'm ordering and I can't wait! Hands down the best Italian food in Vegas, no questions asked!  Yo Cuz!!!!!

I read some of the other reviews and I cannot speak on the ambiance in the main dining room as we sat out in the patio area. I will however speak on the food.  I took a client here for dinner on a Thursday night before a night out. We ordered a bottle of wine and the calamari to start. The service was excellent, the wine was presented well, and the calamari was out of this world (I'm a bit of a calamari snob). I then ordered the Chicken Sicilian. I'll make this short...this is probably the best Italian food I have ever had and I used to manage an Italian restaurant. My client was also very satisfied as we were talking about how good dinner was for the rest of the night.  Again, I didn't experience the atmosphere of the main dining room which, from reading other reviews I could see as being kind of cheesy. But if you are just looking for great food, go here and sit out in the "patio" area, which is in front of the restaurant out in the main hallways of the Paris Casino.

I don't know why this restaurant doesn't have 5 stars. Our experience was incredible. The food was to die for, their homemade mozzarella was out of this world. Very authentic food, and we know because we are Italian! Highly recommend!  So we ate again here two days later and AGAIN, the food was phenomenal. Chris our server was outstanding and Jeff the manager was great as well. After talking to them and picking their brain about who Steve Martorano was, we now love it even more. Our kind of restaurant and our kind of guy!   Don't hesitate to eat here. Incredible place.

Give it 4 stars for the food I had, 4 stars for service, 3 stars for price (I understand location costs) and 3 stars on seating (explain below.)  First of all if you are staying or gambling at Paris or Bally's, good Italian, real good. Can I get better in Utica, NY or Philly or Brooklyn or Jersey or....mom's kitchen, yeah, yeah, maybe, but you are in Vegas. If you like veal, you gotta try the house Veal Cutlet Martorano. It is spicy with peppers and really sharp tasty cheese. I get veal all over and am a pretty good cook myself, I'm gonna figure this recipe out (steal it)!  I had it with the sauteed greens (spinach) crisp, fresh & tasty. Why not escarole? I was drinking bourbon, so the food review ends there.  Now if you want a little privacy, stay off the rail with all the casino pedestrian traffic. Interior is ok. I don't get the movies or music, give me Italian music, Martorano!  Wait & bus were attentive and personable. I don't get the lit up menus, but then again I'm old fashioned.  My food was 4 star, I'd give the place 3.5 overall, and yeah I'll be back for the veal & greens.

WORST CASE OF FOOD POISONING IN MY LIFE!  The only thing that my companion and I ordered that was separate from the group was a plate of angel pasta--"completely vegetarian."  Don't know what they put in that pasta, but the rest of our Vegas trip was spent over the toilet or in bed :(
Excellent service, food and ambience. Highly recommend this restaurant, they aim to please.

Just Amazing...There is nothing else to say!  Our server Paul was very knowledgeable and offered several suggestions on what to try.  Food was just like Mom makes...Home cooking and fantastic flavor.  You MUST come and try the rice balls and meat balls!!  WOW!
Food was absolutely amazing! And our waiter, Matthew, was the best ever! Definitely coming back :)
Best eggplant I've had in 10 yrs, besides mine... the Martorano salad with a meatball was excellent.  Things are alacart, but dont go crazy ordering too many different things, good to share..

A relatively new restaurant in between Bally's and Paris, which replaced another Italian restaurant. I will say this place is much better than the previous restaurant, but that's about it. The decor is very nice, modern with a classic touch, very inviting. It's a restaurant slash sort of night club with a DJ slash bar. When we were in there happened to be a Jazzercise convention in town and all of a sudden 30 women from outside and inside the restaurant went to the dance floor and danced their shoes off. It was a nice touch to the evening.  5 of us sat at the bar, which ended up be very nice, since we got a corner.  I will say the whole Yo Cuz thing and life size posters of Steve and him on TV over the bar in a loop cooking just doesn't cut it for me. It was almost a turn off. Seeing a tattooed jacked guy in a tight shirt and cooking with no audio over and over got old very fast. I would rather see a logo spinning or a game on TV.  To start with the menus illuminate! Very classy touch. How many times is it too dark and you can't read the menu, this is the first time seeing anything like this. Their main menu opens up and it has a easy on the eyes white glow. In addition they have an iPad for drink specials AND food specials. We weren't told about this until after we ordered appetizers as it wasn't clear that there was more to the iPad menu. For drinks I had an amazingly smooth vodka martini, highly recommend it.  For appetizers we shared the meatball salad, the eggplant stack and the fried calamari martorano. The meatball salad is a great idea, haven't seen that too much however you need to have a good meatball. Not the worst meatball but frankly it was not good. Way too dry and I believe too much pork. They say it was voted one of the best meatballs around, they probably didn't have real Italians try them. Do not get it, you will be disappointed.  The eggplant stack was good, nice crust on the eggplant again nothing special. Now the Calamari Martorano, that's no normal fried calamari, and this time I mean that it a good way. The sweet and spicy pepper tomato sauce with balsamic vinegar was delicious. The calamari were tender and the plate was full of flavor. For an extra spice drizzle the spicy oil they bring it with the bread! One thing I don't understand is they have a second fried calamari dish, why have two? I would rather see a different dish.  For the main dish I ordered off the specials (see the iPad). I had the double cut pork chop in a vinegar pepper sauce. The pork was cooked through and through, but more importantly the meat was very moist and full of flavor. It's tough to cook pork all the way and keep it moist and tender, these guys know how. In addition it was a very large portion, as we noticed on a lot of there dishes.  Have to give credit to the bar back, not only did she clean up and help the bartenders, she served our appetizers family-style and was on top of anything we needed. Made the experience at the bar feel like we had a waitress, nice job.  You get a lot for the money, big portions and big flavor at Martorano's!
Over-priced. Over-salted. Poor food quality. Giant hustle.

If you're at Paris and looking for a great restaurant then eat at Martoranos. Excellent service and food is delicious. Big portions which is nice. Our server Jessie was super cool. Great personality and very attentive to our needs. She recommended the eggplant stack... wow!! And the famous meatball is amazing!! Must order this! We had the veal Marsala and penne alla vodka. Food is awesome I'll definitely be back! Great job Martorano you have great food and great employees! Thank you to our server Jessie she was awesome.

First off, the service was good and the appetizers were decent.  We had the mozzarella (good) and the rice balls.  Before I continue I just want to share my qualifications for even giving a review - I can cook a wide array of foods; from Peking duck, to rib roast with béarnaise, to what has been said is lasagna as good as anything that can be found in northern Italy (with homemade sauce).   My wife had penne ala vodka, and while the flavor was good, the plated portion was at most worth $18-20, even by Las Vegas Strip standards, not the $28 they were asking for.  I had the Veal ala Martorano.  The "sauce" was basically some stewed tomatoes, chunks of garlic and chunks of Chile peppers (Serrano's), some salt and pepper over fried veal.   Now for those of you who enjoy heat for the sake of heat then you might very well enjoy the "sauce".  However, I find that spices-heat should not appear out of nowhere like a left jab to the face, depending on which fork full of food you happen to take a bite of.  They should be infused in the dish and add to the flavor, not fight with the other flavors.  That was not the case with this dish.  If you think you might like the dish then I would suggest trying it this way -go buy a Serrano chile and get a slice of pizza.  Then take a bite of each at the same time.  This will save you the $32 cost of trying the "veal ala martorano" to see if you like it, although it may be an insult to your favorite pizza.

We were at Paris Hotel for 4 nights in February 2017. We enjoyed a lot of good food but by far this was our best overall experience. From the reservationist the day before to the hostess the water server all the way thru to our waiter it was primo. Food was excellent as well, we shared the waiter's recommended special of the night - be sure to check the iPad for their specials. Loved sitting out on The Avenue as well. If we are back at Paris Hotel, we will definitely return.
