Food varies. My dish, the carbonara, was awesome! Real authentic and even came with the raw egg (Something that most places won't do). My husband ordered the Chicken Marsala. The sauce was amazing, probably due to using a good wine, but I found that the chicken was a bit dry and tough. The Caesar salad was a very large portion and excellent. It was a little heavy on the EVOO but that seemed to be a trend here. Granted it is a very good quality oil, so I did not mind.   The service was real great as well! Table was kept clean, staff was very knowledgeable of their menu, and the remaining staff kept busy and even though it looked a little slow they were working (setting tables, etc).   The decor and location are why I gave it 4 stars. If this restaurant moved to an on-strip location like the Bellagio, Cosmo, or Venetian/Palazzo I think they would do much better. The Rio just does not do them justice. The view of the pool is not so great and the tables and chairs are a bit outdated and show some wear and tear.  Overall, I would come back for a birthday dinner or special ocassion!  We went to see the MJ Live show after and it was very entertaining. Recomendation: Dinner and a Show!

I wanted to dislike this place.  The life-sized wall posters of the giant tattooed Italian American Cook with his catchphrase "Yo, Cuz" along with omnipresent clips of HIS favorite movies and HIS favorite cooking show (himself) should be all the warning you need that you are dealing with a massive ego here.  Oh, if that weren't enough, the entrance to Paris on the Arc has one giant image of Gordon Ramsay and one of this guy.  So, at first glance, I'm thinking, "Ego, pure and simple, and nothing more."  I'm happy to say I was impressed by the outcome, though.  Ego or not, this food is good.  Now, disclosure, I'm not Italian, so I'm probably not as harsh a critic as others.  But, I've eaten at a fair share of Italian places, and I know some authentic Brooklynites of Sicilian heritage who know a thing or two about cooking.  This place nails it.  The fried mozz, best I've ever had.  A giant ball of fresh, in-house made mozzarella, thick sauce with spicy peppers, perfectly cooked and seasoned.  The bolognese (special of the day while we were there) was literally the best I'd ever had.  I mean, just melt-in-your-mouth amazing.  Cocktails were great, no complaints here either.    I'd definitely come back here again if I'm ever in Vegas and craving good Italian.  This was well worth the visit.  For Vegas, the prices were actually pretty decent, too.    It does get a bit loud there, though, especially after 9pm.  They warn you about this, but it's still hard to hold a decent conversation, even with someone right next to you.  Part of the kitsch, I guess.

This place was one of my favorites. The had Emlo as their house wine, which is always a plus. The food was great. I went with a nice Caesar salad and a fish dish. Everything at this place was perfect.   The menus were electronic and very neat. We sat on the patio which is not really outside, but the hotel area had painted ceilings so it seems like you were somewhere else.   Food was top notch! Highly recommend.

Not satisfied with this restaurant at all. I went around early afternoon and the restaurant was pretty slow, only a handful of people. You would think we wouldn't have to wait. That was not the case. We had to wait over a half an hour for the waiter to take our order. And almost another half hour for the food to come! It would have been worth it if the food was 5 stars but it was completely average, and for what I am paying (overpriced for the quality) and waiting for, I expected more. Disappointed with the service and the food here and will definitely not be going back.

My boyfriend and I went there a couple of weeks ago during our stay in Vegas.  I have nothing but great things to say about this place!  First off, WOW on the food!!! It was one of the best meals we've ever had! All the food was delicious.  Beautiful restaurant and cool technology - love the lit up menus and tablets to order dessert and such off of.  We ate at the bar to watch the NBA playoff game and Jeremy took great care of us.  It was an all-around wonderful experience!  If you're in Vegas, eat here

Very loud inside. All entrees served have no sides and they don't allow any substitutions or anything to their menu. Server was friendly. Managers are very cold, unhappy and look like they hate hate their lives. Ordered the veal marsala and it was ok. Got an $18 side order of spinach, lol. I'll never go back or recommend this place to other locals or tourists. There are better options folks!
Food is pretty good.  Service is so so so slow.... almost feel like you have been held hostage by hostess.  Price is reasonable. Portions are actually too big.

Service was terrible, we sat at the bar but were basically ignored, we left after an appetizer and two drinks, really annoying, food is good but give me a break, too many options for great Italian in Vegas to put up with that

This is a very nice hang, catering to a very middle-America crowd.  Points for lovely design, friendly service, and Strip-central location.   Review based on bar service only.  I had a very nice time at the Martorano's bar last night. Very friendly, knowledgable service. Nice lighting and not too Crowded (Wednesday evening after ten).   I had a house-specialty cocktail called "Angel" -an upscale twist on a margarita. Sweet, but I knew that going into it. Followed by a glass of Pinot -Grigio.   And here's the thing: I was so distracted by the wine glasses, that I almost forgot about the beverage. Rarely have I heard a wine glass ring so beautifully. It was like an alcoholic Tibetan singing bowl. Truly marvelous.   But the wine: eh..the selection was pretty average -same with beers and whiskys.  The house cocktails are pretty standard for the Strip - as were the prices. Three beverages came to $42 +tip.  And here's the other thing: I love Italian food, and spent many years in Boston's North End - the traditionally Italian part of town. Even the best pasta dish is inexpensive to make, and should not be flamboyant. Simple good food made from fresh ingredient is what it is all about.   Martorano's is "production Italian". More emphasis on presentation than is necessary for such a simple cuisine - with prices to match. The gullible are easy to impress. But again, pretty normal for The Strip. I'll go back for the hang, and the singing wine glasses. Probably go light  on the food.

First time and it was very presentable. Had reservations in advance. Waited about 15 minutes because we were early. The menu is right in front and you can scroll through it to see what goodies you would like to eat. When you get seated they have an electronic presentation the waiter does with wine etc... They bring out the fresh baked house bread and several dips for it. We had the big Meatball, which was excellent. Ordered Linguine & the fried Lobster tail. The risotto was the best so far I have eaten. The experience was the BEST! I will be back for more of that. Dessert & everything was the ALL Delicious!! The flat screen tvs were all over, no sound. I heard there is a DJ on the weekend and the floor turns in to dancing which was not the night we were there. It was a good experience. Lots of food that it is ridiculous. But we ordered a lot of food!! I wish they had sample platters for sale!! Guess I will have to eat here again to try the other dishes. Very upscale in price so please see the menu. Ambiance, presentation, food display, employees on top of their game were all Excellent!!

Great food and awesome atmosphere. I had the chicken with peppers and mushrooms and it was great. The bartender picked a great wine to go with it. I loved the fact the Gm Jeff came by to introduce himself. Definitely will come back next time I'm in LV. (It also doesn't hurt when you're favorite movie is playing in the background, Casino!)

Now aside from homemade spaghetti and meat balls at home and a pizza from our favorite pizza parlor,  I'm not much for Italian cuisine. That being said, while staying at the hotel my wife and I decided to give Martorano's a try as an alternative to our usual steak house, seafood, and buffet dining. We had a bad experience, first they gave us probably the worst table in the house, right at the restaurant entrance so parties waiting for their table were standing right over our table. Ok we didn't let that bother us to much. Now the food. My wife ordered the Linguine in white clam sauce, what she got was Linguine soaking in olive oil that taste a little rancid. Neither of us could eat the Linguine but she did eat the clams they were ok..  I ordered the Rigatoni with Sunday gravy recommended by the server. A big chunk of roast pork that was fairly tasty but there was not enough gravy to satisfy my taste so I asked for a little more gravy, the server said he could do that for a  5 dollar cup of gravy as a side dish. ( WHAT ) I did not pay the 5 dollars simply out of principal. I could not finish my plate.   I'm not someone that makes a big deal about bad food or service ( service was ok ) in a restaurant because it makes for an uncomfortable situation for all. I just do not return.(  later that night I picked up a couple slices of pizza at JJ Boulangerie )

That's right...five stars. ..I have had a lot of carbonara Pasta in my life.   This was truly amazing.  They actually stir the egg in at the table.   The pizza my husband had was thin crust and delightful!

Im giving this restaurant 2 stars only for the food....  the loud atmosphere and the I could care less attitude from the waiter Paul because the owner wants it that way doesn't work for me.   If a customer requests COOKED  pasta and  NOT al dente pasta.... it should be cooked as requested.... it's the same as when someone requests a steak to be cooked  certain way it gets done.... pasta should be no different.    I as a paying customer don't care how the owner thinks it should be cooked.    As a local to Vegas I have to say I will be thinking twice before returning to this restaurant in the future.   Also sound is too loud.... TVs were way too loud.... We couldn't even hear the specials, neither could the waiter hear our order. Again was told the owner likes it that way.    I don't think as a family we should be shouting across the table so we can hear each other.

Cafe Martorano's is absolutely delicious! We are locals, and we like to go there every few months (locals get a discount with a player's card, btw). Every meal has been fantastic; everything is fresh and flavorful. We try something different each visit and have not been disappointed. It is worth the trip! If you go around opening time, it's not as busy or loud. Later in the evening it turns into a club, I think, so that's a little weird. Can't wait to go back!!!

The ambiance is alright..it is not a romantic place.  I went on NYE with a few friends and we were told going in it is a $50 minimum per person.  we thought, well, it's like 40 bucks a plate so with a bottle of wine and all we should be good.    we had a good waiter, was timely with service.  4 of us got the special which was a chilean sea bass with lemon butter sauce and one had the veal.  the chilean sea bass was ok...because it was an oily fish to begin with, putting on a cream lemon butter sauce made it a little too heavy.  the risoto was a little too rich, but the spinach was good.  i usually like my bass roasted or steamed, this was good but it was a little too much.  the portions were huge.  my friend said that pasta was a little under cooked.  i think he liked the veal though because they finished it.    at the end of the day, don't expect cheap stuff at vegas.  this restaurant is not a lovey dovey place but more for just friends hanging out.  there are better restaurants on the strip though, so this could b a second or third choice if other choices are unavailable...

After scrolling through yelp reviews, this place sure seems hit or miss, but after getting a raving review from a friend we decided to take the gamble. Let me tell you, it sure paid off. I'm still drooling over my dinner last night.   Let me begin by saying the this restaurant has a modern, club like feel. Blue lights, disco balls, sleek bar....and REALLY loud music (I could have done without the last part. The music was so loud I could not hear own waiter and make it difficult to sustain conversation. On the upside, they were playing my jams so I spent most of the time lip singing in my seat as I waiting for my food).   They provided us with a small complimentary portion of pate on toasted sliced bread. I couldn't hear the waiter, so I can't tell you what is was exactly...whatever it was, it was delicious. Complimentary bread was left on the table with olive oil, cheese and some kind of oil based chili sauce for dipping. I live a gluten free life style and unfortunately they do not offer gluten free bread. (They do however offer gluten free pasta.)  As for my meal, I started with an EXTRA dirty martini which was on point. Props to the bartender. For dinner I ordered the pork chop which was one of the chef specials for the evening. I highly recommend, it was HUGE, perfectly seared and seasoned sitting upon a bed of cooked greens with the most delicious peppers which added the perfect amount of a kick.   I definitely recommend this place, I left stuffed and oh so satisfied.

Seven Stars guest--arrived 10 minutes early--told us we had to wait because the waiter was not available (since when is that the customer's fault?) --asked for another open table--was told the waiter at that table was waiting for a party of 10 and couldn't seat us until that group arrived..wow---decided to wait for the first waiter to become available -even though there were many open tables-finally were seated--waited 15 minutes--no water, no bread, no excuse me I'll be with you in a minute--no nothing---told my fiancé that if no one came our table within one more minute we were going to leave-and we did-went to Mon Ami Gabi--and loved it

Got a recommendation from a friend to come here for their al dente pasta and great calamari appetizer.  Went with my boyfriend and took my younger brother here too.  The service is great, beautiful restaurant.  The menu even lights up with the open it which really helps since it is a low lit place.  When the food comes out, it is served to you, which is nice, but I like to take pictures of it before it is served, so it kinda messed up their flow.  I felt bad, but I needed pictures....to post on yelp of course! :)  The server was nice, but he pushed too hard on a good review.  He saw I was looking at yelp and asked if i was going to do a review.  i said yes, and he asked if he was going to get 5 stars.  To be polite, I said yes.  The push of a good review was a turn off.  The food was just okay....not much flavor and not good textures.

I had dinner at the bar last night. I had chicken Sicilian and it was delicious. In my view, it was a large serving. I did noticed that the couple next to me ordered appetizers,  the appetizers seemed exquisite. It is pricey, but the quality of the food is well worth it. Exceptional service from everybody.
The food was excellent and the servers were great. Ray and Francisco were our servers and they were so attentive and prompt with everything. We really enjoyed it and we will be back!

This is probably as good as it gets in the Rio. The meatball appetizer here is delicious...I would come back for more! You get one huge meatball, but it's good to share since the entree portions here are huge. I had the chicken marsala which came with like 4 large pieces of chicken that could feed 2 people! The chicken was moist and cooked perfectly, but the marsala sauce was a bit too salty. Most of their dishes also come with either a side of gnocchi or risotto. I had the gnocchi, which wasn't that great. I also tried some of the chicken parmesan, which was pretty good...I guess you can't go wrong with their marinara sauce.

We came here with a small group.  Our reservations were early since we were seeing a show at the hotel.  They were very patient with us as we had some guests arrive late, but still got us out in time to see our show.    The salads are big.  One ceasar was enough to feed 2+ people.  The entrees are also big enough to share, and the appetizers are easily a meal.  My hubby and I shared a pasta dish with pork.  It was excellent.  We would definitely go back.

Classic American Italian made to perfection. It seems like it all starts with the ingredients here; the house made mozzarella and ricotta were delicious. You can absolutely taste the difference in these dishes compared to any other Italian food you're used to. We started with the shrimp scampi appetizer that out server plated for the two of us to split. The scampi sauce was awesome. I got the bucatini and meatballs and enjoyed every aspect of the dish. The "gravy" was simple and delicious, perfect al dents pasta, extremely flavorful meatball, and the final perfect element: that dollop of ricotta.  Aside from the food, the service and atmosphere were also worth the 5 stars! Our server was super attentive, excited to tell us about the food, answer any questions and made a great wine recommendation. (It was their brand that they sell at the restaurants and online which we'll be ordering very soon!). We loved the fun super club atmosphere and you go in looking forward to enjoying this unique fun experience.  My only tip for them would be to make sure the hours are advertised consistently. I went to check out some other yelp reviews while we were dining and noticed it said the location was closed. Spread the word that it's open late & has awesome late night full dinner service!  Will recommend to friends that visit Vegas and return to this spot when I'm back!

Italian food the way it's supposed to be ! True, genuine Italian with only the freshest ingredients, including homemade mozzarella and they are NOT shy with portions !  Owner Steve Martorano is a culinary genius with a huge celebrity fan base. I was lucky enough to score one of his first edition autographed books while dining there. The ambiance is elegant and tasteful and the menu has a wide variety of culinary treats that anyone can find something they will love. I started with the eggplant stack that was simply rediculous ! HUGE slices of eggplant, mozzarella and tomatoe and moved on to the veal cutlet which is brought in fresh from local farmers. It was so tender I never bothered with the knife. The service was excellent and staff was attentive and helpful. This is not a place to go if you are looking for Pizza Hut quality food or price, so be prepared to pay for what you get but all in all I will be dning there again as soon as possible.

Our server Bryce and Edgar did amazing job tonight as a host. We were not planning to visit here for our dinner but we were extremely pleasantly surprised. I would really recommend here for dinner their lobster with lemon sauce was great.

I can't remember the last time I had Italian food this good! The meatball salad and the eggplant stack are the best appetizers on the menu and are great for sharing. They  advertise having the best chicken parmigiana in Las Vegas and I think they are right! The lasagna was also great. Mark, our server did an outstanding job and made the night that much better. Unfortunately, we never made it to desert, we were way to full. I will definitely return on my next visit.
Our severs Raymond and Francisco were excellent and so was our food. Chicken Downtown was fantastic.

My husband and I were told to have Italian here.. we were on miracle mile.. rt outside the mall a short walk in flats of course to Paris straight through the the cobble stone walkway  Didn't need to wait to be seated at 8:30 hostess gave us out on perimeter dining  Service was not over top but pretty good  Bread was somewhat ignored  Water was on spot! Drinks, order, food, presentation were all very good. Willing to fetch anything we needed didn't anticipate my needs..but still adequate. Linen, nice glass wear and flatware. Our food which I don't recall with all the talking and drinking and more drinking was pretty damn tasty  It was good. Experience given was very nice  Bill was what was expected $$$ Overall I'd do again

Stopped in to have a cocktail for the first time. Sat at the bar as I am apt to do and was glad that I did. Nathan, the bartender, was a true professional. My martini was made just to my liking. I ordered the special, Bolenese. It was fresh and delicious. I requested a glass of wine and Nathan's recommendation was spot on. I will definitely be back again.

Martorano's is a unique Italian restaurant. The 4 star is based on "No Ravioli", which was the most incredible Italian dish I have ever had!  We were there a couple of months ago, and looked forward to it again.  It can be noisy, but it is clean and a great Restaurant. We too love the "eggplant stack", that someone else recommended. I had the lasagna trying to get close to the Ravioli's, and it too was amazing.   Please put the Ravioli on the permanent menu.

The food was good but overpriced and overshadowed by the ridiculous in-your-face music and television show. Even the girls in scandalous outfits and guys hanging out at the bar just looked uncomfortable here, like they weren't sure what they were supposed to DO.  The design concept is totally off the mark, and I doubt this place will be open much longer.

If you e ever been to the restaurant in Florida, then don't go here. Will totally be disappointed!  My husband and I started w the meatball n salad app. Which was made for one!! Super small, not enough to share! Sauce was great! Meatball? Eh.. The theme of the restaurant seemed a bit watered down, especially w the wait staff wearing "yo cuz" shirts. One word of advice, "yo Steve, do us real fans of yours a favor. Get your ASS to VEGAS  and tell those Fu-ers at Cesears To let you do your thing.
First time at this restaraunt. Great service and great food. Must try meatball salad. Portions very large and can be shared. Little pricey but worth it.

Cant modify the dishes what so ever, maybe i don't know Italian food but i wouldn't eat here again. I asked for a salad and asked if i could have the dressing on the side cus i hate heavy dressing on my salads.. I was told no that they couldnt modify anything. Came with a crowd of five people hungry and left hungry. No one finished their plate of food and the bill was 300$ There are so many places to eat, dont think its necessary to even try... Staff is friendly but thats about it.

Great place. Great food! Calamari Martorano special is excellent for appetizer. You must have an appetizer before your main course because great food must be prepared from scratch, so waiting is a must. If you are in a hurry I do suggest eating at McDonald's. Please no substitute in the chefs dishes, let it be. Everything is prepared old school traditional family recipes.

We ate at the bar because we didn't call ahead for reservations.  I'm glad we did.  Jeremy, our server, was great.  Made good recommendations, had jokes all night and made it a pleasant experience. By way of food, I started with calamari and then had a seafood pasta special.  I thought all of the food was phenomenal.

My husband and I went here for our 8th wedding anniversary after seeing the Rat Pack show at the Rio. It was seriously the BEST lasagna I have EVER had! And they had a great selection of delicious appetizers and desserts as well. It is a more modern atmosphere with "club" type music playing but that didn't bother us, we were still able to have a discussion. Due to the music it may not be the best choice for older couples (60+) but I hear they play more Rat Pack type music earlier in the evening so that would be nice to try! We went at 845pm. I saw they were preparing to open one at Paris on the Strip and can't wait to visit that one as well!

So I came here on Thursday night this week, no reservation. The hostess was very nice and I got seated in 5 minutes, and dress warm in summer, this place is like a meat locker at this time of night around 8:30 p.m. The hostess was wearing a wrap around sweater too keep warm. Now the food, the House made mozzarella and tomato with basil and balsamic reduction salad, this salad was just average. The mozzarella was tough, seemed like not their best attempt at this salad course. The entree was Chicken Marsala and it was huge in portion size, the chicken was over cooked, the sauce and mushrooms were very good, too bad the chicken ruined it. I ordered a side of vegetable risotto and it was a good choice. The house wine selection Pinot Grigio was very good named after the owners vineyard. The Coffee and Tiaramisu were the highlight of the meal. Brenda my server was vety nice and attentive, she is actually the reason this was not 2 stars for the review. Probably will not go back, the town has far better Italian restaurant choices than this one. I wish only the food was as impressive as the wine cellar.
Yo Cuz!! Because you have to!! Four days in LV eating in the "well known chef's hubs" and THIS place rocked it!!!

I have no complaints about this place at all.  Prior to leaving my review I read through the alot of the others and I have to say that my experience was totally different.  We happened upon the resturant after making plans to see Penn & Teller at the RIO.  Since we were headed to the RIO we decided to eat at one of the resturants inside.  After reading a short description of each in a Vegas information magazine, my wife and I chose Martorano's.    For some reason the catalog said that we didn't need reservations but it was wrong.  When we got to the resturant we had to sit in the bar as a result of my mistake.  The bar was dark and romantic and there were several tv's one of which was showing CASINO and another showing clips of the resturant's namesake Steve Martotano on different tv shows.  We didn't have to wait long at all for our food and for once didn't have even a little buyers remorse about the money we spent to eat.  Great resturant.

Went here for a staff dinner one night. We ordered a couple of meatballs to share. DEFINITELY try the meatballs. They are FANTASTIC! The evening we were there they had a Chilean Sea Bass special. It was melt in your mouth tender. Those of us that ordered the special just about licked our plates clean. Place is a bit pricey... but hey, you're in Vegas!!
Great place to celebrate a birthday! Food was wonderful, service was excellent. I will definitely be coming back!

I was in Vegas this past weekend and had dinner at Martorano's Paris and it was ABSOLUTELY GREAT!!! I had the most delicious sea bass that melted in your mouth in the most wonderful white wine sauce, I mean gravy.  Steve was around and I the pleasure to meet him, he is a super nice guy, down to earth I thought that was so refreshing. I LOVED this place and would go again every time I'm in Vegas!

Stopped in for a quick snack at 5:45 and they got us in without reservations. We sat down and ordered drinks and the meatball salad. Was excellent!  Bread and olive oils/butter served as well. Finished eating and were on our way by 6:15.

Came to this place with some family friends for our pre Penn & Teller dinner. Just made sense to do the dinner at the same hotel as the show. And yes this is the restaurant with that cheesy ad (as seen on Tropicana) with the Italian guy (that looks like Pit Bull) and the sexy woman in the background who can't resist the "Italian". We didn't realize we had ACTUALLY dined at the place with the horrific ad until post dinner.   Disclaimer: There's a little bit of cheesiness involved in dining here 1) Loud opera style music is playing.  2) Yes there are about six flat screens (estimation) staggered around the dining room. three flat screens were on the wall behind me.   But the food makes up for the cheesiness (if you can get past it). Server was mindful and the busers kept the table clean. Warm rosemary infused bread served with a trio of dipping oils. The extra virgin olive oil was very good. We got some version of a deconstructed caprese with balsamic gastric. Loved the fried basil they gave us with it. They devote a whole portion of their menu to a mozzarella bar. The mozzarella in our caprese was the best that I have ever had. Generally I would say the menu isn't all that revolutionary....lots of fried options and the portions are alot bigger than celeb chef run restaurants (like B&B in the Venetian). I ordered the bucatini all' amatriciana which was perfectly al dente and right on point sauce wise.   For dessert we got bananas foster with waffles and tiramisu. Both were good but oh my god the bananas fosters with waffles sounded disgusting to me (on the menu) but it tasted really good. By the time I got around to taking a bite of it (we were doing family style among the whole table for dessert) the waffles was soaked with the butter from the caramel of the bananas foster. It was like a waffle with seven layers of butter!

Great service, go between 4:30-8p the music isn't blaring so you can have a nice meal. Beware the waiters are great sales people so keep that in mind when asking for suggestions from them. Hands down the BEST MEATBALLS ever. Penne in Vodka sauce was a bit dry but the chicken parm was everything ! Overall delicious food, pricey but that is what is to be expected from a strip restaurant.

I dined in with my gf on a whim at around 8pm on a Monday night and most certainly regret it. We we definitely not dressed in the typical business casual/business professional attire like the rest of the customers were. I was in jeans, t-shirt, and baseball hat. My girlfriend was in a hoodie and jeans. And let me tell you, our waitress definitely treated us as if we didnt belong there. She glazed through the menu and the specials for us and asked us for our drink orders. We ordered some martinis off their featured list. 10 min later our drinks arrived and she arrived to take our orders.  We decided to do the tasting menu they had available so we could try a couple different things. The Caprese salad came out relatively quick. We both really enjoyed it. It was flavorful and plentiful. Now came the really annoying part. We sat at our table for over 25 min before our entrees came out. The entire time without even a check back from our waitress to see how we were doing. We could see the server station from our table and watched her just sit there talking with other servers and cooks. I got the penne with broccoli and she got the Ziti. My pasta was horrible, no flavor at all. If I wanted pasta with light butter I would have made it at home and saved the $17. The Ziti was much better than my pasta, it had good flavor but was way over portioned with the peppers. I will re-state that even up to this point we still had not seen our server again. There was another waiter (not a waiters assistant) that had to stop and get us refills and check if we were ok. It wasnt until 15min after we had finished with our entrees that she finally came back over and asked us which dessert we wanted to get.   We ordered the canoli. They were decent but you could tell they were not fresh and the outer part was way too hard and slightly stale.   Overall the service was definitely the part that completely ruined my experience at that place. Just because I wasnt dressed in my business attire, does not mean we should have been treated any different than those who were. I will never go back and definitely never recommend this place to anyone.
Very authentic Italian food.   You cannot change anything on the menu  which was a bit annoying but understandable once the food came out.   The pasta was al Dente and so delicious.

Review for dinner, 9:30 pm Saturday 12/12. Reservation made through Open Table. I can't stress enough how wonderful an experience we had at Martorano's this evening. Server Paul went absolutely above and beyond our expectations. My wife and I chose to share an app, entree, and two sides. Paul did us the favor of splitting our order tableside and even served us for an extra personal touch. He couldn't have been more personable, attentive, helpful, and funny.   The food we orders was incredible. The fresh mozzarella and cherry tomatoes with evoo, sea salt, and a 25yr balsamic reduction came out first, and let me tell you, coming from someone who use to sell fine cheese, this mozz was top notch. The 16oz NY Strip was a perfect medium rare, and the blistered shishito peppers were the perfect compliment. The sautéed greens were cooked perfectly as well, and the risotto may be one of the best I've had.   Note to potential diners, on Friday and Saturday they have a DJ performing in house. Great mix, but can be loud in the main dining hall if that's not your thing.   Bonus points for Rocky playing on the tv's in the dining room :-)

The location in Hollywood, Fl is absolutely amazing, this location however was very disappointing.  I made such a fuss about this restaurant to my husband that we made it a point to go to the Rio so he can taste the great food for himself.  Well, after trying to get ahold of someone all day to make reservations, we decided to make the trip anyways.  When we got there at 5:30PM they stated it was overbooked.  We had to sit at the bar where the Bartender rushed us in and rushed us out.  She literally gave someone our seat while we were still sitting there.  We had appetizers which the bartender served our plates between my husband and I...  WTH what if I wanted more meatballs than him?  Leave the plate there and we'll serve ourselves, thank you very much.  Anyways, the food was okay but the portion size was disappointing. As stated above the Hollywood FL location ROCKS!  Skip this location at the Rio in Las Vegas.

What an awesome place to take a date and enjoy top-notch food & service. We have NOTHING like this in Central Oregon. Our server was stellar in his delivery of the nightly specials...enough that we were sold on two of them. We ordered the Roasted Chicken & Chicken meatball Fusulli, and she had the NY Pizziole (NY topped with fresh herbs & house made mozzerella) OMG...the portions were grande & the food quality? truly amazing... With a waiter recommended glass of red, to go with the meal? This was a great dining experience.  The owner Steve was present 1/2 way through our meal, manning the DJ booth just a hairs split from the open kitchen.  What a cool place, If you dont like "loud"...this I will not recommend to you. If you wish to feel like a Queen & KIng while in Rio/Vegas...this is a Top option. I will return later to update more of OUR experience here, later as Im short on time. Namaste~

Food was excellent. Had the Spaghetti Pescatore.  Music was horrible.  LOUD disco music in an Italian restaurant?!? Strobe lights?!?  Will not go back unless the music changes or better yet goes away completely.

Ok in June my wife and I went there and after waiting almost 45 minutes for our dinner we left because the service sucked.   We when back this trip in sept and unfortunately had the dinner. Horrible and over priced.   The pasta dishes we over salted and just bad. We asked if we could have one of the dishes without hot pepper and were told NO, the chef and owner refuses to accommodate. Well this chef can go F himself. I'll never go back and I would tell everyone else much better places to go in Vega.

Recently in Las Vegas with my husband. Decided to try Martorano's before going to a show. Wise decision. The wait staff was attentive and the food was exceptional. We shared a caprese salad of homemade mozzarella. Delicious ! When one of the staff noticed how much I was enjoying the balsamic vinaigrette, he brought me more. For the main course I had an Italian sausage pasta and my husband had a traditional Chicken Parmigiana. We ended with tiramisu. A very pleasant dinner.
Ate here last night...  NOT IMPRESSED  Food was mediocre, nothing to write home about.  Found that for Italian food, price was a bit high. And the entree I ordered was not served with a pasta.
I just called on 11/24/15 and the reservations operator said this location in the RIO is permanently CLOSED.  RIO LOCATION IS CLOSED!!!  The Paris Hotel Vegas location is open now.
Meatball? Second only to Raos. House Salad - esquisit. Seafood Linguini? - You CANNOT go wrong.   Enjoy!!!

Rating: 0/5 Date of visit: 5/23/08  We went to Cafe Martorano based on rave reviews from one member of our party (there were 5 of us) who had been there previously. The experience we had was awful. It should also be said that my friend (the one who had been there before) agreed that the experience was awful and the polar opposite of what had happened the last time she came. I have joined Yelp specifically to post this review and hopefully save people from an expensive and altogether disappointing experience. You would be better served spending a similar amount of money at any of the top-class restaurants on the Strip. One big red flag went up when I saw the chef-owner had written on the menu (and I quote):   "Absolutely no changes or substitutions.  This is how I cook.  Please enjoy and don't break my balls!"  I don't enjoy references to testicles on my dining menu.   -Initially, they made us wait about 10 minutes for a table. Not bad--until we realized the dining room was empty. Why make the party wait? Another red flag that something was wrong when on a Friday night, there was almost no business.    -We were invited to wait by the bar, but did not want to have a drink until we sat down--at which point the bartender asked us if we thought we were "too good for his bar." As a customer, I don't appreciate being questioned as to why I want or don't want a drink.   -Upon sitting down, we were asked if we wanted "sparkling or flat" water--and wanted flat (or rather, TAP water), not realizing we were buying ourselves bottles of water. Later, the waiter sounded irritated when we asked for tap water, although he did give it to us.   -We were never offered drinks or dessert. Luckily, by the time we got to dessert, all we wanted to do was get out of there.   -The wait staff never really checked on us (aside from the one time they refilled our water. when they did come over, they made some snide comment to one of the people in our group. Wait staff was incredibly rude. I guess our first waiter's shift must have ended in the middle of our meal; he just disappeared. I understand that he had to leave, but in most (good) restaurants I have been in, the waiter will at least let you know that they are leaving and someone else wiil be taking care of you. We only realized it when at the end a different waiter brought us our check. (We were not "checked on" frequently--or really, at all--as in other establishments.) Customer service is obviously not their forte here. They could take a cue from the bartenders at the casino floor bar downstairs. (At the casino bar, we had wonderful--and fun!--bartenders.)   -The prices are exorbitant. I understand that in certain fine dining restaurants, you expect to pay significantly more...however, $23 for one shrimp appetizer? That only serves ONE person (according to our waiter.) We would have needed to purchase 5 appetizers (or, $115 in appetizers) to have enough of ONE appetizer for everyone at the table. Maybe I'm wrong, but this is what the waiter told us. I have dined in many fine restaurants all over the world and have yet to feel that I've been so ripped off as I was in this restaurant. Needless to say, we skipped the appetizers.   -and, for these prices (heck, for McDonald's prices) the service is severely lacking. I hope this point is getting across.   -and it is, as most people have pointed out, very loud. I liked the music, but it pretty much killed any dinner conversation. Screaming across the dinner table is no fun.   -the food is actually good, but given everything else that was going on, it was difficult to focus on that. i enjoyed my perciatelli ($23) which was maybe a touch salty but overall tasty with the pancetta.    -The kicker: we gave a straight 15% tip because of the poor service--no extras there. They honestly deserved no tip, but in principle our group didn't think that was right. Imagine the shock when my friend who charged the meal checked her online statement and found that they ADDED an extra 5% to the tip--totaling approximately 20% gratuity--despite what she had written as the tip and signed on the receipt. She is complaining to her credit card company today to get the additional charge reversed.   Bottom line: Stay far, far away. Food is decent, but given the complete lack of service and high prices, you can get a much better experience at other restaurants. Hopefully the Rio management wises up and realized that either this restaurant needs to get more customer-friendly or it needs to be replaced. Hope this helps.

I love the meatballs but hate the dining atmosphere here.  It's loud with music and movies etc.  Just a different vibe and not for me so I always order food to-go.  Meatballs 5/5 The meatballs are about as big as a tennis ball and super delicious!!

The best meatballs on the planet. Period. The meatball with salad option also comes with ricotta cheese and bread... might just be the best meal you will ever eat. I don't care how loud the movie playing is, I don't care how loud the music is... When I am eating this meal, nothing else matters. I'm in heaven.  I have told friends about this and they say " I don't even like meatballs and if I did, I would want them with spaghetti"  I just order for them and when it gets to the table and they start eating it.... They convert right away. So even if having a meatball with a salad sounds terrible to you... Try it. You will love it.  Just a note... If not all then 99% of the 1 star reviews are from jack-off people that are upset the restaurant won't make changes to dishes to make them happy. Go to Olive Garden people ... They will do anything to accommodate you. More pepper, less salt, more sauce, no sauce, this on the side, blah blah blah. This place makes it CRYSTAL CLEAR that they will make NO CHANGES TO ANYTHING. PERIOD. I love that. Finally a place that doesn't fold to these idiots that want to have everything adjusted to them. If you want something made a certain way.. Make it at home. If you don't like MARTORANO'S policy.. AWESOME! Don't go.
OMG! Best food I've had in a long time and I have family in the restaurant business! Please open up in the Los Angeles area!

I've been to this location three times and the old one a couple. I've never had a problem with the quality of the food, it's amazing. If the place is at capacity, the service might be a little slow but that's to be expected. Some of these reviews are from some spoiled ass people that don't know anything about the biz. I'm sorry they don't customize dishes but it states it clearly on the menu! No one put a gun to your head and said eat. Maybe in old Vegas they would have. Then again they would have done us all the favor and buried your fake foodie asses in the desert afterwards.

I'm surprised by some of the bad reviews on this site! The ambiance was great. Service was wonderful... (even with no reservation).... and my Bucatini Alamtraciana' was as good as any I had while I was in Rome. The pricing was a bit high, but no worse than other nice restaurants we dined at while in Vegas (Dinner for 2 with wine & a shared appetizer $120).

It is definitely not like any other dining experience I've had cause it felt like I was in a nightclub with all the loud music and flat screens but that was where it ended.  I was with 3 other people and we weren't on any type of budget for dinner so my review is primarily about service and quality.  We got there about the same time as a large group but nonetheless that is no excuse for our entrees to take over an hour to receive.  Our appetizers came out in a timely manner and were very delicious (the meatballs do live up to their rep and the pizza was probably the best I've ever had) but our main courses were a different story.  After waiting for over 30 minutes and seeing smaller parties who ordered after us receive their food before us we were more than displeased.  We spoke to our waiter and he explained that the large group had higher priority than us (I think they just forgot our order).  Our entire dining experience took nearly 4 hours and because of our displeasure, they offered to take a few drinks off our bill.  The money wasn't the problem, it was the service.  Our waiter hardly ever checked on us and we constantly had to ask other staff when we had questions.  The only good thing I can say about this place was that they played some Biggie Smalls on the speakers and The Soprano's on the TVs.

My husband and I were pleasantly surprised by just how fresh and good the food was. We normally go outside of whatever hotel we staying in but very glad we checked this place out for dinner before our show.   The portions are quite generous, enough to share. My husband had already eaten a heavy snack just an hour before our arrival.  Even though I'm an eater, I really needed his help with the Parmesan chicken, mozzarella & tomatoes and sautéed spinach. Our server Luis was excellent. Will definitely return here for dinner next time we're in Vegas.

We ate here while showing a friend around the Paris Hotel and we thought we'd be in for some incredible food after hearing all the waiter had to tell us. We were prepared to be blown away by amazing food. It it fell short. I like my pasta al dente but this was just too undercooked almost to the point of being crunchy. The sauce was just ok and so was the meatball. The ricotta was really good. The guys that ordered the veal and chicken parm didn't have any gripes but weren't blown away either. I think if you set people up for greatness as the staff does, then you should deliver. That didn't happen. The mozzarella appetizer was good but not over the top delicious as promised. It was just eh....  I come from a long line of great Italian cooks, especially my Dad, and this stuff just can't touch any of their stuff.
Was part of a large group here on Saturday, The food was very good, the wine was very good, but the place was really loud.   Very Trendy restaurant, but thankfully the food lived up to the hype.

Nice location and atmosphere,  but that's it!! The server we had was unhelpful and messed up the bill three times and still didn't get it righ. A couple of us had the salad and couldn't eat it as it was all vinegar,  them came the worse pasta clam dish ever. Also the pricing is outrageous...this was not a good experience

Over hyped, over priced, lousy service and UNDERCOOKED chicken Parmesan - we stopped in here after a show and were very disappointed   The topper was RAW chicken served - saw the previous post on the veal and agree - average cut over breaded and just a glob of sauce plopped on top  Diner Beware !!!

Never have had a bad experience dining here - if you're looking for a nice Italian dining option on the Las Vegas Strip - consider Martorano's! On this visit we sat at the bar and had the terrific Nate for our server - we started off with the meatball & salad (even to share between 2 people) - you get chef's famous big meatball and nicely seasoned Italian salad, for main course we had one of the evenings specials - the You Cuz Linguini with fresh shellfish and one of our regular favorites the Penne al Vodka. We finished off with a slice of decadent cheesecake. The entrees are served family style so definitely suitable for sharing - there's not too many side offerings but I've had the sautéed greens before. They have daily specials so be sure to check on in the Ipad. Entrees range from about $28 - $50 for most. Convenient location at the Paris and since the one at the Rio has been closed - this is the spot! They are only open for dinner. Don't miss out - check it out and you'll leave happy and full! ;-)
Incredible menu, fabulous service, and a Sunday Gravy worth a second helping. We'll be back for sure.

Delicious!  Service is great to start.  I had the rigatoni with Sunday gravy and it was just right. Perfectly cooked. There s a small side of ricotta cheese you mix in to give it a bit more of luxury.

Great food. Meatball was great and succulent. Our server Mike was gregarious as they are. Fully explained the menu, the options and his delivery was personable.  Even his help Jamie was great help, helped serve our food and was attentive,  kudos to both.  Great ambience and good dacor. Only downfall was limited selection on pasta options and hostess weren't the most personable.

Martorano's is soooo good, I came here on back to back nights during my last stay in Vegas. Ask Sergio & Jason -the best waiter and bartender!  Believe the hype! You need to order the MEATBALLS with the Martorano's salad! Please, I beg you. If you're in Vegas and reading this - I'm jealous because you're much closer to heaven in your mouth than me. The salad is magnificently acidic and the meatball is perfection. The other item you must order is the FRIED MOZZARELLA because the spicy San Marzano tomato sauce is absolute crack. I'm addicted! We had these appetizers both nights. They are not light! You could fill yourself up with just the meatballs and mozzarella - you've been warned!  I had the chicken parm my first night and although delicious I couldnt finish. If i ate a quarter, I'd say that was a lot. The second night i had penne alla vodka and although delicious i also couldnt finish. You'd think I learned my lesson. I highly recommend the chicken parm. It doesnt come with pasta but note that it's a massive chicken cutlet.   Beautiful news: you can order a bowl of sunday gravy so you can soak all of your food in it before you go into your food coma. You must order the bowl when you order your food. If you order halfway through your meal it may take time before the bowl of heaven gets to your table.

This italian restaurant is located inside Paris hotel and casino. We came here for dinner one Thursday evening. We did not have a reservation but got a table without waiting. We were given a table near the bar and entrance which was busy. We tried the highly rated chicken parmigiana and spaghetti. We were pretty satisfied with the service and food. The place is located across the hotel buffet. The prices are higher compared to similar restaurants.

Very limited lunch menu, food overall was good, not the best Italian Ive had but not the worst either. When we asked for bread our waitress said they only serve bread during lunch hours..hm, ok. Im giving them only 3 stars because the experience was boring, we were the only guests at the restaurant. Probably wont go back..

I came to Martorano's with a request: seating for a party of 25, within 30 minutes. After a few escalations, we haggled it for 45 minutes, and only if my party agreed to do things "family style" - that is, order a bunch of stuff from the menu, and everyone shares. No problem! This was a great compromise, and I was so grateful they let us do this. Awesome service, both in that regard and once we were all seated. All of our servers were attentive, kept the wine flowing, and were able to talk in an educated way about the food that was being served to us.  There were a couple of pain points though. First, while they wanted us to do family style, they didn't have a policy in place for it. We actually just had to order 3-5 of each menu item, and pay the same price. Not quite what we expected (the manager led me to believe there was a specific family style menu). Second, the food is just fine, but some of it just isn't worth the cost. $30+ spaghetti? It's good, but not quite that good. No one at all in our party liked the  Linguine in White Clam Sauce.  I'd recommend the veal, meatballs, and calamari bibzy. And making a reservation for large parties ;)

Hands down the best meal I've had in Vegas in my life. I not only love this place but I've been here 8 times. Everything was perfect. Literally. From the amazing food to the amazing service to the amazing bar to the amazing prices to the amazing location. I can't say enough about this meal! One love cuz, one love.

Our server Paul is the man. He took the restaurant experience to the next level. When you get details about the history, about the mozzarella being made fresh daily, the can't miss meatballs, and his favorites...you are set up for success.   The caprese salad is bomb. Fresh mozzarella, tomato, crispy basil and aged balsamic. Yes. Get it. That was probably my favorite.   The meatball is 1 big meatball with a side of a tasty salad. Paul split the meatball for us and some salad, awaited our joy, and we let him know he was right - it's tasty. I wouldn't say the hype is THAT accurate, but it is a nice app. The salad it comes with is a little higher on vinegar which is a nice cut to the meatiness of the dish.   We also split the spaghetti pescatore - aka seafood spaghetti in a tomato sauce. The pasta here is cooked al dente (firm) and this is how I'm used to eating pasta so I was super happy about it. If you're used to a more cooked pasta, don't be shocked.   It was too much food. We were both like a package of crescent rolls - a second away from popping. If you're sharing, I'd recommend 1 app and 1 entree. Or 3 apps.   It's vegas, so somehow this wasn't weird, but they have a dj and disco ball scenario going on in the restaurant. It threw me off because the food quality and service is more upscale, and then you have club music in the background. It didn't detract for us just a talking point. Another, don't be surprised, thing.   I know I already preached about Paul, but I can't say enough good things about him. He's full of fun facts, is super likeable, and at the end you want to invite him to join your table.   Good food, great service, dinner for two around $120 (2 apps, 1 entree, 2 glasses of wine).

Ohhhhh man, I don't even know where to start with this delicious experience! My best friend and her family make it a tradition to come to Martorano's every time they are in Vegas and this time, I was the lucky guest that got to learn WHY they love this place so much! I'm not sure why they only have 3.5 stars because I thought it was absolutely incredible from beginning to end and left the most full that i've ever been. HIGHLIGHT: The menus LIGHT UP so that you can see what you're reading! I've never seen this before and it is such a cool concept! :)   We ordered a delicious bottle of Malbec to start, and enjoyed it along with their family-style apps {that they dish up for you!} and soft and airy bread with parm and dipping oils. For the appetizers, we ordered their famous Meatball & Salad {a MUST! I could probably eat this for my meal}, the Eggplant Stacked made with house made mozzarella {ANOTHER MUST}, and the calamari. We were honestly full after these apps but then the REAL meal came! I ordered the Chicken Sicilian and it was so delicious. Chicken tenders, mushrooms, capers, and hot cherry peppers. Warning, it does have a kick but I love that! The entrees do not come with a side but I ordered a side of spaghetti so that I could taste their famous marinara sauce. The entrees are HUGE and if you order apps, I highly recommend splitting them. I also tried my friend's Veal Piccata and that was delish too!   All in all, a VERY great experience. Pro Tips: Order an app or two, share entrees and a few sides. This place is pricey and you don't want to be left with a ton of extra food like we were because when you're on vacation, leftovers go to waste! :)

Got to go to the VIP soft opening last night and it was everything I had hoped!! Also, took my kids but got in by 6:30, so noise wasn't a problem through dinner and they were happy to dance when the tunes started to crank. The food was really impressive--and I eat out at good places a lot!! Fresh, EVERYTHING cooked to perfection, nothing cold or even slightly overdone, and flavors were wonderful! Kids were in heaven! All the sauces were completely individual, no one note bases here, and presentations were creative without being weird. Also, wine by the glass selection was special and perfectly paired to the menu. Had a beautiful Brunello I hadn't seen since I was in Italy! Knocked it outta the park Cuz!!
Excellent.  Staff is very friendly and Jeff the GM is outstanding.  If you haven't been please go.  Great Vegas experience with amazing food!!

The veal piccata is $34.00 And the spaghetti piscatora is $38.00 Oh my the best veal piccata was the best I ever tasted....! The wine sauce was amazing...! It came with two nice pieces of veals...! And the spaghetti piscatora came with a lot of seafood...! I was surprised...! Brando was our server and the service was too good! Wow! The manger came and checked on you....! At least once was in Vegas trips...! Worth every penny!

I read many of the negative reviews and almost cancelled, but was glad I didn't. My family of 5 enjoyed good Italian food at a reasonable price. The calamari appetizer had good flavor. Our server was attentive, but not over bearing. I saw people complain about the lack of substitutions on the part of the restaurant, this is simply not true. They more than compromise, except on the 3 course fixed price menu, which is more than understandable.  My wife had the ceasar salad, which was light, but still had the sardine flavor  one would expect. Although, they do not have a children's menu, the appetizer pizza was more than enough for my 9 and 13 year old to share.  If you choose to go, be aware that this is probably not the quietest restaurant on the strip. If you don't already have a total rewards casino card, you may want to stop downstairs and pick one up as they offer about a 10% discount on most items with the card. Overall, the food was good and the price was on the lower end for Las Vegas.

I went to cafe martarano for dinner tonight and it was terrible.We waited for so long to get our food.  We had spaghetti and meatball which was bland and the noodles weren't cooked all the way so they were still crunchy. We also had the chicken Alfredo dish, it tasted salty and plain. The service was not good and it was overpriced. I will not be coming back and we have had better food at olive garden.
Been here many times and the food though expensive is awesome. Jeff and Nate were terrific and very personable. Highly recommend the short rib pasta.

The server did the best that he could given the restrictions of the menu and lack of substitutions (even with an allergy). The food is bland and overpriced. There are FAR better restaurants in Vegas to spend your money in.

Martorano's can't decide what kind of restaurant it wants to be. Its both tacky and faux elegant. Its kitchen is open yet its ingredients and prep are very basic.  Its prices are high and its quality of food is middle at best.   Steve Martorano is painted as a South Philly goon (Posters of him with "Yo Cuz!!" in large print are plastered everywhere") who somehow learned how to cook despite no formal training. You will see his book, his image, and videos of him talking about cooking during your time there. It's like walking into someone's ego. They are really selling this guy's image along with the food.  The Ego would be fine if the food matched it. Or, at the very least, justified the prices.   None of the food was bad, but it wasn't very good either and, at about $50 a person, I'm hard pressed to recommend this place when there are SO many better Italian options on the strip in the immediate vicinity.

This is a straight to the point kind of joint. The menu is the menu, no substitutions, no hold this or add that or sauce on the side. Just order and eat. That's it.   Best parts: Cadillac Margarita, strong yet tasty. Meatball, GREAT flavor. House made mozzarella, yummy. Light up menu, nice touch. Bussers were nice and efficient.   Decent parts: Everything else. Cesar salad, nothing special. Calamari, nothing special. Veal Marsala, below average. Spaghetti pescatori, lots of seafood, but just good. Gnocchi, bland.  Bad parts: Over priced, shoot em up movie playing on the tvs, no outside drinks allowed (not even cocktails from the casino bar). Not offered fresh Parmesan cheese and no salt or pepper to be found.   We would come back for meatballs at the bar but that's about it.

I love going to different restaurants when in Vegas, but a must stop is Martorano's! Never have I ate such a delicious carbonara than here! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. The staff is always friendly every time I have visited. Definitely a place to check out if you haven't!

First, I probably would never return because of the level of noise from the music.  We could not hear each other talk.  And as the night got longer the music got louder.  That is all part of the atmosphere we were told.  They do a great job of pulling off a Philly-style place, but we did not enjoy that. The food-ourparty split the meatball and salad, and the eggplant salad.  Both were wonderful, along with the warm bread.  I could have stopped there and been satisfied, but order a special for the night entree-a short rib dish-disappointed,  the flavor was not good, pasta was bland, and all was too salty.  My husband had a special-seafood dish, loved it. Others liked their choices.  My monitor was great. Service seemed good because when the staff was at our table they were attentive, but when we wanted the check and when my food came a couple minutes after the others the service was slow.  Sorry to say the music level ruined it all.

Great:  Bread Calamari Appetizer Linguini & Clams, portion too much Scallop Special, portion a little light Fried Peppers  Not so Great: Service Fusilli Pollo, portion too much  Didn't have dessert, but they looked great at other tables.  Better choices around.

Get the calamari. It's sooooo fresh and soft. You can cut them in half with a fork they are so soft. We are mostly used to frozen calamari so having fresh calamari is night and day. I would come back just for the spicy calamari. The staff is so professional and attentive. The atmosphere is great with people walking by gawking at the beautiful plates presented from this restaurant. There is a 3 course meal for 50$ or look to spend about 60-80$ per person for dinner, appetizer, sides and drinks. Also try the mini ice cream cone sampler for desert. Is casual wear for men and women but I saw people in shorts at dinner time.
Amazing food! Bryce and Rudy were fantastic servers. Highly recommended if you're in Vegas!

First off let me say that this place is delicious. For Italian fare in Vegas this place is the right place to go. I have eaten at some of the best in Vegas as well such as Nove. A restaurant should be judged on a few main categories. Food, Service, Ambiance, Uniqueness.  The reviews about the movie clips playing is just dumb. First of all, don't bring your little kids to a place like this. If you want them to eat somewhere nice then bring them to chain like Chicago Grill or McCormick or any other run of the mill fancy place that you can bring kids to. The movie clips are part of this places character and I think it is awesome to be quite honest. This is a cult classic Italian restaurant with a little bit of punch in the face too it. That is what it is going for and if you want some delicious Italian at a place out of the usual boring run of the mill fancy Italian place, this is where you go.  It seems to me the people reviewing this place poorly have no character themselves and enjoy being bored. Go somewhere boring if something different is not your idea fun.

Disappointing to say the least. This is the second time we have been here and I was left not wanting to go back. The service was decent, but the food and the price were really surprising, and not the good kind. We started off with the calamari in the chili sauce, which I think there is a photo on yelp of this dish. The calamari was fresh and so tender, but because it was breaded and then drenched in a TON of sauce, it left it mushy and overwhelming, we couldn't even finish it. Why cover it so much sauce that you completely ruin the entirety of the dish? Usually, you would find this on a place that serves old or frozen calamari, which this doesn't seem to be the case so I just don't get it. It would have been much more enjoyable with a drizzle, or little side of sauce to spoon onto your dish.   Next the entree, I ordered veal parm, which was decent but nothing spectacular. The side of spaghetti I got was remarkable, I must say, it was some of the best spaghetti I have ever had but everything else was quite lack luster and mundane. Not something I would be willing to drop another $200 bucks on. Again, value for money and while I get this is Vegas, I think so many places in touristy spots don't need to count on repeat business that they don't really care if they gouge people because someone else will be checking into the Rio (where this place is located) the next day.
We had a great time here!!! Great staff and the spaghetti and meatballs were awesome!!!  My friends really loved the sea bass but were sick afterwards...
Just amazing Italian food I had in the long time.  Perfect temperature with fresh everything.   I would recommended 100%.

Hands down the BEST restaurant in Las Vegas! From the service to the food was just simply AMAZING!  Our waiter Brandon was Top Notch! From the homemade mozzarella, eggplant, meatballs, spinach, sea bass, bread, speciality drinks..... ALL extraordinary! Spent my birthday dinner here and it was worth every single penny. Take my word for it, this is the SPOT in Vegas for the best dinner in town!

We dined at the Paris Hotel location.  I just don't get it.  The food is average at best.   The waiter and the manager were both obnoxious.  It seems to me they are all just Gordon Ramsay wannabes.  "Yo cuz".  Really?  How stupid.  Go somewhere else.
Great Place , food is as good as Ft Lauderdale the original . Every dish is amazing  Dessert is amazing

While eggplant stack was good, very Disappointed in quality of sea bass - tasted few days old.  Ambience was bad night club suck.  Bill came up $150 for two of us with only ordering a drink each which was a rip off.

I've eaten here at couple of times in the past and the food here has always been very solid. This time was no exception.  They have a weird policy not to bring out any bread until the food has been ordered.  Maybe many have left after filling up on their bread and then decided not to order.   So once we ordered our food they brought out some of the bread served with romano cheese, olive oil and a spicy oil to dip the bread in.  We started off with the bibzy fried calamari.  Tender and delicious with a sweet n spicy sauce sprinkled with sesame seeds.    I opted for the protein side of the entrees and ordered the veal piccata.  A generous portion of veal that was ohhhh so tender and delicious.  I could easily cut it with a fork, no knife needed.  The veal was sitting in a delicious sauce of wine, butter, lemon, olive oil and surrounded by tasty capers.  The meal was very filling and by the time dessert was offered I was too full to partake.  I'll definitely have to save room for some tiramisu the next time around.

Me and my home boy just had some grub. We had the ribeye cheesesteak and meatball and salad combo. The chef hooked us up with some sesame honey glazed wings.  But in all seriousness... Service was great, food was awesome, drinks were delicious. Highly recommend this place!

I made a reservation for my team dinner at Martorano's last week and we had a great experience.  All of the details were considered (including the light up menus - love!), the service was impeccable, the decor was modern, and the food was fantastic!  I started with a peach martini - perfectly mixed and quite tasty.  I shared a caesar salad and fresh burrata to start - spot on!  My entree was the penne with vodka sauce and it was sinfully good.  We shared a panna cotta with fresh berries to close out the meal and it was perfect - light and delicious. Definitely worth a visit when looking for Italian comfort food on the Strip!

The food won't disappoint. Must have: the eggplant. I don't even like eggplant - it was that good. The pasta is excellent too. Don't miss out on this celebrity magnet restaurant. It's pricey, but a good go-to spot for a nice dinner out. Go late and see Penn & Teller after their show. On a special night, you might see the restaurant's favorite: Ludacris.

What the hell is this place? Fancy looking... but with TVs all over the place. Showing movies (Leon: The Professional was on while I was dining... superb movie, but not really fancy dinner fare). The service was pretty good, but the servers had to wear a shirt that said 'Yo Cuz' on it. Ew.   I really can't get over how surreal the environment was. Just absolutely bizarre. That said, the food everyone had was pretty good. Not really worth the prices, but my calamari and veal parm were good. The cannoli for dessert was sub-par.   I guess if you're really into the Jersey Shore culture and what that while eating a not-inexpensive meal, check this place out. Otherwise steer clear.

This restaurant is located on the 2nd floor of The Rio Hotel/Casino.  The interior is a cool dim blue lighting that subtly changes to violet lighting.  I had a yellowtail snapper that was seared and excellent.  Overall, the place is pricey but with excellent service.  If you haven't won big that night or if you aren't on an company expense card, I wouldn't eat here.  If that's not the case, do check this place out.

Messed up my (simple) order and took a long time to get it right. Waiting so long for average Italian food is nothing to be impressed about.   The place has a good ambience.  That's probably the best thing.  The service was just okay, not even counting the messed up order.   The food was okay and good presentation. However, very overpriced. The pasta noodles were of good quality.  The sauce was nothing special. (I got the red "gravy" with the meatball. The meatball tasted fatty.   The Manager did come over and apologize for the mix up on my food.   No way would I take my wife here for a nice dinner. Much better places in the same price range.   It's not romantic. It's not special. It's overpriced.
Amazing food and service!!! The spaghetti al pomodoro and chicken Marsala were delicious!

I've been coming here for about 3years. During the World Series of poker there are few restaurants to eat at in the Rio. My first few times coming here (3years ago) I had an amazing experience the food and service were 5star and it was one of the things I looked forward to while staying at the dingy Rio Hotel. Anyways I ate there 2x in July. The first time just my boyfriend and I dined there and after our meal our stomachs went hay wire for 2days! We got so sick! Then we went back with another couple. Because we werent 100% sure that it was Martoranos that made us sick, but low and behold after the 4 of us went to dinner EVERYONE had horrible issues with their digestive system. I dont know if the food was spoiled or if they just over did it on the grease but we never plan on returning there. It tasted great but the after affects were not worth it. It almost makes me loose my appetite when I think about what exactly they are doing in their kitchen that made everyone so sick.

This place is great for large groups and entertaining customers on business trips... but bring your big boy credit card, cause it can cost you! Was here Monday night with a good friend and customer, and we had some sick insane food. The fried Mozzarella with the San Marzano tomatoes. The Linguine Marinara, and the Fried Lobster all killer. Make a Rez because this place gets packed and you will wait a lifetime. Definitely one of the better places to eat in the Rio.
Amazing Italian food. Service exceptional. Try the veal scallopini. Prices a little high but we'll worth it. A must if you are visiting Paris Hotel.

Outstanding meal. Venue is fun and different. Had the fried mozzarella with a home made meatball on top. Fried mozz was definitely the best I've ever had. Meatball and sauce were the bomb! Linguine and clams for my dinner- simply amazing! This is one of my favorite dishes and it was outstanding. My husband had the chicken parm with a side of gnocchi. All phenom. Would definitely recommend! #YoCuz

If I could give this restaurant a 1/2 star, I would. The service and food were less then desirable. The menu items sounded delicious, but the actual food served to me proved to fall short of that. While I have never personally met the chef, I can tell you the ladies in my neighborhood church have better gravy and better meatballs then this place.   To make matters worse, the management was completely uncompromising and pretty much ruined my best friend's birthday.   We had a moderately sized party with a special request to order two meals and appetizers separately from the rest of the group. The waiter informed us that they could not do that and that they WOULD NOT DO anything to assist. He sent a manager over and he said he could do nothing for our request, and due to the owner, appetizers could not be ordered separately from our meals. We explained to two different managers our situation and they regretfully informed us that the owner refuses to make any exceptions in how his restaurant is run. Management did nothing to accommodate, even when the situation was explained to them over and over again.   If you want good Italian food I can recommend several other places that severely beat this place. Picasso, Sinatra, Andiamo, Nove, Casa di Amore, MAGGIANOS, PIZZA ROCK, BUCA DI BEPPO...literally pick any other Italian restaurant and you will be happier.    Furthermore, if you have any business colleagues, clients, friends or family that you plan to recommend here, don't.  Steve Martorano and his restaurants will never have my business again.

Great food and awesome service. Water glass always full, waitress came back many times to check on us. Place was pretty busy.  Set us right away with our reservation. Chicken Scilian was very good and pasta was very tender.

Went for dinner. Sat at the bar Evis great and takes care of me. Starving but wanted something quick  Caesar sale fresh dressing great. Philly cheesesteak sandwich surprised me. Meat was delicious great bin. Will try and ho back before I go. Managers always seem to stop buy and ask how everything was.

Wow!! From Jeff the host who was helpful and friendly on the phone, to the hostesses when we arrived.... the bartender was spot on with drinks....Paul our server was on top of his game and he handled us RI gals pretty well lol the gentleman helping Paul was so nice as well.....food was delicious and will highly recommend!! Nice touch for the manager to stop at the table as well!!
This was our first visit to Las Vegas restaurant. We've eaten at Steve's in Ft Lauderdale. Experience was amazing and waitress Jessica was amazing. Would recommend for foodies

i wish this thing had an option to vote 0 stars because this place was a piece of shit.  The chef looks like a ghetto wrestler who should be fighting on UFC and his dishes are so unrefined, he probably NEVER went to culinary school, or else he used to be a sous chef at olive garden.  On the menu, he writes,..."This is how i cook, dont break my balls" he has got to be the most ignorant uneducated fool who got a chance to cook.  The service was mediocre, food is WAYYY overpriced. NEVER GO HERE.  The food? IT WAS TERRIBLE.  I like my pasta "al dente" but he didnt even cook his pasta.  The sauce was OK, a little salty, but i couldnt get over the pasta.  It was like biting into a straw.  This chef needs to learn how to cook pasta.  Thats foundation stuff.  He SUCKS!!!!  FOOD SUCKS, the restaurant vibe SUCKS, and i give it a big FAT ZERO.  He needs to go back to wherever the hell he came from, and maybe try cooking again after taking some high school level foods classes. ugh  ::UPDATE:: this is what the chef of this place has to say after reading a bad review of his place.  Instead of apologizing and inviting me back to redeem himself, he writes... "From    user photo Steven M. Sent  3 days ago    You obviously have no idea what flavor is.. I'm sure you are accustomed to Olive Garden type food since you seem to be a pro .. However, Cafe Martorano uses only the best quality products... Come in and show your face we will definitely give you a tour and show you products I'm sure you have never seen and with your non existing culinary background I'm sure you cant pronounce "

The very best in service but the food took very long to prepare on a slow night and it came out with little flavor.  highlight was caesar salad but price and flavor didn't match up.  Better places to go for italian.  oh yeah, bread was good but time to prepare courses meant we ate too much of it.

I'm a seasonal Las Vegas Resident, I've eaten at the best restaurants in town and I've got to say, Cafe Martorano's is one of my absolute FAVORITE restaurants in Las Vegas!!!  When I'm in town I eat here AT LEAST once a week...some of the best italian food I've ever tasted, and the service is impeccable. THE BEST Meatball in town....TO DiE FOR!!! My other favs are the Eggplant stack & the Philly Cheesesteak. SO YUMMM!!! http://thesuiteworld.com/blog/cafe-martorano-best-meatballs-italian-restaurants-vegas/

No need to look for a better Philly Cheesesteak in Las Vegas because you won't find one. The meatballs are second to none as well. However, i do like Carbone's meatballs a little better, just my opinion lol I love nothing more than Italian American cooking from South Philly it reminds me of growing up in Jersey and my grandmas Sunday gravy every weekend. Shout out to Chef Steve Martorano and his commitment to serving the highest quality ingredients and employing a top notch staff.  YO CUZ!!  Dishes I recommend: Philly Cheesesteak Meatball Salad Sunday Gravy with Macaroni   First Cut Veal Chop

To make a long story short - great everything! Great service, great menu, great drinks, great fresh daily mozzarella, great decor, great location.... and the list goes on. We had a large party of 10 and we loved where we were seated.   You know how you go to dimly lit restaurants and the older people in your party can't ever read the menu?! Welp, no problem here because the menu is digital! Fancy!   I dare say that you will not go wrong with anything you order. Everyone in my party was ecstatic with their meal and raved about it. I had the most divine braised short rib pasta! I still dream about it. The drinks are great as well.   It's well worth it. I paid for my date and I believe for the two of us ,it was only $200 with drinks. The dirty martini is excellent and I got some sort of pear basil drink that was delicious. Next time wine for sure because the gentleman sitting across from me said it was delicious with his steak. I tried both and he was absolutely right. Can't wait to go back!!
All I can say is: terrible , really bad. A simple cafeteria food with a higher price. If you can avoid it do so. Not worth it.

There are no words to describe fresh made mozzarella.  The plastic we purchase at grocery stores does not qualify for this discussion.
