After reading an article (years ago) about a woman's search for truly fresh mozzarella, I motivated to find the product of which she spoke.  I order this cheese everywhere it indicates "fresh" on the menu and until this dinner, I had not experienced this culinary bliss.  Order it before it is pulled, at which time it takes on the texture of which you are probably more familiar.  It changes the taste, you want the pre-pulled, just drained goodness.    The meal was very good and deserves more stars than I awarded.  The late seating (New Year's Eve) had us eating at 10-10:30pm, which is just too uncomfortable for me.  However, the reheated Chilean Sea Bass was stupendous.  Portion size of the fish was impressive.  It was served with risotto and saute spinach which were good but otherwise unremarkable, the fish was the star of this plate.    My low star marks evolve from the atmosphere.  Clearly this turns from restaurant to club around 10pm on most nights.  The sound system must be automatically set to turn up, way up, at this hour.  I could only nod and smile at comments made by my table mates as I could not hear them.  Given no conversation was going on other than the person seated immediately to my side, my attention often drifted to the movies showing on multiple screens.  WHAT ARE THEY THINKING?  I don't know the flick, but I watch a man get cut into pieces in a shower by mobsters.  Do I really need to go further?    For every downer, there was a counter upper.  The LOUD music was 70s-80s mostly and I will return here for a night of dancing, much preferable over the house throb everywhere else (even Stoney's plays this crap).    As for food, I'll take it to go or you can serve me in the wine cellar.  I don't want to eat in your space again.
Overpriced, average Italian in a hyped-up wise guy environment supposedly reminiscing of the old days of Phili lore.  Italian food should never cost this much.  I tried it twice, twice too many.

I love Martorano's! I have been to the Ft. Lauderdale location before and while in Vegas made a point to visit them and I was not disappointed. I love the upscale table and service, but in the fun format of large TVs, music and lights. The music was fun, but not so loud a conversation couldn't be had. The food is great. My significant others family is Italian and his grandparents were first generation Italian. The Eggplant Stack is amazing and I enjoyed the traditional dish of Meatballs. In times past, I have had the other less "traditional" dishes and each one has been awesome.  If you are looking for candle lit romance, this may not be the place, but if you want fun, candle lit romance with fabulous food and service this is THE place.

We had a horrible experience at Martorano's. Staying at the Rio, we were under the impression it was perhaps the best food available. When we arrived without a reservation we were told to return at around 8:15. The restaurant was fairly empty except for one huge party of at least 30 or more. We were bit served for ages, ignored, given the wrong food. This post is being made much later than the event.

Best meal we had in Vegas this trip. Several tables complained about the music being too loud. The response from the wait staff was that is the way the owner likes it regardless of what the customers say. Not a good response. That alone makes me doubt a return visit.

Yes...Lina And I did this up...Martoranos @ The Rio, Las Vegas.   The best Italian food, the Best Service and the coolest Ambiance......try the Meatball and Martorano salad..Chicken Marsala, pasta al dente.....huge servings, great fresh taste....just cooked my first Martorano Tomato sauce using your recipe...Thanks Steve!!!
Excellent experience. Everyone is very helpful and courteous. Seated quickly and food was very good quality, quantity, and value.

Excellent service and food was incredible.  Great atmosphere with upbeat music.  Bar was very impressive and cool!  Wine list is pretty awesome too.  The servers attire is very New York !! Highly recommend this place

Loved our first time here. Came highly recommended from a friend who grew up in Philadelphia like the owner here. Everything is fresh and delicious. Prices are very reasonable for LV. Meatball salad app and a eggplant stack app a must. Chicken Parm dinner was spot on.
We went here for dinner and enjoyed it! The carrot cake was "to die for!" The atmosphere is nice!
Great dinner and great service.  Pricing are Vegas high but overall the food and service were better than most.

Love this place and love the atmosphere here! They play movies (The Departed was on when we went) and cool music. Its dimly lit with cool purple lights. Our server was bomb! Now for the food... It was so delicious. My caeser salad was so freakn good! My fiance doesn't even eat salad and he was eating this salad. I got spaghetti with meatballs. Yummy! Their portions are huge too. Can't wait to go back!

Excellent service and scrumptious food.  Meatball and salad was perfect appetizer.   Attentive service never let my water glass go below 3/4.  And the pasta.....yum!  We ordered the bugatini and it was cooked perfectly al dente.  When in Vegas , head to Paris casino and dine here

If you are in las Vegas go to the Rio Hotel and find Cafe Martorano. It is beyond well worth it. The is quite possibly the best meal I have ever had in my life. It never gets old. I have been there every time and the food is to die for. Rumor has it The Rio paid Steve Martorano 1 Million dollars to open his famous Ft. Lauderdale eatery there. I know why.  First of all this is the coolest place to eat. The dining room is surrounded by large screen TVs playing clips from the best movies on the planet. The will have music playing then all of the sudden you hear the best lines from Pulp Fiction, Casino, The Godfather, No Country For Old Men, etc., and the whole restaurant stops eating and joins in. "Check out the big brain on Bret" exclaims Jules from Pulp Fiction. Awesome. Then comes the food. I would highly recommend tossing the menu aside and let them bring you out a sampling. Meat Balls the size of a baseball, scampi that will melt in your mouth, philly cheese steaks that are better than in Philly, and the list goes on and on. This is S. Philly Italian cooking at it's best. Don't be surprised if someone gets on their table and starts to dance, it happens. I love this place. If Steve is there, say hi, you can't miss him.

I'm actually surprised to see this restaurant has less than 5 stars. I have been in Vegas for about a week now for a convention and out of all the restaurants, this place by far had the best service. I came with 3 people and we did a tapas style dinner. We ordered a bunch of appetizers: calamari, meatballs, and mozzarella, which were all delicious! Our favorite was the calamari, which is perfect for anyone who loves spice. I was also really impressed by our server who came by and split the appetizers evenly for us. It was the right balance of quality and service.
Fantastic dining experience - the staff was spot on and the food was excellent. Try the meatball!

The ambiance was nice with blue undertone lights and disco balls. They have tvs so it is not your typical fancy Italian restaurant. They were showing sports and old movies which we enjoyed. The bread was soft but got cold fast however they make sure it's replaced quickly. Our server was nice and fairly quick with service.  The chicken parmesan was delicious and the penne vodka was simple yet tasy. Overall we enjoyed our experience.

The quality of food is barely a step above olive garden. The owner was the past house DJ at Rain and inside the restaurant are lights like in a club and the music is so loud you can't even hear the people at your table. The music was so loud people actually walked out. When we asked the owner if the music could be turned down a bit we were told "this is my joint and that's how I like it, so no I won't turn it down". A few minutes he sent over a pasta dish as an apology and the pasta was not completely cooked. The only saving grace was that our server was fantastic. You can tell he was embarrassed but his performance was fantastic. The final straw for us was when we ordered a bottle of wine and there was a bug in the decanter and our $200 bottle of wine was wasted. I give this place 1 star because I can't give it any less. Do yourself, friends and family a favor and find some place else to eat!

This is hands down one of the best restaurants in Las Vegas! The Chicken Parmesan is phenomenal with fresh mozzarella; the gnocchi are like little pillows of heaven; the meatball/salad is a must-order. Even the olive oils that accompany the bread are worth raving about.. hello red pepper infused oil. It's one of only a handful of Italian restaurants I'd ever recommend. Our server Paul & all of the staff were nice, helpful & attentive. (P.S. I'm posting from the table because it's so good you have to know now!)

Far overpriced for the quality of food.  Food was extremely salty, and for the price, did not impress me one bit. Literally one item was slapped on a plate and served, leaving you to pay an exorbitant amount for a side dish. I feel like a was a sucker to pay for food  that was just average. Even Olive Garden is better.  I will say, however that the coffee was FABULOUS, as well as the bread, which is the only reason I gave 2 stars.
Wow.   Holy Crap.  I just had the best Italian meal ever not only Vegas but anywhere .   I would give this place 6 stars if I could
Excellent Italian restaurant modeled after East Coast Italian! Bryce took very good care of us! Pasta excellent!

I'm half Italian. My Nana raised me on homemade and handmade pasta, delicious meatballs, incredible gravy, sumptuous salad. She was a spectacular cook. Although she passed on to the great kitchen in the sky, I keep her alive by cooking her recipes and enjoying many of the dishes she would make for me.  So why do I begin my review of Martoranos with that introduction?   Two words - the meatball. Italians do not order meatballs out. Your family's meatball is part of your heritage. No one else's can come close. Or that's how it is supposed to go.   Sadly, the meatball that Chef Martorano cooks puts my Nanas to shame. That is almost sacrilegious to say but there - I've said it. There's a reason this restaurant is famous for its meatball. It's AMAZING!   But I'm getting ahead of myself. Let's start with the cool decor of the blue lit bar and the plasma TVs all around the restaurant showing Classic movies or the DJ playing tunes to dine by.   We ordered the meatball and salad appetizer and were blown away by it. Our waiter also suggested the made-fresh-that-morning fried mozzarella in gravy which was out of this world.   For our main course my lady had fresh fish over risotto. Loved it. I had veal parm with peppers, onions and gravy that was phenomenal. The side of ricotta gnocchi was light and spectacular.   This was one of the best Italian meals I ever experienced. Hands down the best meal I had in Vegas in years.   Service was 5 star. The meal was 5 star. A MUST for lovers of great Italian food!

WOW!! What a hidden gem in Vegas!  We went to the Rio to go see a show, and decided to grab a bite before. We foolishly did not make reservations (I suggest that you do!) but the hostess offered us a cozy spot at the bar. Which we took.  Had a meatball appetizer, which was recommended by another patron. YES! SO delicious!! I would go back just for that! Then had the specials. One scallop dis and my partner had a sea bass dish. Both were full of flavor, tasted super fresh, and over all great dishes!  I would go back in a second!  p.s.- Locals with a T.Rewards card and NV ID get 25% off! If you are seeing a show, you get 20% with ticket stubs! What a deal for an amazing dinner!

I love the Martorano's in the Rio Hotel! I am a Steve Martorano fan, for sure!  I was excited to try this new location. My mom was in town so I thought it would be perfect!  It was not perfect, but it was really good. And I am sure once they settle into this new location it will become amazing, like we  are used to at the Rio. The food was good, although it took a really, really long time to arrive. The service was good in a awkward, trying to hard kind of way.   My mom did not lover her entree, unfortunately. So we asked for it to be boxed up, because she only ate 2 bites. Both the waiter and manager knew she did not like it, and after the long wait, If I was the manager, I would have probably comped it.   I am looking forward to going back in to have some amazing Italian food. Once the "New Restaurant" jitters are gone, and they have there Martorano's mojo going!

I have been here multiple times.   I went there this last week and I was highly disappointed. I mentioned my problem with one of our two servers.  Nothing happened.  Then I also wrote about it in the electronic comment section that comes with the bill.  Nothing so I decided to leave a review.    I will start with another patron was extremely drunk and causing problems he was in the table next to us.  It made it hard to enjoy our dinner.  Secondly, they brought me the wrong salad but they fixed that and brought me the Caesar salad I ordered. The problem is it was bad.  The lettuce had many wilted pieces in it and the croutons were mostly stale.  I usually love their Caesar salad.  I quit eating it and showed it to the servers assistant who was helping our table.  They did not do anything about it.  Our entrees were good to a point. I have to say that over all it was a bad experience.

Ok, I have to admit that I was skeptical of eating here just because of how dead it was during prime dinner hours. However, I am happy to announce that I was wrong & anyone that doesn't try this place at least once is missing out. LOL! I had been craving a good beef carpaccio for a long time and that was the 1st thing I saw on their menu. Their service is awesome(we sat at the bar,) their pours are heavy, & their food is top notch. My husband and I shared the fried mozzarella that was topped with a delicious marinara, and their creamy penne pasta that had peas, mushrooms, and chicken. YUMMMMM!! Their pastas and the rest of their dishes are all homemade. No frozen stuff here! The atmosphere was superb as well. I love the lighting. Perfect quiet spot for a cozy dinner date. We will definitely be back!

The people who gave this place bad reviews must have gone in here thinking it was a regular ol restaurant. Its not This is an experience. The food is plentiful and amazing. The owner came and talked to me and my girlfriend and sent us over a few extra plates of his choosing which were great. This place is Loud and fun. You are in Vegas! it is supposed to be different. go there know its going to be different and have a great time.

This one is a toughie. Rio is my sister's home for 6 weeks in the summer for the WSOP, so we of course frequent every restaurant there. I like the food. I really do. And the service is great. But there is something so Jersey Shore about this place. I know it is Vegas, but after 8 hours in a casino with smoke and lights and ding!ding!ding! of slot machines, I want to have a quiet dinner. Martorano's goes from Italian eatery to nightclub around 7pm when the music starts blaring and the disco balls start spinning (seriously). It just gets too loud for me. One of the guys dining with us this trip said he was waiting for them to move the tables back so we could all start dancing.   That all said, the food is great. The caprese is delicious, fresh tomatoes and mozzarella, a drizzle of balsamic and olive oil and a fried basil leaf. I love how simple and clean the flavors are. Then there is the meatball. OMG. It is so fluffy and flavorful. Served on top of some sort of tubular noodle whose name I can't recall with a fresh tasting sauce and a scoop of the best ricotta I have ever tasted. Everyone at our table ordered that or the rigatoni with Sunday pork gravy, which was also fantastic. The pork was so tender and the sauce again so fresh. You really feel like your Italian grandma made it.

I do not like rating places 5 stars because not too many things can be as goood as it gets.  But, this place is......As Good As It Gets.  The atmosphere is nice, the service great, and the food is incredible.  Yo Cuz Steve was there in person watching his crew cook up the food.  I lucked out at the seating because I could watch the events of the staff as I enjoyed the Company in my party.  The eggplant stack appetizer was pretty darn good.  The speghetti pescatori was outstanding.    The prices were not cheap but not out of this world like some of the other nearby places.  If you pay decent money, you want decent food and this was the case here.  Steve was especially busy during our time here because NFL Quarterback, Joe Montana was dining a few tables over.  But he took the time to come over and talk to us.  This was really special to one of us in our party as he is a frequent diner at his Atlantic City location.  He is one huge dude and takes his craft seriously.  It was nice meeting him.  I would highly recommend this place.  I will be back!

If you are going to Cafe Martorano make sure you are hungry. These people aren't fucking around with the portions (think Bucca di Beppo portion size but also really fuckin good!) The place is also super loud, if you go before 8pm they are usually playing some sort of gangster movie (think Scarface, Casino or Goodfellas) on all 50 of the flat screened TVs located throughout the restaurant with the sound rotating between Sinatra or Bennet and the movie during a good killing scene. Makes for some great atmosphere. As it gets later in the evening the Executive Chef Joey Martorano (who looks like he was on the Sopranos) will actually alternate his time between the kitchen and the DJ Booth spinning some hip grooves. Literally its like you are having one of the best Authentic Italian dinners at Rain or Tao, its so loud. That being said the place is really good. I am a sucker for good orchiette and bolognese. Both of these rocked. The orchiette wasn't the best I've ever had (I've been spoiled with great orchiette) but it was pretty damn good. One of my clients had the Fra Diavolo with lobster and Crab and it was divine. The last time I went we had dinner at the bar and had one of the best bar dinners I've ever had thanks to Stephanie. She was on point with everything from food descriptions to cocktails and she was super hot and busted my friends balls shamelessly when he tried to throw half ass pickup lines at her. I will definitely be back. By the way the place is not cheap by any means.
Ordered prime rib sandwich and it was good. Meat was juicy and tender and the hoggie was fresh and it came with au juice.

I loved this place!  The food was incredible. We chose the price fix menu for $39 , plus appetizers. The meatball and salad was incredible.  The main course of rigatoni and chicken was perfect, and the cannolis were fluffy and sweet and very fresh.   The Service was ok- not 5 stars, but I liked everything else in this restaurant. YES it is loud and there are strobe lights- Frank Sinatra is blaring. But this place is fun, great food, great wine list, lots of things going on - if you are celebrating something fun- this is your place- if you are looking for a quiet relaxing place - this is not for you. I cant wait to go back -- There is no food that I have tasted like this in CA or NV- you have to go to NJ to italian food this good!

My wife and I enjoyed the food, very attentive wait staff. No substitutions and Insistent on ordering everything right away, I like to get  appetizers and see how full I am before completing my order but it worked out ok.  Not inexpensive but quite enjoyable.

Had my brother's wedding reception here.  Staff was incredible!! Very helpful, kind, ready and willing to serve! Kept regular drinks filled and we're always around to get you anything you might need.  And food was amazing!!! We ordered appetizers, salads, meatballs, spaghetti, and the chicken Sicilian!! Everything tasted incredible but the the Chicken Sicilian... forget about it! It was amazing!!! Order it now! So incredibly flavorful and tart! My mouth is watering again thinking about it! Mmmmmmmmm!

This place is great !   Came in and was greeted by hostess immediately, bar / restaurant had some old Blk/Wht movies playing.  My guest was super impressed with the light board menus. Manager came by the table during my meal to thank me for business.  Great vibes just like the spot in Frt. Lauderdale.  Your going to want to grab an order of Rice Balls, Truffle Fries, Clams Casino, Tagliatelli and a Veal Parmigiana and a glass of Barolo.  Thank me later.

ughhhhhh..... Let's negate the price here because the meal was free and I'll still say, quite possibly one of the worst meals I have ever had. My chicken parmigiana tasted like something I microwaved from a Michelinas frozen dinner. On top of that, the waiter was a condescending eegit with a superiority complex. Listen to me and listen to me now, DON'T COME HERE! There are so many good Italian places in Las Vegas, that there is no need to stop at this self-righteous restaurant in The Rio. Do yourself a favor and go to Valentino in the Venetian or Rao's in Caesar's Palace.   Cheers!
Mediocre service makes for a poor experience...especially when the restaurant isn't nearly full on a Friday night in Vegas. Fails to live up to its hype.

If I could give 7 stars I would. The best Carbonara I will ever have in my life. I'm positive it will never be beat. My boss ordered chicken parmigiana with a side of spaghetti. Everything came out at the same time, at perfect temperatures and cooked to an astonishing perfection. I can't remember the name of my mixed drink, it was pear flavored, was a dream. The waitstaff was very attentive and knowledgeable without ever hovering. I highly recommend

My mother and I came here for lunch, around 11:30am. We had never been here before and wanted to try it out. We had a really cool server, and the drink I ordered was amazing. Except the fact it was kettle one, and $14. Not cool. The salad was good honestly. Then the spaghetti and meatballs came out. The meatball (yes it is just one huge meatball) and honestly, it was not that good. Anyone can simmer some tomatoes and put salt in it. I was not impressed. And it was $27 for tomato sauce. I do not plan to go back here. Ever. Save yourself money seriously.

Definitely one of the best dinning experiences I've ever had and the food was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The staff was excellent! We started on night off with the meatball salad and egg plant stack which both were so delicious. The meatball had such and amazing flavor and the egg plant was cooked perfectly. Then for our Entrée we had the carbonara and I must say it was fantastic! I highly recommend visiting this place. If you don't mind spending money on delicious food this should definitely be the go to spot!

Absolutely Awful...I just wish I would have read reviews FIRST.. I would have never have gone. SERVICE... Ridiculous. They were not even busy and they let us sit with our menus  menus closed for some time.  FOOD...so NOT good. You know how when you are eating Spaghetti  and the oil is overwhelming? Yep... That's it. Awful  Please please SAVE your MONEY. I suspect they are struggling. I wonder why? Why don't they try and listen to the customers reviews ?  Here is your chance Management... Email me and ask me to give you a full report.... I will be happy to help.

Our family had dinner at Martorano's in April, 2015. Most of the entrees were in the $25-$35 range. Two of my sisters ordered the special which was grouper. They both enjoyed it till they received their bill - $62 each! I realize they should have asked the price, but still, I think the waiter could have given them a clue.

If you are looking for a quick bite go out on the strip where quality and excellent service isn't important. Everytime I am in Vegas I eat at Martoranos because the food is excellent the service is EXCELLENT the atmosphere is excellent and if you the type that believes you get what you pay for then you will see and taste the quality you paid for! The warm Mozzarella is to die for and basically everything else on the menu. Its obvious that Mr Martorano prides himself in running a class act of a restaurant because I will NOT eat anywhere else because Chef Martorano and his staff at this location care and it shows big time!! Give it a try you wont be disappointed! All these negative reviews I think are incorrect or fraudulent regarding service and times for food delivery because NOT ONCE  in the over 20 times Ive been here have I waited more than 30 min max.

Ok, let's start with the important stuff:  Martorano's food is outstanding.  I am from South Philly (as is the owner) and I have to say that his "gravy" and meatballs were excellent.  The service was very attentive and, since I was the only one in my party, the waiter was very kind and patient - willing to answer any questions.   I started with an appetizer of Italian Meatball and Salad.  I wanted to try both - and if I did it separately, it would have required me to get a second mortgage:  $18 for the salad / $15 for the one meatball (about 1/2 pound).  Both, together, was something like $20.  And both did not disappoint - the meatball was excellent and salad fresh and very well prepared.  (I'll discuss price later.).  Next, I had the Rigatoni "Sunday Pork".  This was so good, it brought back memories of the Sunday dinner's where the pork was cooked in with the sauce ($29),  I was too full for dessert.  Now, there are two issues to be aware of:  Pricing and Ambience.  With the price, come on Chef, one meatball for $15??  Anyone from South Philly believes they have the best meatball, including me, and I readily admit yours is excellent.  But, $15??  It was a good idea to pair it with your salad, but, still, an app for $20 is pretty hefty.  The price for the Rigatoni was pretty steep as well.  I know this is Vegas, but I didn't think I would need to go back to the Wheel of Fortune slot to replenish my wallet.  Here is the biggest issue I had (which almost got me to lower to 3 stars):  With regard to the ambiance, I would consider the restaurant area to be romantic - if not for the HDTV's.  There were 3 TV's side by side.  The middle played a video made by the Chef (OK, though a little narcissistic), but the other two were showing the movie Casino!!  UNEDITED!! With subtitles!!!  Which means that, in this dimly lit, romantic room, I'm being treated with videos of blood, brutality and vile language.  Not what I would have chosen.  Really, if you want to show a video, show Italian scenes or something.  Don't show movies - it's not Chucky Cheese!

My sweetie and I had dinner here for the first time last night and were blown away by how fabulous everything was. From the atmosphere to the service (Paul is an outstanding waiter who is both friendly and knowledgeable) to the food, it was simply top notch. The Caesar salad is big enough to split and the dressing was flavorful. Both pasta dishes we had we perfectly cooked and seasoned. Wine was reasonably priced considering the quality. This place gets it right on every level. We will be back!

my wife and i have eaten at martaranos for years...and we keep going back....its simply the best italian food in las vegas... we ate at martaranos on 5/18/17 for my wifes birthday.....our waiters raymond and juanito were excellent....top service...always checking to make sure that everything was alright.....the food was superb...i am of italian heritage....my whole family is from italy....and i can verify to you that martaranos food is 100% authentic italian food.. they use the finest ingredients...and there recipes are right on the money...the restaurant itself is beautiful....well decorated...the manager mike was very cordial...making sure that our dining experience was total satisfaction...then to top it off i found out that martaranos takes off 20% from your total bill including liquor, for all local residents....awesome way to end the evening....i highly recommend to anyone that wants excellent italian food, to try martaranos...you won't be sorry......its phenomenal.......

Expensive as far as Italian food goes but damn good.  Martorano's is located in the Rio hotel and worth leaving the strip for.  The meatball appetizer was great.  People rave about it and it did not disappoint.  A huge tasty meatball with a glob of great ricotta cheese.  For a main course, I had the veal marsala.  It was a huge veal chop which was so tender and good.  The gnocchi that came with it were nice and fluffy.  And the mushroom sauce was great.    My wife had the lobster francaise which was very good as well.  The risotto that came with it was kind of salty and didn't really taste all that great though.  But overall still a good dish.  Our server was great too.  Real Italian food is worth paying for.  So I totaly recommend this place.  Also Casino playing on the TVs was fun.  And that's that.

We were staying at the Rio with friends this past weekend, and failing to have made reservations at a decent restaurant, called down to Matarano's. They made us wait a half an hour for the reservation, and when we went down to the restaurant, had us wait in the bar for another 15 minutes. The bartender was rude and we had a hard time getting drinks. We were finally shown to the dining room, which was about 25% full. Right. Things LOOKED promising at first: three separate servers came up to our table to say they were part of the "team" waiting on us. Then one waiter berated another for talking to us. We asked for a wine recommendation, and were poured an absolutlely AWFUL 2007 Chianti that, if it wasn't faulted, really should not have been on the wine list. We are NOT people who send back food or wine, but there was NO WAY we were going to drink this. We ordered a bottle of California wine that we knew was going to be good. Then it took a good 20+ minutes to get anyone to return to our table. Our "team" of waiters was no where to be seen. We finally flagged someone down to beg them for bread--which we were CHARGED for!  My BF and I split a Caesar salad (which was the best part of the dinner by a mile) but were brought no extra plates. Nice. I ordered the pork chop special, which, while cooked properly, didn't have a lot of flavor. Interestingly enough, my BF, who ordered the Red Snapper special, had the SAME salty sauce on his fish! REALLY? Our friend who ordered the Chicken Parmigiana got a piece of chicken with cheese & what appeared to be canned red sauce slapped on the plate--no pasta, no veggies, no presentation whatsoever. Our other friend ordered the Seafood Fra Diavola, and said it was quite good.  We'd had dinner the night before upstairs at VooDoo Steak & Lounge, and it was excellent. Skip Matarano's and head upstairs. You'll be glad you did.

Been here many times.     Atmosphere feels a bit snobby and douchy.     If it wasn't for the fact that I am a philly native and crave traditional Philly Italian food, I wouldn't come here.  That said, I love the food at this place.   Not terribly sophisticated, way overpriced, and not much better than I believe I can make myself, but it is good.  Ricotta with anything is good.  meatballs are good, and traditional Philly.   Their cheesesteak is really tasty, but again traditional and not worth the $16 they charge.  Have had numerous dishes, all of which were good for a Philly native.

Love this place, my only reservation is the service has been hit or miss.  I have favorite servers now.    I'm from Philly, and let me tell you their $18 cheesesteak is .....worth every penny.  It is absolutely the best.  Their meatball is spectacular, my only issue is; why the heck they charge extra for a tablespoon of ricotta.  That kind of stingy-ness as well as the inconsistency with service is the only reason I cannot give them a 5/5.       Overall, I have never not been happy with their food.  And locals....there is a discount!!! Great place to go.

Horrid atmosphere, amazing food!  I have never found a restaurant that I loved and hated so much at the same time.  This is an example of a Las Vegas vanity restaurant with an 'experience' I would avoid at all costs but food that begs me to come back for more.  We were seated inside of the restaurant late in the evening, exactly at the time we reserved our table.  The staff were friendly, attentive and professional.  The service staff had spot on recommendations for drinks and appetizers. Stars all around for everyone.  Inside the restaurant was clouded with vanity pictures of chef Martorano in poses that show him as the 'Boss' he apparently is.  Music from the 90s was being pumped through speakers so loud the servers had to shout the specials and signature drinks, and even that was not good enough to hear anything they said.   Much worse, a string of scenes from Martorano's favorite films were loudly played on TV screens throughout.  Scarface, Rocky 3 & 4, and an old Steve Martin film were forced down our throats as we tried to enjoy delicious cocktails.  Why the TV's?  I felt like we were at home watching bad cable.  The food, however, oh the food!  Are you kidding me?  We ordered four items from the regular menu and specials, and everything was just amazing.  Super fresh, top of the line meat, seafood and pasta.  The standout was a sea bass special, absolutely melt in your mouth perfection.  The pasta was perfectly prepared, just as promised on the menu.  Martorano's is loud, loud, loud, so go for great dining with somebody you don't want to talk with.

Food was just ok service was bad. Ordered calamari was tough. For the prices they charge would not go back. Nothing worth shouting about. Water was always empty. They can't service the whole table at one time bring out food when done each plate what a scam

This restaurant was amazing. The service was great, the food was drool-worthy, and my colleague and I felt well taken care of the entire time. We had the fresh mozzarella, calamari, and shared a chicken Parmesan special and the carbonara. I have nothing bad at all to say about any of the food- every bite of everything was amazing! - but my favorite had to be the calamari, a perfect blend of sweet and spicy without being overbearing. Definitely will be back next time I'm in Vegas!

My boyfrind and I went to the Rio in search of a good dinner. We landed at Cafe Mortorano. We did the special where you get an appitizer, 2 entrees and a dessert for $44 each. We sat down and the waitress took a good 5 minutes to greet us. My boyfriend ordered his drink and I took water until I made my choice. It took her another 10 to 15 minutes to get the drink and to take our order. The food was semi up to par, however our server was horrid. She dropped off our entree's 30 minutes after our appitizer was cleared. She passed by our table several times without even glancing our way. Another server noticed and he was awesome at checking to see if our dinner was up to par.  No matter the food, the service was terrible.

Extremely overpriced for the quality they deliver. I ordered the carbonara and it was doused in salt and heavy cream. For $28 a plate, you'd expect something more than a heavy slob of cream, plated in a manner that looks like it came out of a cheap cafeteria. Very disappointed. DO NOT RECOMMEND!

If you are VEGETARIAN , do NOT EAT HERE.. They have nothing for you, the chef won't even make alterations.  We were very disappointed, the prices are ridiculous and the food isn't even worth it... The manager tried to get us to come back again and try their fish, I was like no way... The food is really BAD....you can find a million better Italian restaurants.. When a place tells you we cannot make anything vegetarian, its trouble, I have learned my lesson.. The decor and the color scheme of the restaurant  is awesome, too bad the food sucks....  I  was very disappointed. I don't mind paying for good food, but when the food is bad and overpriced its horrible... DO NOT GO HERE...

Nice surprise here in Paris hotel. Really good bolognese, pasta, they even created an Alfredo dish for us that the guy said was best he ever had. Good bread, good atmosphere and good for business dinner.  A little slow on service at the table. Fantastic bartender last Thursday night so lots eating at the bar.

Yeah Yeah.  Located at the Rio.  Everyone knows about the Carnival World Buffet and their Village Seafood Buffet.  That's how the hotel pushes it's marketing: "go to our Carnival World Buffet".  I don't think too highly about the buffet.  In the 90s, it was the buffet to experience because of the quality and price.  Now it's only about the price.  Well, surprisingly, I was surprised that the Rio has one hell of a restaurant on site.   Martorano's!!!!!  I went with three picky eaters.  We normally stay at the higher end casinos like The Wynn or Caesar's.  But we had to stay at the Rio due to Business reasons.  Well, we were tired so we chose this place.  What a great surprise.  In fact, it was the best meal I had during my 3 day trip, although the Wicked Spoon Buffet also ranks up there!  My friends are picky but they all three decided to have the Meatball Salad.  What a weird choice.  Meatball Salad????  But they LOVED it.  It was so memorable that we spoke about it weeks later.  Me on the other hand, I don't like to follow everyone else so I decided to order something else.  I ordered the Bucatini Carbonara.  I love Carbonara.  I've had it in some of the best restaurants.  Beverly Hills, Paris France, New York.  Well, hands down, this was the BEST Carbonara I have ever had.  Wow.  It was so beautiful I wanted to take a picture but my friends would have laughed at me.  They are obviously not a foodie like me and my fellow Yelpers.  The Bucatini, which is a thicker spaghetti, was al dente.  Perfectly al dente.  The Carbonara was delicious.  It had a raw egg yolk on it and you had to pop it.  It goosed out and made the Carbonara authentically delicious.  I added some fresh ground black pepper and it was PERFECT.  I actually think about it.  I recently had Linguini Carbonara at two fancy places in Los Angeles and was disappointed.  Martorano's has set the bar very high for me and has ruined Carbonara for me......unless I'm willing to make the trip to Las Vegas!!!!  This is one instance where "What happens in Vegas Stays in Vegas".  No......spread the word.  The Best Carbonara I have ever had was at the Rio Hotel and not at the Buffet!!!!

Didn't even eat here. Had a reservation for 7:30. Stood there for 15 minutes and no one helped us so we left. This place is a joke. I've eaten here before and the food is not that good to stand there and wait like this. Never again.

Food was ok was not very impressed I thought it would be a lot better .. The rice balls were great the chicken parm was good but it didn't come with any pasta and for $28 it should my clam sauce the pasta wasn't cooked enough and it was very spicy . The drinks were ok very sweet

Review only for drinks at the bar--- Great bartender! Sat down and was quickly presented with an iPad of all the various drink options. Lots of cool cocktail combinations made expertly and quick. Really impressed with the fast service here because so many other places I've been to here can be quite slow. Bartender was also cheerful and friendly. Will definitely go back for drinks. Only draw back was a bunch of obnoxious investment bankers lurking at the bar, but I can't really fault them for that.

This was my 3rd time here. Fantastic Italian food. Ordered the special steak and risotto. Cut like butter, awesome flavored mushroom bernaise . The spaghetti and famous meatball was a little dry this time, so did not eat all of that. They comped dessert to make up for it. You can't ask for extra sauce since all is prepared to order, so ask for more sauce in advance. Great wine list, and great waiter. Knew the menu well. Will be back when visiting Vegas.

I will start off with the food was incredible! The service was mediocre at best...the server seemed preoccupied and self serving. One the menu, everything seemed in line with the pricing you would expect with added sides. But  everything is ala-cart ($10 for side of spinach and $12 for side of spaghetti) and served in plates that are their own separate full plates so you are reaching three plates over to get your vegetable or pasta.  For the price and service the food greatness does not make up for the other ineptness!  I would not recommend  this restaurant with so many others in the vicinity...if I could have, 2.5 stars and a pass! Never again.

Just went to the original location in Fort Lauderdale a few weeks ago. That was awesome, and the food was amazing. This location, not so much. It just didn't wow me. It was still good, but just not the same. Even the ambiance was different. It was a busy Wednesday night in Florida. It was a quiet Monday night in Vegas. We were one of 5 tables that were occupied in the quiet place at 8p. But that's fine, I understand.   The meatball was drier than expected, the pasta was undercooked. The chicken parmesean was good, but it was just okay good. The sauce is still awesome.   I find it interesting to see that almost all of the positive reviews of this place include a mention that Steve was there. Could that improve the quality? Possibly. I watched him inspect just about every dish that left the kitchen at the original location. That definitely didn't happen here.   So it's getting three stars. Our service was good, the food just didn't meet the expectations set by...his own restaurant. And thats what brings me back. I likely won't be back to this location. Too many other great options in Vegas. But I am still looking forward to my next visit to the Florida location!

Would definitely recommend this restaurant. We ate here on a Friday night and we ate a little earlier in the evening. The atmosphere was nice and was not too noisy which I have grown used to in Vegas. We ordered our drinks and I had the Black Beauty (at least I think that is what it was called) which was fantastic. For dinner my boyfriend ordered the lasagna and I ordered the bolognese. They were both delicious and very good portion sizes (I usually have trouble finishing a pasta plate but I was able to here). We really enjoyed the televisions playing old school Vegas movies like the original Ocean's 11 movie. For dessert we had their homemade ice cream and that was also a wonderful addition to our meal. Will be returning on our next visit!

The food here was phenomenal. Raymond and Francisco helped us out with some recommendations from the menu and took the the time to explain everything. They were a great team and kept us happy throughout the meal. I tried the watermelon martini Raymond recommended and it was great. The pasta was cooked perfect as was everything else. Started with the calamari appetizer, chicken parm, risotto, you name it. It was all great ! Unfortunately we didn't have the appetite we should have coming here but I will definitely be coming back. This time with an appetite big enough to enjoy dessert afterwards. If we're lucky we'll get stuck with Raymond and Francisco again :) they were awesome!

I came for a business dinner so I have no idea what the bill or the expense was, but the food was fantastic. I'm not sure if they pulled out the stops for our group of 20+ but everything down to the bread was perfect. The little olive oil trio they serve alongside it was a nice touch - and again, the bread was crusty and perfect.  We started with Martorano's Salad and moved into some apps that I don't quite remember but recall being very happy stuffing them into my face hole. A stack of fried mozz with fresh tomato...more please. The meatballs were heaven, the chicken cutlet (City Chicken Stack or some such thing) was divine and a few others were also wonderful. The one glitch was the underdone rigatoni but no matter. I didn't love the trout scampi style but I'm no fan to cooked fish.     There are several big screen TVs to around the room showing Italian genre mob flicks like Goodfellas, Casino and The Godfather so that's fun but it is a little loud and obnoxious if you're hoping for a more intimate experience. Service was tip top and family style dining kept the food rolling in and all of us content. Definitely one of the better spots to eat in the Rio at 4.5 stars.  FYI the cannoli was good but the red velvet cake was OFF THE HOOK!

We really loved this place inside the Paris! We came here twice while on our vacation and both times we sat at the bar while they were only serving pizza and salads. The Caesar is to die for seriously! And the pizzas are unique and delicious. Great for a little bite mid day around 3pm. Both times the bar tenders were exceptional as well and made it a truly nice experience. Next time we are in vegas I'm sure we will be here again.  Ambiance is cool too with the blue lights!

PHENOMENAL, I had the Chilean Seabass and I was with party of four, the rest had the stacked eggplant, (not a fan of the eggplant) but it looked good. The place is like a club as well; music were 70s-90s dance hits. Great music great food, great everything. Clean, Well explained about food and beverages, Well organized. I will be going back for sure!

We had a party of 6 last Saturday night and I ordered the lasagna special the waiter was quick to note that they do not have the special available they were out what Italian restaurant on a Saturday night on the strip runs out of lasagna at 7:30 so I ended up ordering penne alla vodka dish and I asked to substitute for a different pasta he said he would check got back to me said no they do not do that . You would think they would help me out since the lasagna was already out.So when the dish came it was not penne alla vodka wasn't even close wasn't even edible the waiter was more than accommodating to exchange it but by this time I lost my appetite I managed to call the manager over and and  asked him what restaurant at your caliber runs out of lasagna on a Saturday night at 7:30 he said he only makes 15 pieces of lasagna per night the restaurant holds 125 and if you have two or three turnovers that's a lot of people I asked him why he cannot do substitutes on pasta he said that's their policy .At the end of our meal the waiter said he took my dish off the bill like he was doing ME a favor that is horrible customer service every time I go there I have a fantastic time but this time it left a bad taste in my mouth probably the alla vodka hard to say if I will return

The food was a little on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for, meaning it was well worth it! The staff was very helpful. The food was delicious - I love Italian food!  We walked out of there stuffed and happy. Would definitely eat there again.

So here is the scoop!  Great food!  Great service & great deals for locals.  Downside... The TV's took away from the atmosphere of the place and it was soooo cold in the restaurant.   I would go back and if I could actually stop shivering and could hear my date over the TV ... this would have been 4 stars!   Orders are large so feel free to share!

A sad duplicate from the greatness in the Rio Hotel.  Staff was rude, my dinner plate had finger prints on it, my wine glass had lipstick.  We were being sea One cocktail menu to be shares by 6 of us, and you only get to see it once as it bounces from table to table. My food was bland and tasteless.

Wow, what an unxepected dining pleasure! First walking in noticing the dark ambiance of a supper club, the cool Philly Sounds music playing and then the food.... mozarella was the best I ever tasted. Wonderful smooth texture, prefectly seasoned. Caprese tomatoes were spot on. I had a simple marinara spaghetti which had a nice flavor, noodles cooked perfectly. Kris' Chicken Maralsa was cooked very good, great flavor. With all that and American Gangster playing in th background, it was all good and more!

I was really impressed with the food at Martorano's in the Paris Hotel. The decor is quite modern with specials and cocktail menus displayed on iPads and a light up menu.  The customer service from the hostess to the waiter were all top notch.  THE FOOD WAS DIVINE!  I tried the caesar salad, linguine in white clam sauce and the homemade mozzarella with olive oil.  I don't suggest this place for a romantic date night but for a fun night out it fits the bill with fun music and stellar food.  For the cost it would have been nice to not have all the buzz and noise from the casino and for Martorano's to have it's only restroom which is why I deducted a star.

Who knew that an Italian restaurant would have some AMAZING seafood?!?!  First off, the restaurant is billed as a nightclub/restaurant however don't let that fool you for dinner; mind you, we got there about 7pm for dinner so we may have missed the nightclub crowd. Sadly, we didn't have reservations & they were booked until 9:30pm. Luckily for us they serve the full menu at the bar and there were a couple of available seats, so we took them! And after the food, I'm so glad we did! First up were their meatball for an appetizer, which you can order with or without a salad, we ordered without & that was one giant, meaty, tasty ball of meat!! For our entrees, my Partner ordered the scallops & they were probably some of the freshest, most buttery, large scallops we've ever had!! Perfectly moist and perfectly cooked! Just, DAMN good! I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass & let me tell you that was one perfectly amazing plate of food. Fresh, tasty, buttery, flavorful, meaty & perfectly cooked! The Bass was topped with 2 giant grilled shrimps that I believe were some of the best shrimp I've ever had!! The risotto on both of our plates were spot on! When you're there, disregard the disco lights floating around but while you're at the bar, ask for Nathan, he was the AWESOME Bartender/Server!

The food is really good but I think it's expensive for what you get.  I had the meatball and salad and hubby had the meatball with spaghetti (their version of it).  Pasta was cooked to perfection and really good.  The staff is friendly and is located in a good location in the Paris hotel.

My family and I had dinner here tonight in the paris hotel. Food was nothing special. Pasta had hardly any sauce on it and my sons riggi pasta dish was real hard and under cooked.  The atmosphere is a nightmare . Music blasting it have us a horrible headache could not wait to get out of there.  Why would anyone want to enjoy a nice meal with blasting music. We could not even talk to each other it was that horrible !
Food was good. Eggplant stack amazing and homemade mozzarella to die for! Service was impeccable!

Highly disappointed with the food especially after our waiter gave us a long monologue about using the fresh and best ingredients.  Brandon, our waiter is the only reason I give as many stars as i did.

I'm a big fan of fresh pasta so when I heard this place imports from Italy I was super excited to try it. But it was mediocre from start to finish and not worth the price we paid.   My husband and I like to be adventurous so we started off with the pigs feet. This was a little too fatty for me but the sauce was adequate and it was interesting to try.   Afterwards, we weren't sure what pasta to get so we thought we'd split the bolognese of the day. The picture on the menu made it look big but when it arrived there was not a whole lot there. I thought the pasta was extremely underwhelming for supposedly "fresh pasta".   Because I'm a glutton for punishment, I decided to order the carbonara which I thought would be better. It wasn't. Pasta still tasted stale to me and the sauce was underwhelming as well.   Overall we felt that the price for everything just wasn't worth it. Yes it's the strip and you're gonna pay more but for this price we expected top notch pasta. I felt like the meal was comparable to any run of the mill pasta place on the strip that would be cheaper.

Excellent food, ambiance, and service!!!  We didn't have a reservation nor had any expectations, we were here to see the Penn and Teller show at 9 am and want to good eats nearby....also to celebrate a friends 60th birthday that evening.  We thought we give Cafe Martorano a try...glad we did.  The food was delicious and the service was even better.  We each ordered from the prix fixe menu which include a started, main and dessert.  Also order a bottle of red wine and two expresso....all for about $200.00!! That is considered a good deal since food on the main strip can run you more than $75 for fine dining.   Food:  Ordered their Meatballs, they're suppose to be famous for them (pic).  The calamari with the peppers was delicious (pic), I would go back just for this dish alone!  We brought in our own cake and the server presented with our cannoli.  Made the evening even more special for my friend. Regular menu items are reasonable as well (well reasonable for Vegas anyway!)  Ambiance: White table cloth with five star service, but you can also come in casual as we seen people in flip flop and shorts.  You get the same service.  Overlooking the pool, open kitchen.  Unexpected: The "Godfather" was playing on three screen (or maybe more) in the restaurant, which was a little odd, but other than that it was fine as watching a younger Pacino and De Niro was an added bonus to the evening.   NOTE:  The server said we could use our receipt to get into the Voodoo Rooftop Nightclub.

im sorry.. i just noticed i took a picture but never posted a review ;( .. so here goes. Very Loud Very Overpriced "even for a cleb chef" - and this guy isnt really in that boat either.. Food Quality - fair.. seriously just fair..  You have to really really look for reasons to go to the Rio.. I mean the rio is a dirty and nasty Casino. This place didnt do the brand any favors.  Penn and Teller are the only reason this Casino exists..

Second time here and was amazing just like the first time. I have tried many Italian restaurants in Vegas and this one is by far the best. Prices are extremely reasonable considering how great the food is. If you like Italian, you must try this place. I would give it 6 stars if I could.

First I'd like to say that the atmosphere is very relaxing and enjoyable. Sadly however, I can't say the same for the menu options and service. The menu lacks selection and customizability. I asked if the spicy sauce on a dish could be substituted and he said "no we don't customize orders." I then asked if their was another dish that included paste, with chicken, that is not spicy. He replied "no". I can't believe that they can't customize an order that costs upwards of $30 a dish. This establishment lacks quality and versatility that many younger individuals desire, due to this I would highly recommend overlooking this place and finding a more "family" oriented restaurant (save your money and time).

My sister and I went here on August 9th. As two Italian girls from Philadelphia we found a place that cooks like our mom does! We used open table to place our reservations we walked in and got seated before our actual reservation time. Which is really hard to do in Las Vegas. Yuri was our waiter and I can't say enough about how wonderful he was!! We ordered the fried calamari to start which was amazing! I ordered the special which was the Sunday gravy with ravioli which are two of my favorite things! Initially I was just going to do the Sunday gravy with rigatoni but then Yuri came over and told us about the ravioli special. There was no doubt about it I had to try it! My sister got the lasagna which was great it was such a huge portion that she couldn't finish it. And the bread was so crusty and fresh which is great for dipping! I can't say how much we felt welcome here. All the staff were extremely courteous and welcoming!!! We will definitely be back!!!

Went to Martorano's at Paris on Sunday 5.1.2016 and it was not what we come to expect of this place. We have dined most locations more than once; and this was by far the worst experience that we have ever had. Being from Philadelphia and fairly familiar with the cuisine and the restaurant itself. I will have to say that our waitress (Jessica) was excellent and none of it was her fault. We had reservations at 8:30PM and were not seated until 8:40 PM; everyone was crowding the hostess stand. We were finally seated and looking at our menu I order Veal Parmigiana with Gnocchi which I do every location. I was told at first that veal parm is not on the menu but it was on the menu outside the restaurant and every other restaurant that I have been to; but then I was told that they will make an "exception". Then moments later I was told that they were out of Gnocchi (I was the 24th order and they only had 23 orders). How do you run out of Gnocchi on a Sunday night when you have it on your menu and you are still open for another 2-3 hours minimum? This is not acceptable for a place that has reservations and is accepting walk-ins. I got my Veal Parmigiana and it was the size of my fist (which isn't that large) and it was very thick and had bones in it (not usual for Veal Parmigiana)  Martorano's was so much better atmosphere, presentation, and family like at the Rio;  at Paris I feel like its get in and get out not enjoyable.

Good food, extremely loud environment, great waiters.  Staying at Rio it's hard to imagine a really good restaurant embedded in this old world Vegas casino however Cafe Martorano surprises you when you dine there.  A clean upscale looking design with fa very friendly staff greeting you at the door. You immediately get a more hip vibe as your shown to your table.   Disco music was blasting, Godfather 2 was playing on the video screens ( my all time favorite film so right away they got me) and white cloth tables await your arrival.  The menu is old school Italian fare with their signature meatball at the top. We chose to go with a series of appetizers and salads for dinner.  Here's the scoop on the food  Meatball with Ricotta cheese - great and lives up to the hype  Eggplant Stack- pricey but was by far my favorite dish. Can share between 3 people  Martorano Salad - good crisp lettuce, excellent slices of pecorino Romano, light dressing  Fresh mozzarella with prosciutto - nice dish, not buffalo mozzarella but fresh and served with Prosciutto drizzled with olive oil  Baked clams - they have a bit of a kick with red pepper flakes, not my favorite dish  Cannoli for dessert was very good  Two issues I had with CM was extremely loud environment where even the waiters have to scream to be heard and all our courses came out at the same time. I know we ordered a bit different by ordering all appetizers however it should have been paced a bit.  Overall though, great food and great friendly service overcome the two shortfalls. And oh, Godfather 2 playing, well that just makes the whole experience even better.

decided to give another try because of the  billboard I see on the freeways.  OMG I am really beyond disappointed. for a 32 dollars pasta you would think that you get a good service (I mean this pasta is a price of steak)    service is slow and mediocre for high priced restaurant.  we never got our breads. took long time just to get some salt and pepper. chicken marsala chicken is dried out chewy(sign of frozen meat)   people do not go to this place.  I can confidently say that this is the worst high end restaurant

This place was a joke!  We should have known the attitude we would get when the menu states "No substitutions", "Don't break my balls".  We went anyway because we were staying at the Paris hotel and needed an early meal before the show.  The atmosphere was very pretentious and awkward.  Almost every server that poured water or wine was a nervous wreck and shook like leaves.  We asked for butter with our bread and they brought one pat on a little dish for 4 people!  The wine was very overpriced ($19 for 4 oz.).  The meal was mediocre, especially for the price.  I'm used to high prices for fine meals, but this one really was a disappointment.  I've been to Italy many times and no place treated us like this one did.  My sister asked for salt when they brought her meal and the waiter insisted that she taste it first and stood there while she did it (she still wanted salt!)!!  They made you feel like they were so superior in their knowledge.  I would never recommend anyone go there!!

This place looks fantastic! The service once they get to you it's very good. Definitely not worth the hype. I would almost rather go to Olive Garden. There is not a single thing here that I was impressed with except the meatball salad. It is enough for two people to share and has great taste! Had the chicken parmesan and was definitely not impressed. They brought out the wrong order at first and they made it right but by the time they came back I was so full on bread it did not matter that they brought me new food period was not able to eat it anyways. Had a few bites and it was okay period then packed it and gave it away to the homeless. Martorano's you guys really need to step it up. The appetizers came out at the same time as the entrees. They sat us very quickly but the waiter took 20 minutes to come say hello. Once we started eating we realized something was not right and it took them an additional 20 minutes to come but that was only because we waved them down. I think you guys have a great place on your hands, a few tweaks would bake it so fantastic

Came here for the first time on St.Pattys weekend and absolutely loved it. This past weekend, I brought some of my friends who are big "foodies" in as we flew in for a few days to see Elton John. They had the best time and the food was excellent again. The bartenders are fantastic - went above and beyond when I asked for a cucumber martini which by the way was perfect. Make a reservation,  go an hour early, sit at the bar before you are seated at your table, they won't disappoint.

The food was okay at the most. Definitely not worth the price. There was no Frank Sinatra nor R&B playing, as it was said on the menu's introduction. And the cockiness of the chefs statements on the menu's cover makes you lose your appetite. His arrogance is second to none.  Service was good.  Will not come back.

My wife and I have stayed at Paris several times before and this was a new (opened October 18, 2014) restaurant.  We knew going in that it is a bit pricy $$$ but that's why you read reviews.  Our wait staff was great (Chris D).  He was very knowledgable about the food and how it was made.  Plenty of fresh bread to start and a nice wine list.  We ordered the Chicken siciliano (6 tenderloins) and penne ala vodka.  They serve it family style and split it for us.  WOW!!  If I could have sucked the sauce up with a straw I would have.  Worth the price for the quality of the food.  The music was not to loud but there was no DJ on so maybe that was when Slipknot fans come as mentioned in another review.  They also have unlimited tap water not in plastic bottles.  Some of the negative reviews may have been when they first opened but it is running great when we visited.

We enjoyed a really terrific meal. My wife ordered the salad with meatball and I ordered the pepperoni pizza. Great portion size. Very tasty meals. Quick lunch service. They have Lagunitas IPA and I enjoyed that, too.

My wife likes the Matarano story, bought the book, I kind of read a few parts. Great story, pretty good recipes, and was pretty excited to try the new place in the Paris. Went for lunch and was impressed by the trendy upscale decor..Had sports and a n old gangster movie on the t.v.s. I like both so cool. We ordered the bucatini carbonara and the bucatini meatball with red gravy, and truffle fries...both pasta dishes were pretty good. Carbonara had the white Parmesan sauce which was my favorite, other one was pretty solid with one good sized delicious meatball..good but $28 at lunch time good???not sure..Truffle fries were flavorful slash a.little salty..$80tab for lunch seems to make me not like it as much as I hoped..Maybe I'll return for dinner to give a fair review..Cool and friendly waiter was a plus..#yocuz Lower ur lunch prices..haha..

This was my first experience in the restaurant.  I've never had a waiter so attentive and knowledgeable of the menu.  He has been with the restaurant since opening.  His recommendations for starters were the eggplant stack and the meatball with ricotta cheese.  They were incredible!  The ambiance was great.  Busy restaurant, but you could still carry on a conversation without yelling.  Regarding dress attire:  I would think this restaurant would require dressy attire, but there were some people in casual.  Very much enjoyed my evening and  will be back again!

Our excellent waiter, Paul, put this review past 3 stars. His manner and passion for the food was entertaining and informative. The food was good...not great and if it weren't for our waiter and the ambiance I'd only give it 2 or 3 stars.
The absolute BEST Italian Food in Las Vegas.  Every entrée is delicious.  Atmosphere is fun and lively.

My friends and I were craving some good Italian food and decided to try Martorano's. It is not really inexpensive, as pasta prices seem a little high.  Our appetizers and server was amazing! The spicy calamari was the best that I have ever tasted! The meal portions are very large so the waiter recommended family style so we all ordered a few items and split it. It was all pretty good, and the service was polite and helpful.

We've never heard of this place until one night when we were desperately looking for a place for dinner while on vacation in Vegas.  I'm glad we went for it.  It was a good experience overall, however the 4 stars are mainly for the service and the calamari appetizer.  I know some people complained about it being soggy because of the sauce but I think it's the sauce that *made* the dish!  It's different from any other typical calamari appetizer I've ever had at most restaurants.  It's lightly breaded and fried, but they put a slightly sweet and tangy sauce on it that made it completely different in a good way.  I ordered the seafood pasta with red sauce (I forget the fancy dish name) and the seafood was obviously very fresh.  I would pick this place over some of the other "celebrity" Italian restaurants in the area.

An hour long wait, despite having made reservations more than a month in advance - we were originally seated on the "sidewalk" outside the restaurant, with casino guests stumbling past mere inches from our table. Make sure you ask for a table inside the restaurant, but not under the house speakers - it was so loud, we couldn't even hear our waitress, who immediately screamed over the noise, "Yeah, people complain about the music all the time!" Do they, now?  We started with the Fried Calamari Bibzy ($20), which was a conflict of textures - some of the larger pieces of squid were completely melt-in-your-mouth tender, while other pieces were crazy rubbery - even the waitress quipped about the half-eaten portion when she finally arrived with our drink orders.  The place has a fantastic wine selection, featuring some really nice and inexpensive offerings, including several of our favorites from the Conundrum Winery by the glass - and we received some awesome suggestions from the sommelier, who had to scream his selections over the music.   My wife's Linguine with White Clam Sauce ($32) arrived under a thick layer of Italian parsley - so much so you would have thought someone dumped a lawnmower bag over the plate. And while the pasta was perfectly cooked, many of the clam pieces were gritty with sand. By the time my wife called it quits, there was such a pile of parsley "clippings" floating in the remaining broth, you couldn't see the bottom of the plate.   The Veal Piccata ($34) was tender and the lemon butter sauce was excellent. Just don't forget to order a side of pasta, because everything is a'la carte - an important fact that was either not shared with us, or we simply missed the detail while the waitress attempted to scream over the music.  Oh, and don't ask for salt or pepper - "The chef seasons everything to perfection." Maybe for his pallet, but the veal would have certainly benefitted from a tiny sprinkling of salt.

Once again it did not disappoint.  We got our favorite chicken Sicilian and this time we tried the New York strip steak with sharp provolone and peppers. It was AMAZING?. Cooked perfectly. We also tried the greens which was spinach sprinkled with bread crumbs with big cloves of garlic. So good.

A real comedic event   A good menu, but a bad excuse of a restaurant and a really poor Las Vegas restaurant management team!  Really sloppy - their dress, their presentation, their view on food / service, etc, etc, etc   Just ok service - rushed and unrefined  The food is good, but It is not great by any stretch.  You experience is overshadowed by the management / service.    Find your good customers and don't rush them.    Overpriced even for Vegas. No regulars here, but just tourists who are drawn in unknowingly.  2 years and the location will likely turnover to-another entureprienoer.            Not worth a return trip based on the management, presentation, price, rushed service and poor leadership.    Too many other GREAT options.

Very surprised by the 3 star rating. My wife and I give it 5 stars!   Everything was delicious,  from the meatball salad appetizer  to the chicken parmigiano.  My wife had the special California  sea bass with lump crab. Setting was perfect and service was superb!

The ambience and the location of this place is amazing . It has an indoor and outdoor seating arrangement .The staff is very friendly and co-operative .  We ordered chicken fussili and a caesar salad , both were good and very filling .We had to take to-go boxes. An authentic Italian restaurant !! Will come back for sure !

First time in Vegas- wanted to eat well. I love Italian food. My son suggested this place as he had been to it at a previous location. He told the waiter we would start with appetizers and then decide on the main course. The waiter said that he could not take a partial order - we had to order the entire meal at the beginning. I said - I may want dessert... he said we had to decide then. If I had been in my hometown I would have asked for the manager and had a discussion with him about how ridiculous this was. Instead we just ate our appetizers and left - we went elsewhere for our dessert. What a shame.

I reserved my table as Albus Purcival Wulfric Brian Dumbledor and the hostess totally got it.  That made me happy. Great food. I had the meatball. I put that salty ball in my mouth and I was beside myself with satisfaction.
I was very surprised at the quality of food and service i received here. The restaurant is tucked away in the crappy Rio hotel but is by far one of the better places I have eaten at in vegas.
The bucatini  pasta  with a meatball was phenomenal.  Truly  a great dining experience  coupled with a fine wine list. Service could have been a tiny bit better but food was  outstanding.

Wow we were surprised by the number of negative reviews for this restaurant.  We thought this place was awesome.  We totally enjoyed the ambiance of Motown music with mobster movies playing on the big screens throughout the restaurant.  You are in Vegas lighten up!!!  We waited for about 15 minutes at the bar and we were first introduced to the rule that nothing but wine and beer were served in the dining area and at first we felt a bit put off by this but in the end we think it is a brilliant idea.  First of all the portions are HUGE!!!!  We ordered the Eggplant Stack as an appetizer and it was not only huge but very tasty.  For our entree we ordered the Chicken Downtown and let me just tell you it was absolutely foodgasmic.  As we had no room for dessert we can't report on that, but we can say our service was right on and our experience was fabulous.  This is Italian served South Philly style with lots of attitude and lots of flavor.

Really enjoyed dining here at the Paris hotel. I had the meatball salad and the carbonara pasta. My husband had a rigatoni special. Delightful martini choices. Canolli was okay. Pricing is excellent for the quality of food, Vegas experience and the name alone. We will definitely go back.

Fabulous food here!  Wait staff is very attentive and friendly.  We greatly enjoyed our experience with Brandon and the bartender Jenna.    Our first night here we stopped in for a drink and dessert.  We saw someone else enjoying the Cesar salad and knew we had to come back.  The following night after watching a show, we returned....  The Cesar salad is splendid!  Beautiful presentation with large shaved Parmesano-Reggiano pieces on top.  Bread is served wth olive oil, grated Parmesan, and chili oil.    Desserts.... No words, just yummy feelings. We tried the chocolate cake with cream cheese frosting the first night and the following night plus the tiramisu.  Delectable!  Flavors do not disappoint.  I want that tiramisu recipe!  BEST ever...  Atmosphere:  There are TVs playing Vegas mob-type movies with subtitles, music playing, Several disco balls glittering in the back.  The blue colors are inviting.    really cool modern menus... Backlit!  iPad/tablet technology used by wait staff.

This place is awful. I suggest visiting this restaurant only if you enjoy getting an instant heartburn from house salad dressing that consists out of straight up vinegar, consuming overcooked chicken in Marsala sauce that's saltier than the Pacific Ocean, or washing it all down with a glass of Pinot that must've come out of a cardboard box for $5/gallon. To top off your experience, you will wait 1.5 hours for your course to make its way to your table and your dessert will be unavailable at the end of your meal. We came in with a party of 8 people and not one of us had a single positive thing to say about this place. Maybe this restaurant should try to focus on food rather than pretending to be high-end with poorly written iPad apps that aim to replace the drink menu.

Absolutely phenomenal service and by far, the best Italian food we have ever had. The homemade mozzarella is delicious and the pasta cooked perfectly. The meatball is out if this world. Cannot more highly recommend. And big shout out to Raymond for making our first date night as a married couple absolutely perfect!!!!

My wife and I are here last night and it was absolutely amazing!  The food there is made to order and tastes just like grandma used to make, I couldn't hardly contain myself from ordering more food just to try it. This place has an amazing menu and great quality food, not to mention a very home feel to it, even though its upscsle.  The wait staff is professional, curious, knowledgeable and also very concerned with making you feel like your home. ( as for Paul, our entire menu from drinks to entree were of his choosing and we couldn't have been more satisfied)  To start: the bread and dipping sauces are just amazing. We ordered a homemade mozzarella and tomatoes antipasto, this was to die for! 4 layers of handmade cheese with thick, fresh and ripened tomatoes between them, fresh basil and a 20 year aged balsamic vinaigrette.  I cannot say enough about it.  We also ordered the chicken parmesan that was on special with a side of pasta and their famous meatball....OMG it was amazing! The chicken was perfect, topped with fresh ricotta and mozzarella, not to mention the fresh tomatoe to round it all out. The pasta, always served (al dente) has changed my view on how pasta should taste and that meatball... was worth every stretched out millimeter in my stomach.  All in all, this place was worth the money and time spent, we will be visiting here again on our next Vegas trip.

Stay Away!!!! I went here with a party of 10 for our annual Vegas NCAA trip.The food is mediocre, service is terrible and prices are ridiculous for what you get. They do have a good but overpriced wine list. The music is so loud, you can't even think about having a conversation and the movies with gunshots and blood are completely unappealing while dining.  When I asked if it could be turned down, I was told no and to be happy because it would soon be louder. Is this a restaurant or a disco? Apparently the mis-management seems to attract the "stripper" crowd with free food and drinks. You have many choices for good dining when in Vegas so eliminate this from your list.
Fantastic great food and obviously the message not to break his balls about his cooking applies. Great service great wine list. Just a pleasant meal all the way around.

Dined here with my boss on a Tuesday night approximately two months ago. Attention from all staff was wonderful, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was nice as well as we were seated outside. I had some sort of pasta (Can't remember the name but similar to the spaghetti and meat sauce) but it was one of their evening special plates, it was delicious! All ingredients were super fresh and the portion size was perfect.  The bread with oils, vinaigrette and spicy sauce was delicious as well.

AVOID THIS PLACE - BAD FOOD, BAD SERVICE & HORRIBLE ATMOSPHERE  My stomach is still unsettled from last night's dinner.....And so are the stomachs of the other three I dined with.  My suggestion - Go elsewhere in Vegas - anywhere.  For a suggestion as to where to go:  Piero's is far better experience (upscale food and ambiance)  for about the same price.  It's located right off the strip and has been a favorite here for over 30 years.  We are a local Las Vegas family that eats out at good fine dining restaurants regularly.  We know good food when we experience it - and when we don't.  We didn't experience good food here.  Boy were we surprised when the bill came.  I never saw $300 coming.  Now we pay more than that regularly, but never as a surprise.  Here is what we had:  Appetizers: -2 salads $16 each - Mozzarella appetizer special (average appetizer price on menu $18) - Eggplant Stack $23 - Rice Balls $16  Entrees: -  Plain pasta with tomato sauce (as main dish for one person) $19 - Veal Parmesan $28 - Veal Picatta $30 - Seafood special (Sea Bass with two shrimp) (average entree price on menu $28)  One glass of wine $17 No dessert.  Using prices from the menu for items ordered above, the bill should have been $211  So how did they get it to $300?  (That's 50% more than we expected to pay.....)  The bill was filled with extra charges - for items that the server made sound were included.  For example, I ordered the Veal Parmesan, and asked if pasta came as a side.  When I was told yes, I asked for penne, and was told the chef does not allow substitutions for side pastas.  But they charged $10 for that side of pasta - which I did not eat as it was horrible.  I would have sent it back and asked for it done right if I knew they were going to charge.    They also charged for extra sauce on a main dish.  I've NEVER seen that happen - EVER.    And the specials were way above the average price on the menu.  Both Appetizer and entree were $20 each above average menu pricing.
