Fine dining restaurants ALWAYS price their specials around the average price of their menu, and tell you when they have something extraordinary that deserves higher pricing.  The service was non-existent.   We were constantly looking for our server when food was missing from the table.  I waited at least 30 minutes from when others received their appetizers to get mine.  No acknowledgement of delay, no explanation provided - until I pointed it out.  And the atmosphere - well what can I say.....Large TV's throughout showing the "celebrity" cook on a TV show (he obviously was not in the kitchen).   And about 8 speakers hanging from the ceiling - each the size of a large person - with music so loud that no one could hear each other talk.  Again - avoid this place.  Go anywhere else for better food and an overall better dining experience.
Stay away! This place is insulting to anyone of Italian American descent.  Decor; tacky! Videos; distracting! Music; yuck! And the food; straight out of a food court.

My husband and I stopped by Martorano's this evening before going to see Garth Brooks in Las Vegas at the T-Mobile Arena.  We started off with the fried mozzarella appetizer which was the best appetizer we have ever had!   Then we split the Carbonara and it was also delicious!  Our server, Chris was very knowlegable and personable!  Overall, an excellent meal and we will return!

Went here for a birthday dinner. Food was great! Chicken Downtown was delicious! Eggplant stack and a meatball for appetizer was also great. But what really stood out was our server Brandon, super nice guy and extremely knowledgable about all the menu items. Everything was excellent.
It probably helped to have a great waiter - he helped explain the menu - the food was terrific as was the service.  Prices were on the high side but  the quality and quantity of food were worth it.

We had dinner here twice while we were attending a convention at the Rio. Compared with the other places we dined at the Rio, this was a stand out. In general, though, it was a fairly average Italian restaurant. Prices were a bit high, most likely because the restaurant is in a casino.   We made reservations both nights and were seated promptly - we definitely chose times before the dinner rush started. Service was similarly prompt and attentive. The wait staff helped with menu selections and based on their recommendations we split the chicken parm the first night. When paired with a side of spaghetti (which was incredibly overpriced given the portion size) and a salad it was more than enough for the both of us. The next dinner we both tried the meatballs, which had a nice taste to them and were accompanied with a light sauce.   Another benefit to eating "early" (6-7 pm time frame): The music was at a tolerable level. We were worried about the noise when we first read the Yelp reviews, but it wasn't an issue when we were there. They apparently gradually turn up the volume as the evening draws on, so if you want to be able to chat with your dining companions, you might want to dine before things get too loud.  They do have a person going table to table asking if you would like your picture taken. That might be a turn off to some people, but it didn't bother us. The woman was very friendly and we chatted for a while. From what we saw from other tables, she wasn't high pressure: Tell her "no thanks" and she is off to another table.  We'd eat here again if we were ever in the Rio.

Food is exception and always enjoy Steve's restaurants!  Server was a bit rude but I can overlook it since the chicken Parmesan was out of this world.  Fried mozz with meatballs is killer and the bread is straight from north east.  Can't go without telling you how good the housemate mozzarella is on top of the tender chicken rolling out the parm.  Excellent five stars all around wish we did dessert but I left half the portion of chicken on the plate because it was so big.  I also got gnocchi with sunday gravy because I can't resist trying Everyhthing on the menu when I dine.  So good & so bad ars #YoCuz I'll be back soon !!
Excellent experience. I had the scallops while my husband had the veal and both were fantastic. I would recommend and will return when in Vegas. The wine by the glass was surprisingly good.

The American/Italian "Philly" style food is delicious across the board. Meatballs, Pastas and Parm style dishes flood the menu and are all very tasty. The restaurant is a relocation or spin off of Cafe Martorano's which was at the Rio for many years. I think this is an excellent restaurant with one severe drawback. At night (weekends?) they turn up the music obnoxiously loud as if it's a night club. It's not a night club, it's a restaurant that becomes impossible to have a conversation in. I have never seen the restaurant packed when they do this, as it clearly drives away more traffic than it attracts.

The Good: The food was very good. Sauce had notable flavor. Wine list was decent. Service was good.  The Bad: over hyped a bit. It was good but about what you would expect. I had a hard time moving from very good to exceptional.  The Rest: overall a nice stop and if you don't mind the higher price associated with vegas fine dinning, you wont be disappointed. If you fine dine frequently you will be satisfied but probably not wowed.

The food here was disappointing. The service was good but I would probably not come back for the food. Maybe, I'm just not the right type of customer. There were there for dinner before going to see the new Inferno magic show.  We ordered, the fried calamari, spaghetti with meatball, carbonara, and cheese steak, and a salad.  First of all, when I order calamari, I expect it to be crispy and temperature hot. The sauce that they put on the calamari made all the pieces soggy. Have you had soggy calamari at a restaurant before? I haven't. This was the first time.  The spaghetti was fine. Nothing special with a giant meatball. For $25 or so for an average bowl of spaghetti wasn't worth it. If the sauce was more flavorful, then sure, but really, I could have made that spaghetti. The carbonara was okay, but I think they must have used swiss cheese, or the combination of cheese they used wasn't as good. It was very strong. I love parmessan, gruyere, asiago, etc. but whatever the combination was - was something that I personally didn't like. The Philly was okay, as well, but nothing special.  Usually price isn't a factor, but when the food isn't great, then it becomes an issue, because it wasn't worth it.  If I had known, I probably would have gone to Maggiano's instead. Oh, finally, the salad. It was swimming in dressing. I ordered the Maggiano's salad for $14. It was just that - lettuce and some tomatoes. I am being critical in that the world of restaurants has made so many innovations in salad that a $14 salad shouldn't be a small plate of greens with dressing that I could have bought at the grocery store.   I love great food and expect it when it is billed as a fine dining restaurant. Mediocre is right. I make better pasta at home than this restaurant. I don't think the chefs understand that people's palate's have changed. We're used to eating at so many great pasta restaurants - Nora's, Buddy Vs, Maggioni's, Wolfgang Puck, and a few more - gosh even California Pizza Kitchen, and I'll say Buca Di Beppo have some solid dishes, so this place is a great disappointment.

This is located in the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas. The atmosphere and the servers are great. But the pasta and seafood dish I had was very spicy. I didn't enjoy it nor did I finish it. Also shouldn't they be playing French music rather than American pop? I enjoyed the Malbec wine.

This place is pretty great. The downside is it is located in old Vegas in the Rio hotel, completely away from everything. The Rio is kind of a scary, smelly place at night. The handmade gnocchis are soooo good. The meatball with ricotta is really great as well. I had the eggplant parm as my entree and it was cooked perfectly. This place would do even better in a better location.

Great service, very friendly staff, intimate ambience. Food was so delicious. I got the shrimp bizby and it was to die for. Perfectly seasoned and cooked, not rubbery or bland at all. The next dish was the meatball and fried mozzarella...again, perfectly seasoned and cooked. I tried some martinis and they were not weak at all. Wide selection of beer and liquor. It was very cozy and romantic, yet somehow it was lively with music and people - perfect balance! I went two nights in a row during my stay at the Paris and it will certainly be my go to place when I'm in Vegas again.

Best Italian restaurant on the strip!!  Beautifully displayed and gourmet cuisine!!  Love their fresh mozzarella and risotto. Scallop and crab dish so delicious!!  Great atmosphere with old movies showing on screens throughout The restaurant.

I was excited to have the opportunity to finally eat here. The atomsphere is dark and modern. I loved it. Our waiter did an excellent job giving us all info necessary on the food and the establishment. He knew the menu very well and explained the items in depth like a pro. I got the meatball and salad for starter. The meatball was huge and made to perfection. It was topped with an incredible red sauce and a nice side scoop of smooth ricotta cheese. It was surrounded by a delicious italian dressing topped salad. For entree i got the carbonara. The serving size was more than enough and it tasted so good with the cream sauce and egg yoke. I have no complaints. None. Next time i'm in Vegas i will be a repeat customer. This place lived up to all expectations.

LOL, this place is a joke, although It's worth a visit just to see how off the wall it is and to bring home a good story of the awkwardness.   I'm a foodie and know for a fact I could cook proteins better than the head "cook". I know for a fact there are better tasting pastas from Sysco. I also know when I can taste a marinara that has a base of canned tomatoes yet it's called "homemade".. I know for a fact that Lipton style instant Iced Tea out of a plastic bottle doesn't cut it as a drink in a restaurant of this price range.   I've traveled Italy, ate at some of the best Italy has to offer and I have a moderate respect for the cuisine, but even if I do over look the under cooked pasta and a horribly dried out meatball and bring it all down to flavor, this place still just doesn't cut it and dont even get me started on the service..   We tried this place on a whim before the Penn and Teller show as it looked to be the closest thing to fine dinning at the Rio, but we should have known better when there are TVs playing the God Father all over the place.. The Rio really needs to up their dinning game.   If you're a foodie, my suggestion is go for a overpriced poorly mixed drink at the bar to experience the train wreck that is Martorano's and take home a story of a "restaurant" you will never forget..  Oh yeah, what the hell was that thing that Martorano's calls bread? Wow, who ever came up with that one needs to be taught the basics of baking bread again..

This restaurant was a  big disappointment, it looks very nice from the outside but the menu, service and food were really very poor.  I ordered the chicken marsala which I have eaten at many restaurants and it didn't come with pasta, mashed potatoes or vegetables, just over salted pieces of chicken.  My girlfriends pasta wasn't any better and the prices for two salads and two meals and one glass of wine was $137.00.  We should have gone to Maggiano's just down the street we would have had a great meal for about $40.00.
Food is so good here!! Great staff. Me and my wife had an awesome birthday meal thanks again to the chefs and front of the house. We will come back soon.

My wife surprised me with dinner place at this place last night for our first time. I was super excited. Been wanting to try this place for a few years and we are locals!   We got seated fairly quickly because my wife made reservations ahead of time. The ambiance was great. Romantic and classy yet hip. Our server was great. Very knowledgeable of the menu and personable. His assistant and the GM were great. Everyone who waited on us was amazing.   I took off a star because the bread wasn't all the great and my chicken parmigiana was kind of boring on the plate. As for the taste it was pretty good, but I don't think it met my expectations for how much each dish was.   I would still recommend though. It was a great date night place.
Seriously delicious. If you're in the area and hungry for an awesome Italian meal, definitely check out Martorano's new location on the Strip!
3 course special for $40 - large shrimp scampi, spaghetti and meatballs and a large cannoli is the best deal around. Great music, atmosphere, staff and food.

Here is the bottom line, if you like your pasta cooked Al Dente, then you will probably like the food. But if you don't like pasta cooked Al Dente, then your out of luck, because they will not cook it any other way. I am not fond of Al Dente, or not being able to have my food cooked the way I want it, so 3 stars is the best I can rate this restaurant. I had the rigatoni in Sunday Gravy (sauce) with pork, and the gravy is very good. I also ordered a side of meatballs (which they give you one large meatball for $12). It was OK, but I have had a lot better and it was certainly not worth the money. The bread served with the meal is authentic delicious Italian bread, served with sides of oil, hot pepper sauce, and grated cheese (although I wish they also included butter as a choice as well). The decor is very sleek and ultra modern, and although it hardly fits the theme of an Italian resturuant, it is a nice looking place. The prices are high for an italian resturuant, but when you take into consideration your eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant, right on the strip, the prices are fairly reasonable. There are certainly many better Italian restaurants in Vegas, but if your staying at the Paris, and don't feel like leaving the hotel, you can get a decent meal here (as long as you like Al Dente pasta!).
Eggplant stack was amazing! Meatballs and gravy, and the gnocchi were delicious.
80s disco Italian restaurant. Yeah you read that right. A total gimmick and a bit cheesy but the food is really good. If you need a meatball while listening to The Bee Gees, then this is your jam.

Typical 'celebrity' restaurant in a big casino. Good place to eat, as long as it's on someone else's dime.  THE ROSES: Fun concept, especially in the bar. There are a battery of large TVs above the bar that offer you a selection of sports and better gangster flicks to watch while you wait for your table. While I was there, I enjoyed scenes from "The Godfather, Part II", and "Copland". Given the noise level in the bar, it would be nice to have the closed captioning turned on, though; there is no way in heck you're gonna hear the dialogue. Food is actually quite good; served family-style (at least on my visits), everything was uniformly quite tasty and well-presented. Service is quite good as well.  THE THORNS: Very loud; not the place you want to go for a quiet, intimate meal. The other big thorn is that while the food and service are quite good, I honestly do think the prices are a bit steep for what you're getting. Unfortunately, this is the New Vegas Model; where the casinos used to offer great dining deals to get folks in the door, these days the larger casinos apparently have no problems packing the suckers in, so they can charge quite a bit. I dined on an expense account, but if I had to pay my own way, I'd have gone elsewhere, as I honestly felt the value for (my) money wasn't there.  THE VERDICT: Loud, boisterous, fun place with great food, but steep prices create a poor Value Factor and so I have to detract at least 1 star.  If you're dining on someone else's dime, have more money than you literally know what to do with, or if the Rio is comping you, by all means go; otherwise, as they say in the mob movies, 'fugheddabboutit'!

Had a horrible experience, first of all our bartender at the bar was ver rude and helped other people at the bar before us. Had he been Sincere and helped us during the course of our drinks. The experience would have been better had he only given me a water, really ruined the experience at this place. I'd be happy if they went out of business because of this horrible experience. Took an hour to even be able to get an appetizer.

Do Not eat here unless you like to eat in a disco environment. Went here with a large group at CES.  Appetizers were very good.  Meatballs yummy.  Meals were good.  But loud music plays nonstop, disco, rap, and other weird songs so loud you cant talk.  Movie scenes are played on 25 TV screens and every now and then the music stops and the movie sound blasts the room.  Horrible dinner environment.  Asked manager if he could lower the volume and he said after 8 they pumped it up because people like it.  Note Friday night in Vegas and this place was half full.  Manager take note.  I will never go back and neither will the Herbs 17 people who were in our party

First time visiting the one at Paris Casino and like the one at Rio Casino they never disappoint. I had the special: Rigatoni Bolognese and it was the best pasta dish I've had at any restaurant. My wife had the Chicken Parmigiano and she said it was the best she ever had. Of course started the meal the world's best tasting meatball.  The server Mike, the manager John and the cook was the most professional and beyond approach when it comes to service. The chef made my dinner twice cause he didn't like how the first one came out and you don't find that commitment to quality and detail like that anymore.  If you come to Vegas and miss this fine dining establishment then you are definitely missing out. Don't walk but run here for a fine dining experience.

Excellent food, Very good servings - and it was fast. One star off however. Apparently owner likes to run his movies as part of the video experience. Maybe - just maybe- a kitschy horror film where there's a decapitation is not the very very very best idea to show when people are eating. I'll come back - get smart (no pun) about the movies and we can get five stars - of course keep the food and service excellent. ok? Ok

This was some of the best Italian food I have ever had. My friend, who is from Philly, also loved it.   I had the chicken marsala without the pasta, they were out of gluten-free and that's the only kind I can eat.  Our table had the Caesar salad and an appetizer special. I don't remember what it was called but it had mozzarella and prosciutto (I think), tomatoes and Italian spices. It was nothing short of heaven (IMO).   On our other visit, we had the meatballs with ricotta (soooo good!) and I tried my friend's Chilean Seabass. I swear I am now ruined for all other Seabass, ever.  If you're in Vegas I highly recommend this place. And if you're staying at The Rio, you shouldn't eat anywhere else in the hotel.
Everything we had was wonderful. From the cocktails, to the salad and main course.  I would highly recommend to anyone in Vegas.

The only good thing about this place is the service. And it looks nice and has a cool ambiance. Besides that, don't waste your money. The portions are small and it was nothing to write home about. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and it was like $20 and came with like 10 pieces of calamari. Seriously? For $20? I thought they were feeding mice. The entrees were nothing special. We had the chicken permigliano (however you spell it). It comes with no sides!!! And it wasn't even good. It was a fried piece of chicken with cheese on top. Seriously don't waste your money. This place sucks. Overpriced and they are greedy with their portions. I only gave it two stars because the server was really nice. But they try pushing you to buy more (sides, alcohol, etc.). I felt like I was looking for a used car.

Beautiful decor and has a nice view of the pool. This place serves your classic italian dishes. i don't like huge portions so I opted with the appetizer section? And i still got a huge meatball with a salad. They had risotto with fish as a special that day, and the risotto i tried was delicious. It was very creamy and flavorful. The bread they serve in the beginning wasn't that good but I would probably come back as they have other dishes that sounded good.

The only way this dining experience could have been worse if if the food totally sucked. It wasn't great, and the service was horrible. We ordered drinks and waited over 10 minutes to receive them. We ordered another round and waited even longer. When our meal was served, the entrees came out at different times and my 'salad and meatball' appetizer came out several minutes after everyone else causing their entrees to be cold by the time we ate. After speaking to the manager, twice, he told us that they serve the food as it comes out and that was the way it came out...not my problem! And the restaurant wasn't even 25% occupied. The food wasn't great, just passable, so all in all, won't be going back there again...ever!

The service was excellent.  Our server was attentive and genuinely friendly.  The bus boy did not let our water get below half full.  The food is tasty.  The bread they bring out is good.  The chili oil dip for it is great.  It has a nice flavor and a little kick.  For my meal I had the philly cheese steak with truffle oil fries.  I love the flavor truffle oil gives fries.  They were great.  The cheesesteak was also pretty tasty.  For desert I had the tiramisu.  It was great.  The flavors were solid and distinct.  My friend had the cheesecake.  It was very good, and was a huge portion.  There is a good wine selection.  It is a bit pricey.  The cheesesteak was $24.  Most of the more formal meals were in the mid 40's.  There are several flat screens televisions through out the dining room.  The Godfather was playing on one, so that made me quite happy.  They also had some games on.
Firs time there had the best veal parmigiana ever. Second time there had the worst veal parmigiana. They need to have consistency with their chefs   So disappointing will not be back.

Best pasta I have ever eaten at a restaurant. I had the Bucatini Carbonara. It was rich, but flavorful and addicting. My gf doesn't even like pasta, but she was impressed with the bite I made her try. I highly recommend this dish and this restaurant. The service was on point. Our server was very professional. The drinks were fantastic too. Lemon drops. The appetizers we had were the Eggplant Stacked and a meatball and cheese appetizer I can't recall the exact name. Both dishes were fantastic. I would recommend the Eggplant Stack. Trust me... Overall I had a great experience. I will be a returning customer.   PS: they have a strict no altering dishes rule. If you're the type that likes to modify your dishes you will not like this place. That being said, I wouldn't change a thing ;)

Food tastes OK, but is highly overpriced. Plus the atmosphere is incongruous with what you would typically associate with high end Italian cuisine because they have loud music blasting in your face while you try to enjoy your meal for most of the time. So you really can't have a nice conversation with your dining partners at this establishment.   What is even more strange is that, when they are finished bombarding you with loud music, they then replace it by showing movies on a bunch of HDTVs with the volume cranked up all the way. I guess the people who work here must be hard of hearing. So definitely don't come here if you prefer a nice quite and relaxing dining experience.  As for me, I've never been in a high priced Italian restaurant that, to me, has the ambiance of the HDTV and audio sections of Best Buy. These guys need to figure out what they are, either a pricey Italian restaurant or an electronics store. Whatever they are, they need to decide fast because the place was almost empty on a Friday night. Too bad, because the dining here is not that bad, just expensive and loud.

Muscle man Steve Martorano serves overpriced East Coast Italian food at his restaurant in the Rio, where we dined with our foodie friends on Sunday evening. Although nothing we had was bad and everything was well-seasoned, I still left with a bad taste in my mouth due to the prices and the atmosphere. Let me give you a mental picture: disco balls, neon lights, over-sized outdoor garbage cans in the bathroom, and blaring music only turned off so you can watch an equally loud scene from the original Ocean's Eleven on one of six flat screens. The light/video/music show is all orchestrated by DJ Martorano himself, who spends more time annoying his customers with noise than paying attention to their food.  His menu is as beefy as his arms, so I would advise vegetarians to stay away. I actually give him credit for his unabashed use of meat, which he prepares well. Since we were a group of four and didn't feel like eating a ton of food, we ordered a bunch of appetizers to split. Their meatball, which they are famous for, is light with balanced meatball elements. It is served with tasty marinara and excellent ricotta, though these features can't justify the $14 price tag (or $18 if you want a microscopic salad to go with it as we realized after the fact).  We then ordered pigs feet, a dish I would say was the highlight of the meal because I don't generally eat pigs feet and they seemed to be prepared well. But it's also possible my enjoyment was due to the abundance of that San Marzano marinara or the relatively inexpensive price ($10). The feet themselves were not terribly meaty, but the accompanying rolled pig skin stuffed with pork was quite enjoyable (if eaten only a few bites at a time) and tasted like thick, chewy pasta (if pasta was pure fat).   Other above average options included; the eggplant stack, which was crispy but heavy, and not served hot ($19); the gnocchi side, which was light enough but not terribly interesting ($14); and the hot peppers stuffed with veal that I enjoyed, but felt had a bit too much crushed red pepper ($18). He also offers an interesting take on carbonara, which he sent to our table gratis because we are locals (Always tell restaurants on the Strip you are local when making a reservation. They usually do a little something extra for you). I can best describe his preparation as spaghetti (though the waitress called it buccatini) tossed in a white bean hummus. The flavor was fine but it had an off-putting mouth feel, and was not worth the $24 price listed. I'm not sure how he can get away with these prices for dishes that are essentially superior preparations of adulterated versions of real Italian food...   P.S. Don't let the waitress talk you into a specialty cocktail. They taste worse than a melted tropical concoction from Fat Tuesdays. And, if you still want to come, do so before 7:30 or you won't even be able to have a conversation with yourself.
Great dinner and service! Veal Park and Lobster were fantastic. Orders all desserts for a birthday and they brought it all out with great flare!

Ah, where should I begin? This place started out rough and only went downhill. Our party of 8 had reservations and the restaurant was not all that busy for a Saturday night...now I understand why. We were told that we could not be seated until all 8 members of our party arrived.-Strike one. We went to the bar to have a drink, but it took so long to navigate the cute little iPad menu that all of our party arrived before we could order a drink. At least we were able to sit at our reserved table. We then sat and waited 15 minutes for a server...did I mention it wasn't that busy? When he did arrive, he impressed us again with an iPad drink menu...for 8 people? Really? I asked for a paper menu and was told that it was not updated. Strike two. Good news, we did get water after 25 minutes! The server was pressuring us along after he made US wait?!? Strike three. I haven't even tried the food yet, and honestly don't care if I do. It's like a nightclub more than a restaurant. I would have asked my fellow diners if they felt it was loud too, but you can't hear each other at all. The noise level is LOUD! Skip it and just go straight to the club.
When I'm hungry for Italian...  ... I see the Martorano's billboard and lose my appetite.

We came here just to try the caesar salad because we heard  so much about it. I must say it was excellent, one of the best Caesar's we've ever had. We also had the shrimp appetizer which was just as good. Bryce and Umberto took excellent care of us. The next time we come we will be sure to ask to sit in Bryce's section. We would highly recommend this restaurant.

If you want to spend $161.00 for food that tastes like Olive Garden then eat here.  Be careful with the waiters daily special. My Chilean Seabass was $62.00, now I think he should of mentioned that when I was looking at ordering the veal for $28.00.  I'm a foodie and I don't mind spending the money on good food but this is nothing special at all.  You pay for the ambience and food presentation.   I learned my lesson - always ask the price of their daily special.

Experience:  my friend invited me to go with her, because she had a comped meal and show.  Lucky me!!    Facility:  it is inside the Rio. I liked the decor...it seems a little more high end than it is. It's pricey, but they show casual movies and clientele are in shorts, t-shirts, and tennis shoes.  All tables and chairs and some bar seating.   Service:  the hostess was rude, treated us like we were bothering her, and ignored me when I was talking to her.  Great first impression!!!!   Our waiter, Ben, on the other hand was amazing!!!  He was so friendly, helpful and professional.  The manager came over and asked how the meal was, and as I told her the pasta was a tad under al dente, she talked right past it. Why ask of you don't care?!  Food:  Well, hmmm...what to say.  It was decent.  Some things amazing!!!  Some things not so amazing.  Bread and oil - 5/5 loved the fresh warm bread and different choices of oil and butter.  Spicy Calamari appetizer - 5/5 the best!!! I loved the flavors of the sauce on this dish. The calamari flavor was overpowered, but they were crispy and I don't care, because the sauce is so good.  Meatball and ricotta on bread - 3/5 it was good, but not amazing. The flavors just didn't impress me and this was the signature of the place....the meatballs.  Carbonara - 2.5/5 the waiter raved about this one. He said people from Italy say it's comparable - nope!  Italy is waaaayyyy better. It was bland to me.  It needed salt and the pasta was undercooked. I like al dente, but this wasn't there yet. I did love that they left the egg yolk for me to stir in.   Overall - nice place, food was decent, but not sure I would be happy to pay $100 without the comp for what we got.  They do have 25% off for locals, so maybe I'll come back and try something else.  But not anytime soon.

The extremely poor service outweighed the delicious food. My daughter had just turned 21 and we were in the mood for some fine Italian food so we made our reservations and arrived right on time. We were seated, but no server was to be found for about 10 minutes. We had no drinks, or water. Finally our server Raymond came over and introduced himself, he was pleasant but dismissive, not even apologizing for the wait. We understand the restaurant may be busy, but maybe more waitstaff should be hired because one server can not handle 12 tables at once. We were looking into getting a bottle of wine and he asked us if we were staying at The Paris Hotel. We said no, but staying at The Cosmopolitan across the street. He kept trying to sell us something we did not want but insisted and made us try it anyway, still not liking it we ordered what we originally wanted. Took another 15 minutes for our bottle of wine to come and be served.  The whole time we noticed the table next to us was a bunch of high rollers, and got anything they wanted. There was every server, bus boy, sommelier helping them the entire service. Our server was barely present the whole time, and was mainly focused on the table next to us. A sommelier did not even show us the bottle of wine that we ordered. Then it came time to order our food, and we were excited because we heard the food was amazing and it certainly did not disappoint. Our first course came, we got the meatball salad and it was divine. I noticed though that every other table that got salad got it served to them by their server, in which we did not. Not a big deal, but bad front of house service for sure. Our main entrees were fantastic as well, we got the chicken parmigiana and veal parmigiana. Excellent food, kudos to the kitchen. Overall it was extremely poor service, which is very upsetting due to how good the food was.   Will not be returning due to the service.

If I could choose 0 star, I would do that.  We  were yesterday, Sunday the 25th table of 7 people.  We had the worse server ( The blond lady) with attitude and over 'I work by the book'.  Just to mention we are Diamond guest who spend 10-20K a night in the casino.   First she said on what ever we ask to change or add or remove from a dish ( My wife is pregnant)  ' No! I can't. You can see in the menus no changes at all' and after I asked a few times to ask the kitchen and begging , She came back and said 'oh it's ok the will do it for you'. It happened a few times.   Then one of the pasta dish wasn't cooked, And we know more than her one or two things about pasta, She said it should be like that. 'If you wanna change and make a new one it will take you 40 min for a new pasta'. Are you serious !?! She didn't want us to order a new one.  And so we said yes, And guess what? It took 20 min, half of the time she said.  When we said we don't want it because of her bad service, She was  laughing on front of our face with the manager.  One more thing, The pasta is not fresh, and costs 35$ and up for a poor basic marinara pasta. SHAME on Paris hotel that they let this restaurant to be opened there!  Don't go there. Poor menu, WORSE SERVICE.  Super expensive, You better go eat with this prices at Gordon Ramzi restaurant or Mom ami Gabi, X10 times better value for your money , 10X better menu and food quality and the most important you get an excellent service there.

Truly in my opinion the finest most flavor packed Italian food I have tasted in Vegas. Simple ingredients, but so well balanced and perfectly cooked. Nice elegant place. I tried the veal lemon piccata and it was simply amazing . I tried their signature meatballs with fresh ricotta cheese.... And they were simply "WOW" so authentic and packed with flavor... My mouth waters for them even now. Their spaghetti had a wonderful marinara with great toasted garlic and chili, it was top notch on every level . Staff was great and attentive. I spent years mocking the owner because he looks like a juiced up guido from the jersey shore, and I thought what does he know about food? My wife dragged me to his restaurant because she wanted to try something different in Vegas . I was truly humbled  and I stand corrected . This owner knows Italian food intimately and passionately. I respect the man and can't wait to go back on my yearly Vegas trip. You will not be disappointed with this food

Unfamiliar with Martorano, I was pleasantly surprised with this restaurant.  Overall, the look has a very modern/trendy feel to it, though admittedly a little confusing with the random mob/action movies playing on all the TV's periodically turning up over the sound system for certain scenes, only to fade back into the dj's mix.  Food wise---I enjoyed the meatball over fried mozzarella. The meatball was sizable, tender, delicious and of course fried mozzarella---what more need be said.  My entrée was the lasagna which is better than average, but not necessarily anything to get too excited about.  What I did quite enjoy, however, was the wife's risotto with shrimp and scallops.  Quite possibly one of the best things I've ever tasted.  The risotto was so buttery and rich with each bite--completely flavorful, and the seafood cooked perfectly.  If I were to go back, I would certainly order that.  The price point was a little high, but as expected for this sort of restaurant on the strip in Vegas and certainly not outrageous.  Waiters were attentive and food brought promptly.  Overall good experience.
I really liked this place. Excellent service and food was great. Had the steak and it was amazing.
Came here solo (long story) while in town. Server Paul was charming and informed and made me feel welcome. Delicious food, fun music. Loved it and will be back!

I was impressed with the atmosphere of this restaurant. The decor is pretty upbeat and unique. They have several tvs which play old movies and at some point they dim the lights and play loud music. It's a pretty fun place if you are in the mood to party. However, if you are not it can be very dark and too loud for dinner.   They have a large variety of dishes. I highly recommend the homemade mozzarella. There are a few dishes with it, so you have several opportunities to try it. For my main entree I ordered the tailgate pasta which comes with ground beef, veal and pork. The dish is super meaty and the pasta was perfectly cooked.   For my dessert I ordered the carrot cake. This dish was good, but easy to forget. Unfortunately they do not have a lot of options for desserts. I felt the five options available were very mediocre.  The service was also ok. The staff was friendly but it took about 45 minutes to get our main entree. Overall, a good option if you are feeling like having Italian food with a great atmosphere.

I had wanted to try Martorano's for a while as it seemed like it would be a great dinner spot.  While restaurants can be hit or miss, they did everything right from start to finish.  We were promptly greeted at check in, as was every party arriving.  We were lucky to have Paul as our server.  What more can I say than "wow" about his professionalism, knowledge and hospitality.  He spoke about the menu with a sincere passion for his role as ambassador to our table.  With items I would never order (vegetarian) he spoke about the menu with such confidence and intimate knowledge that he was sharing an insiders look more than just suggestive selling.  The menu was amazing.  Paul prepped us for a fabulous ride and it did not let us down once.  The freshly made mozzarella made it a necessity to have it to start.  We had their version of caprese and fried mozzarella that was evident that everything was made fresh and with love.  Indeed Paul's presentation of the menu was a love story and homage of the chefs vision and passion.   Portlons were abundant and full of flavor where you savored each bite.  Penne a la vodka was exceptional and chicken dish huge.  While the menu consisted of fresh and simple ingredients, it was the symphony of flavors and presentation that made it perfect.  Overall, a great experience from Start to finish and I would not hesitate in recommending it!  I can't wait to return!

" FAST FOOD IN PARIS"  Guest of this establishment during V day 2016. Was excited to spoil my gf to fine dinning VEGAS-STYLE.  What we experienced instead was fast food fine dinning at it's best. It took more than a few minutes for our waiter to introduce himself and serve water.   We ordered philly steak sandwich and Shrimp spaghetti. As expected from menu we were asked to be patient for food, as it was "made to order".  We received what I felt was market prepared bread everyone boasts about.    After more than 20min when the food finally arrived I was pissed!!!  The philly sandwhich ($18.00) looked like a complete mess.  I felt that it was purchased from Costco frozen food sandwhich.  The spaghetti was warm-cold not hot as I expected from a freshly prepared entree.  Shrimp was prepared perfectly, wild caught.  The calamari was a F'n JOKE!  It was frozen.....Yo Cuz!  You fed me a frozen entree??????  When it came time to pay this establishment inquired about my experience.  I gave them a "D" rating simple fact that it was terrible!  I gave this establishment 2 stars for two reasons; Incredible ambiance & MGR inquiring about our experience prior to completion of our meal.   I will not be returning.....

Hubby and I came here for anniversary dinner since we were staying at the Rio anyways and was recommended by friends.  We both loved the chili olive oil for dipping the bread (different spin and good).  Hubby ordered the Pescadora (Lobster, Clams, and Shrimp over Linguini in a Red Sauce)  Per hubby the seafood was AMAZING but the linguini with red sauce was just okay and not as flavorful as he was expecting.  I had the Famous Meatball Salad and although the meatball was VERY good as was the salad.  Overall the whole dish was too salty for me.

Five stars is difficult for me to give at eatiing establishments, but Mataranos really delivered some knockout flavor profiles.  The service was top notch, the menu is simple but elegant. Get The Cheese!  Because WOW and you are welcome!
Went there today for dinner before a show.   Fantastic! The food had amazing flavor, service was on point and the vibe of the place was great.

I'm glad I did not read the reviews before i went.  I thought it was great  The girlfriend and I went for dinner after a show.  We were seated near the bar, with a view of the walking area outside the restaurant and could see into the restaurant as well.  The music was interesting, not what i would expect, but since I was a child of the 80s, i enjoyed it a lot.  I guess they have a dance floor as well, since they were playing a lot of 80s and 90s hip hop and dance music.  I liked it, but we did not dance...  I thought the food was good.  We shared the Fusilli Pollo and it was enough for two of us, with an appetizer.  We had good service and the price was good as well  It's not a chain that you see in every town, and that's what we were going for.  And it was close to the hotel...

Oh I'm sorry but I cannot leave this a bad review at all when I came here to this particular location with my friends from New Jersey we happen to walk by right as they were opening the restaurant and what do you know it was like we hit the jackpot lottery I swear to God it was crazy we were there first table and chef Martorano was there!  He kept coming toward table and bringing us food that we didn't order There were other tables in the restaurant that were two tops but it was so strange because I didn't think that we were the first actual people to be seated I think that maybe we were there first party of six It was my girlfriend Sheridan's birthday that we were celebrating I didn't get the bill if there even was one but my friend had said that the chef had hoped it up somehow it was crazy I'm sorry but I thought the food was good and I will never forget how this big jumbo macho Italian guy with the muscles came up to us and were so friendly and was talking to us I'm not sure that even realised it was Chef Martorano at that point until we had left  I don't know about these other experiences but I had a nice time plus the booze always helps

My group comes here each time we visit. The food is always great. Love the cheese steak, scallops, and chicken Parmesan. Raymond and Francisco were fabulous servers, we had a group of twelve and they managed us very well. Wonderful food and great service!

Love going to the spot great service great energy great atmosphere I had the seafood fra Diablo delicious Evis was the bartender or waiter did an outstanding job also the bread with a hot olive oil dip was ridiculous

This is not authentic Italian. But it's authentic NYC Italian. There's a difference. You don't want to go here for an authentic Tuscan dish, but if you want some spaghetti and meatballs, or what I had - the rigatoni with short ribs in "Sunday gravy," was amazing. There's a barrier between comfort food and high-end cuisine in Vegas. But sometimes you don't want a $100 steak...some home-style pasta and sauce hits the spot. And at $28 for my entree, it actually was a very affordable place with n upscale feel. My meal at Martorano's was exceptional. Filling and delicious.  My only complaint is that the drinks are ridiculously priced. I paid $28 for my entree and $26 for 2 Jim Beam drinks (their house bourbon). Sorry, but Jim Beam is not a $13 per drink bourbon. Especially when drinks are measured exactly in jiggers and the bartender doesn't have the option of making it a bit stronger to please the guest. I'm not so upset about the booze content except that they weren't able to make a drink to my liking because it was 75% mixer.  Next time, I'll do beer. Safer and cheaper. But overall, love this place. Affordable but still pretty upscale. Down to earth with the food, but the drinks are outrageous. I'm basing this review solely on the food - not the drinks. Five stars all the way for food, and this is a restaurant after all, so I'll let the drink prices slide.

Service was impeccable! Make a reservation and no wait! Food is to die for... Large portions so come hungry!  Wine list awesome and reasonably priced. Thank you for a perfect meal... We will be coming back soon.

After a great meal at Capo's on Saturday night we ventured over to the Rio for a shot at Cafe Mortarano Las Vegas located in the Rio Hotel 2nd floor over in the Mardi Gras wing. Arriving to the same look and feel from their other two locations in South Florida, I have to admit other than poking my head inside at the Hard Rock Location, I had not yet tried any of the locations for a dining experience.  I have read mixed reviews from everyone and spoken to many persons in and about south FLA who either swear by the place or think it should be black listed. I thought I'd give my own opinion after this event. Arrived as stated Sunday night 9PM very empty for a Holiday weekend, and I'm guessing the Rio Location is the cause. If this place was in one of the more mainstream malls you probably couldn't get into the place.  After some drinks with Bethany at the bar, we moved to our appointed table 5 of us to dine this evening.   Scott our friendly waiter gave us a rundown and we ordered up some appetizers that showed up in no particular order or together but this is the way it's done as I understand everything fresh & hot.  Homemade Meatball with gravy and ricotta cheese $14, South Philly Cheese steak with caramelized onions and American cheese on a crisp Italian roll $16 and Eggplant Stack with homemade mozzarella, tomato and arugula $23 were the 3 appetizers we chose to share.  Bread was hot and fresh and every single one of the above were 100% on the money.    We decided on 4 entrees for dinner to split for 5 persons. First was Shrimp Scampi Bread with butter, garlic, tomato, peas and bread crumbs $18 which was an appetizer order that we asked to be bumped up to 5 jumbo shrimp one for everyone.  Veal Cutlet Parmigiana with tender cutlet of veal and fresh mozzarella $30 a Linguine and Fresh Clams in light red or natural white juices $25 and the absolute last but not least Rigatoni with a Sunday Pork Gravy made with fresh pork, San Marzano tomatoes and ricotta cheese $28.     All I can say is there was not one single solitary thing left in any plate, the food was absolutely delicious on every level, and although I was told family style meant large portions (They aren't) it was a sufficient amount of food to go around.  Two bottles of wine were consumed on moderately priced list, and the 70's disco music in the place was absolutely perfect.  Scott was an Excellent server and giving my own unbiased opinion this was a winner from every vantage point that I can find.   A definite repeat for me on my Vegas runs and will give the Original South Florida location a go when I get a chance. Enjoyed my best meal in Vegas in some time.

We ate at the bar for quicker service. It would have been a 15min wait, but we were meeting friends, so we wanted to be in and out. Also, we weren't really prepared for a nice meal at a candlelit table, so this was just fine. (We were misleaded by the CAFE in the name).   We ordered a Ziti with Hot and Sweet Sausage and Penne and Vodka. (from Rio webiste; official website does not have updated menus). Both were very good with big portions. We also had a side of bread with some dips that were interesting. There was the usual olive oil, but there was also a spicy dip, kind of like chinese spicy hot sauce (weird, not really my kind of dip). The service was spot on... the bartender would refill our water glasses when needed and checked on us periodically.  On a side note, Steve Martorano looks like a UFC fighter that just happens to own this restaurant. I'm not sure i'd trust him as a chef. Oh, and the prices were higher than i would have expected, but then it's vegas

Great service! The food was good-- a little pricey. We ordered the calamari, sweet and spicy shrimp, and the salad for appetizer. They were all great. For the main course-- we got the chicken, steak, spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were a little salty.  Overall, the food was good and service was great!!! Took off one star for the price -- as it is not a fancy restaurant with a steep price.

Went here on a Sunday evening with a party of 6.  Caesar salad and canoli  were the best parts of the meal, everything in between was just average, and overall everything was WAY overpriced.   Service was adequate but not what you would expect for the prices on the menu.  The atmosphere was not appropriate in our opinion; the music and the movie clips (bloody scenes from Casino and other mob type movies) just did not make any sense to us for a place to feel comfortable eating. Caesar salad was well dressed with a good dressing and croutons, and was a very nice sized portion, enough to share. We (tried to) split the stuffed clams appetizer, but only 2 of our party could eat it because it was so greasy and way too spicy.  I love stuffed clams but have never tasted any with quite as much red pepper as they put in it. For the main dishes, one person in out party ordered the Chicken Parm.  It was a decent sized piece of chicken, but for 24 dollars it comes all by itself on a plate, no side of pasta or anything.  I have heard of the a la carte menu items on a steakhouse menu but would it really be hard to add a little mound of pasta? The chicken marsala and gnocchi were pretty tasty, even though the chicken was on the salty side.  They are very heavy-handed on the salt and cheese, especially the ricotta scoops they put in the bowls of spaghetti and meatballs, which a few of us had.  The pasta was cooked nicely, the sauce was very one-note in my opinion, and the 'famous' meatball was just average.  My mom has been making it better for years, and everyone at the table agreed.   I would not go back there unless I just wanted the salad and cannoli, and even then I might just get it to go.

Great wine. Weird atmosphere. Inside Paris on a fake paris street. Calamari was excellent.  Service was good. Over priced. Ordered the lobster. Good enough. Would never come back here. So many better restaurants. So expensive. And a stupid atmosphere.

The best damn Italian I've had since I was back on the Least Coast!! Service was excellent - the Veal and the Pasta (Bolognese of the day) and Salads were simply delicious and just perfecto. Multo Beni boys!! We will be back whenever we can. In Vegas Italiano is a must and this may be the very best in town.

The only reason why I making this a three star review, is the fact that the meatball salad was off the charts and the wait staff was very courteous. They're claiming the best chicken Parmesan in Las Vegas, if that's the best then I'd hate to see the worst because it was soggy and not very good at all. We had the flat pasta bolognese and it was so salty it was barely edible. I will eat there again solely for the meatball salad and the Motz appetizer.

I have been to the RIO a zillion times. This was the first time i visited this place. It is tucked way back in the corner of the masquerade tower area. Kinda of odd location..i wouldn't be thrilled if it was my place. Anyways....My pops had the seafood pasta special was solid with nice big pieces of creatures from the deep..definetly not chincy or low grade. I had the chicken pasta was also good. The only thing is i had it to go so it wasnt totally as nice when you get it at the table but it was good. Its not cheap like anything in a hotel its a bit costly for what you get. The guy who owns the place looks like vin diesels dad lol...yo rocky!...hes just another character in a city full of them..he fits right in :)
Great food, exhuberant service in sidewalk style but filteted noise and little smoke.

Surprisingly good!  Best pizza I have ever enjoyed in LV.  Light and crispy crust, balanced toppings, super fresh tasting.   Prices a little high, but the service from the bartender was phenomenal. A fly landed in our drink, and they comped the beverage.   Totally unexpected and indicative of the overall great service.  Will definitely return and try more items.

I really disliked this place, and most of the food we ordered.  The decor is nice, black and white. With blue lighting along the bar and the kitchen, which is open (about a 1/3 wall) at the back of the restaurant.  The environment is odd. From the outside it looks like a typical classy restaurant, but once you're in it's a different story. "Yo cuz" is plastered all over the place, I'm guessing that's the chef's catchphrase. Several tv's around the room were playing Mystic River (a great movie but would not be my first choice for a dinner - the concept of having a distracting t.v. while in an " elegant" restaurant was off-putting) while funk and disco music played a little too loud.  They try to be trendy and modern, the menus are backlit and the server brings over and iPad that he uses to go over the specials and which serves as a cocktail menu/shop/dessert menu, but doesn't actually serve to order.  The servers were very professional and friendly, and provided their recommendations when we asked.  The fried mozzarella stack was very good, but a bit pricey. $22 seemed a bit much.  The main courses were not very good particularly when factoring in their cost. $28 for what amounted to 6 chicken fingers in marsala was a bit steep, and the carbonara, although a generous portion, was not very good either. The risotto was a little too al dente for my taste, although the portion was generous.  There are a lot of better dining options in Vegas.

anyone who reviewed this place must have not been to the original martoranos! Why this place wasnt packed when we went there on a saturday night is beyond me! The food was the best! I know italian food and this was excellent! The staff was attentive and our waiter recomended the eggplant stack, the best app i had in all my time in vegas!!!! we shared the veal for our main and it too was excellent.  This place would do great if it was like the one on lauderdale. I wonder why it isnt.   This is real italian food, not the olive garden! i thought it was great! im shocked at the other reviews. and the prices werent bad for vegas

I was able to go here with my uncle because he had a free meal voucher here through Paris.  I enjoyed my experience over all but I feel like the prices do not match the ambiance. The ambiance looks like a lower class Italian restaurant whereas the prices match something more elegant. I feel like they couldn't decide which direction they wanted to go in.   I ordered the three course meal paired with wine. For the first course the wine was paired with the food but for the next two courses our food came before the wine. I feel that the wine should have been brought out first so I could enjoy it throughout the whole meal instead of having to wait for it.   I also wanted to order a coke but our waiter was never in sight. I probably saw every other server but him. He was nice but I just felt he was absent when we needed him. (Side note: I never ended up ordering the coke.)  The food was good though. I started with the meatball which was tender and paired with red sauce and peppers. For the second course I ordered bucatini with red sauce. That was also good and I was lucky enough to have leftovers to take to work the next day. For dessert I ordered their cannoli. I loved it and paired with the sweet dessert wine it tasted really good.   Good food, just ok service and ambiance.   I enjoyed it here but just sub par.

Reservation is recommended!  Our server, Brandon, was very good. He made sure our food and drinks were served on time.   The busser/assistant was also great! Very on top of his game making sure we had our waters and our plates were out of the way.   Food was of good quality. The pasta was perfectly definitely al dente.   They're very accommodating about birthdays, so don't be afraid to ask ;)
Cuzzzzz... best Italian restaurant ever. Atmosphere is good and the food well... you can't get better Italian anywhere in Vegas. Evis is a world class bartender who remembers your drinks and order:
Mozzarella was excellent!! Spaghetti al pomodoro was a work of art !!! Beautiful!!! Affordable pricing with quality products

Great service & excellent food. The fried Mozzarella is out of this world good. My wife ordered and enjoyed the Penne ala Vodka, and I had the Braised Short Rib Bolognese. Both were delicious. We will be dining here again. Chris the Jewish / Mexican was our server and was  so much fun attentive. Cheers.

there was a lot of hyperbole regarding this eatery, so we had to give it a go. when we entered this establishment, our party of four were seated in the main dinning area, much to our chagrin, we were greeted with a cacophony of music, blasting at extreme decibel levels! really?  it was so invasive, that we could not hear ourselves think, let alone carry on a conversation, between consenting adults.   i thought obama had outlawed excessive sound torture, were we to be waterboarded next?  also, there were these funky lights, swirling non-stop throughout the room, really? therefore,  a person is not only unable to speak to your guests, but because of the lighting, you couldn't see them! really?    as a result, we were moved to the outside dinning area, thank you god! once outside, we could at least take advantage of our vision, hearing and remaining senses and  engage in the social pleasantries, associated with fine dinning.  our review of the meals met with mixed results; the appetizers of meatball (yes only one) with a salad, was very good, as was the fresh mozzarella.  however, the main courses of eggplant, ordered by two of our party, was over salty and appeared to have been made sometime in advance. this is against their freshly made food mandate, listed by the owner on the menu, really? they were going to return these dishes but since this place is run by a former mafia chieftain, they decided discretion was the better part of valor and life. my meal, chicken sicilian, was one of the worst meals i have ever been served! the chicken was covered in a thick  sauce, which was made of primarily olive oil and grease! the peppers, which were supposed to add spice and flavor were uncooked! so this chicken dish should really sleep with the fishes, which they will also not eat!  the last dish of spaghetti, was enjoyed by my wife.   so if you desire to go to a place where you don't want to see or hear from your friends, family or associates, martorano's is the place for you, but not me!

SPOILER ALERT   Here's an example of the impact of ambiance on the dining experience.   There are lots of TVs in the dining area and when we sat down they were showing The Untouchables (with the sound muted) on all but one.   SPOILER ALERT   I had never seen this movie but now I have seen part of the end, including the bit where Costner's character throws a guy off a building and   SPOILER ALERT   After gravity dude takes several physics-defying seconds to fall through the roof of a car  APPETITE SPOILER ALERT   The camera gives the viewer a shot of what gravity dude looks like after his trip down.  So when it was time to place an order, I wasn't very hungry.  Those of you who know the movie know it ended soon after that scene. Then they started showing The Godfather.   SPOILER ALERT   Those of you who are familiar with this movie know that the scene with the horse's head came up soon after.
Simply amazing! Food was excellent as was the service! If you like homemade Italian food you will love Martorano's.

*  Welcome Experience -  Blatantly Bad  Had the same obnoxious vibe as the decor.  I actually got the impression that the hostesses thought we were lucky to be there.  It's odd, like the employees are "drinking the kool-aid!    *  Establishment -  Blatantly Bad  This place was obnoxious!  Even for Vegas!  Figure out what you're going to be!  And when you do, STOP taking yourselves so seriously!  The endless photos and looping videos of this owner were over the top obnoxious.  I thought it was humor at one point.  Ugh.   *  Service -  Discouraging  The staff seemed indifferent, until I started asking questions about the owner and the decor.  They CAME TO LIFE talking about the "story" of the owner who started as a DJ and spoke so fondly of him.  It was a bit off-putting really.  Then I asked for a substitution and they gleefully pointed at the NO SUBSTITUTIONS banner at the bottom of the menu.   NOPE.  If there's one thing I can't stand it's a restaurant that posts "no substitutions" anywhere.  Combine that with the odd gaudy decor, looping video of the odd owner and odd sense of pretentiousness from the staff, I was baffled.  *  Food Quantity / Quality / Presentation -  Ordinary  My entree was ordinary.  Really just ok.  The bread, however was OUTSTANDING.  It really shined with the olive oil.  Very good.  We were a party of seven and everyone's dish was just ok.   *  What I'll remember  The gaudy decor, the odd sense of "brainwash" that seemed to captivate the pretentious staff, the endless looping video of the garish owner making pasta.  I'm chuckling as I write this.  So strange.  *  What I can't wait to forget  The gaudy decor, the odd sense of "brainwash" that seemed to captivate the pretentious staff, the endless looping video of the garish owner making pasta.
Awesome food and great service. This is a must if you're in vegas!! The meatballs are truly famous. Our waiter Brandan was simply the best.

Food was okay. Bread was nothing spectacular; focaccia would have been much more appropriate. Fried calamari was good. Penne pasta with pancetta was nothing taste worthy. Saffron risotto was just eh. Service from waiter could have been more attentive, especially since there were several unoccupied tables for at least ten minutes.  Hostesses were helpful and friendly.

The chicken parmigiana was absolutely perfect. Large portion, great taste, excellent. I would recommend getting this.  Good service and setting. They also serve bread with olive oil. It is very good and super heavy, so coupled with the chicken, you will be beyond full. No need for a side of pasta or salad unless you want it or are sharing.  I give this restaurant a five stars, highly recommend for the food I had.

We went to this restaurant as a fluke.  We picked up our tickets for the Penn and Teller show and decided to have dinner on site.  We saw there was Gaylord Indian restaurant and were so excited to eat there. Alas, the restaurant closed its doors permanently the week before.  So it was suggested we eat at this restaurant instead.  We should have just driven down the street to the In-n-Out burger for what we endured.   We had to eat at the bar since the dining room was booked up. So we sat next to similar patrons trying kill time before the show.  I noticed immediately that most had left most of their food on their plates. That should have been the warning sign!  We first ordered the spicy calamari.  Can you say rubber! They're we're deep fried rubber bands.  Next was our pasta dishes.  On the menu, there was a " disclaimer" that they serve their pasta " al dente".  Now we are from Chicago and know Italian food and what al dente is like.  This was NOT al dente!  What we ate was under cooked and tasteless.  I had the spaghetti marinara and my boyfriend clams with pasta.  After the first bite, we both asked for Parmesan cheese and pepper to doctor the taste. It literally took 3 hefty servings of Parmesan cheese to put any flavor or mask the tasteless of the meal.  What added insult to injury, was the price. We paid $99 (with tax and tip) for this atrocity!  If you stay at the Rio or go there for a show do not waste hard earned money, time or taste buds  trying to digest a meal here.  You will just go home feeling frustrated and a little queasy!

The service was terrible (the waiter ignored that I wanted tap water and "upsold" a huge bottle of flat, even though I was dining alone... $7.50).  He neglected to bring me a second glass of wine.  I had the 'special' of lasagna, the sauce had zero flavor (and they were very stingy with it), the sausage/meat mix was terrible, chunks of spice and then chunks of zero flavor.  The homemade mozzarella was good, but definitely didn't make the dish worth the $36 price tag. If you are looking for excellent Italian in Vegas, keep walking.

Overall a good meal. Had meatballs, lasagna and scallops as our group shared. Scallops were a little overcooked but everything else was tasty and service was good. Our server was a little slow, but he tried given it was busy.

It was a hot day in Vegas and the first thing I asked for was a glass of water.  "No tap water, you need to buy a bottle.  House rules."  They gave me a glass of ice and allowed me to wait for it to melt.  We got an eggplant parmesan appetizer that was drenched in far too much salty balsamic vinegar.  The "fresh" buffalo mozzarella cheese was the toughest, most rubbery mozz I've ever had.  Fell way below expectations for a $25 appetizer.  Finally, the atmophere was bizarre with old-school Italian dark woods and black and white photos of various actors, but the room is flooded with wacky pink and blue neon lights.  With so many other dining options in Vegas, don't waste your time and money on this place.

After arriving in our room at Paris about 8 pm, my daughter and I decided to eat in the hotel.  We don't particularly do steakhouses, but wanted a substantial meal to share after a long day of travel.  The lasagna was recommended by an employee; it was not on the menu.  There seems to be an "off the menu" menu which you have to know to ask for.  They were out of the lasagna so we chose shrimp over spaghetti with a lemon butter sauce and the "famous" meatball salad.  The meatball was dense and just ok; the salad was drowning in dressing and basically inedible.  The pasta dish was again just ok.  Mind you, we had no alcohol, one salad, and one entree.  The bill was in the vicinity of $88!  For that kind of money, I expect much, much more. Mediocre, at best.

This was AMAZING Place. The food was sooooo good. Our waiter Paul was great. A little bit of a salesman when it came to the menu. Trying to sell the food off the menu was pretty smart Paul. But great service funny guy. The mozzarella with the tomatoes were so delicious. The calamari was very tender and the fresh ricotta with meatballs was to die for. I am glad I trusted him because he knew what he was talking about when it came to the food. Everything was so fresh. I am so going there next time. I wish I can find a restaurant over here in the valley.  Never tasted anything like it.

Great service. The menus are tablets that are back lit for anyone who has trouble seeing in semi-dark rooms. I had the spaghetti with fresh tomatoes and roasted garlic, which was very good. The bread side came with cheese, olive oil, and a pepper oil - all of which were good. The room is filled with TVs showing old movies with subtitles. I'd  return to this place. Great service, great food, and a great location.

I stayed at the Rio with a small group of friends for one night and we wandered a bit to find this place. The menu sounded appealing and at the thought of carbs and red wine, we jumped.   We were told the way would be 25-30 mins are were surprised when barely 15 mins went by and we were seated in the loudest restaurant I've ever been in. There were five of us and we sat at a large round table and could not hear each other other across the table without shouting and making hand signals. It was ridiculous, although we made the best of it and mostly just laughed at each other trying to understand what the person next to us was saying.  After asking the server to repeat what he had said six times we asked how he managed to keep say in a place so loud. He said he used to wear earplugs. I asked if people complain often, and he said yes, but the chef, this Martorano guy, apparently says if people don't like it, they can just leave. Great business model.   What was even stranger was the movie breaks that came on the TV. A loud, obnoxious song would be playing, and then some iconic clip from a movie would start playing and it was so, so distracting. Don't go hear if you'd like to have a conversations with your tablemates.  The service was okay, but not great. Our server forgot to give us the specials menu after we asked for it and came to take our order and we reminded him of his error. He also forgot an appetizer we had ordered. Who knows if he was just forgetful, or couldn't  hear us.  The food was good, but over-priced, even for Vegas. It didn't blow me away and I could get cheaper, better made food on the strip. I don't need to pay $18 for a meatless entree with canned tomatoes, a leaf of basil and a few cloves of garlic.   Overall, I was pretty unimpressed.

Had an AMAZING dinner here!  Stayed at the Rio and wandered in for dinner not knowing what to expect.  Waiter was very helpful in ordering.... we split the caesar salad (delicious except we asked for anchovies and they were not frsh, most likely canned) and the fried mozzerella and they were awesome!  The fried mozzerella "bricks" had a spicy tomato sauce which was to die for.  Entree was rigatoni with pork which was great but we were stuffed by then.  Best meal we had in Vegas!  A little loud in the dinning room but worth it for the great dinner!!!!  Would go back!  DELICIOUS!

A friend of mine had came here a while back and he would always mention it to me. He raved and raved about it so for his birthday we made the trip out here. I continued to tell him that it probably wasn't going to taste as good as he remembered it but that we'd go anyways.   The food is freshly made to order. The hand stretched mozzarella cheese was delicious until they brought our calamari dish out. I ordered a white sauce clam dish and well I guess I'm not a clam sauce type of girl. I couldn't swallow it down. It was too "fishy-scented" for me or whatever that even means to me. I did nibble off someone else pollo chicken pasta dish but honestly with appetizers that good it was hard to compare. The service was great and the bill was great too aka expensive. I wouldn't return because the birthday boy raved about a pork pasta dish that I can't eat. Never say never though maybe appetizer pit stop? Only time will tell. Yeah my review was plain and simple I guess it was just like my dinner.
Italian food is top notch. Have the meatball salad and the Chicken Sicilian, that's all you need.
This place was GREAT. shout out to the server MIKE, he was AWESOME. Also to the busser JAIME he was funny and very attentive.  the food was DELICIOUS!! The service was AMAZING. loved it all.

Yo cuz?" more like, "Yo clown!" I don't understand the hype. I couldn't even find information about this chef on Google. The Italian food was subpar. We had the salad and meatball, penne alla vodka, and chicken parm. The meatball was dry and hard. The salad was fresh and crisp, but we didn't enjoy the meatball sauce in the lettuce. The penne alla vodka was a good size serving, but lacked flavor.   Atmosphere - Don't get me wrong I'm a millennial and we're attached to our phones, but the light up menus and ordering cocktails through an iPad was tacky and unproductive. The Disco Balls hanging from the ceiling and the large Virgin Mary statue was confusing and made me uncomfortable. If you're looking for good Italian food on the strip try LAVO or take a hike to Summerlin for Parma by Chef Marc

The only thing good about this restaurant was the food. Our waiter took our food order before even asking if we a wanted a drink. We were presented our "specials" on an iPad. Who wants to hear about a $52 piece of pork from an iPad picture. The place has sports playing on the flatscreens and disco balls hanging from the ceiling with waiters dressed as paper boys from the 40's. I have no idea what this restaurant is trying to be. Our waiter never came over to check on our meal and we were never asked if we wanted another drink. Our dessert was presented on an iPad. There's nothing 5 Star about this restaurant but the food.

Like eating pasta in the center of a discoteque? As if to outdo the cacophonous chaos of the slot machines on the Rio casino floor below, Cafe Martorano pumps the music so loud I can only make my point by spelling it in capital letters: THE MUSIC IS TOO FUCKING LOUD. You know when a waiter asks if you're ready to order and it usually goes along the lines of, "Are you ready to order?" Well, here at super hiptastic Cafe Martorano, it goes like this: "***********?"  The asterisks denote what apparently was talking, but all I got from the waiter was a screwed-up face like are you gonna respond.  Well, I have no idea what you just said. The sound system is blasting "Boogie Shoes," and there's a spotlight blinding me every two seconds, and I'm supposed to order from a menu I can't read unless the strobe hits it? I pointed to the pasta I wanted (Orecchiette with Hot and Sweet Sausage, $38), and sure enough it arrived at my table about half an hour later. Maybe they give you extra time for dancing. The portion was huge, the sauce tasty but heavy, and I ate about half of it while watching the party people in the place get freaky to flat-screen displays of Matt Damon taking a bullet to the head.
Still the best! Came here after a few mediocre meals and was SOOO happy with my spaghetti and meatball dinner!

We were in Las Vegas just recently and had heard about this great place from a friend. So we decided to try it out.  I had the Linguini with clam sauce and the calamari.  It was so delish!!  Our waitress, Jessica was awesome.  So friendly, knowledgable about the menu and gave us excellent service. She made our experience at Martorano's just that much better.  We will definitely be going back and asking for Jessica.

I had high expectations for Martorano's because my Italian friend was raving about it.  Unfortunately I really wasn't impressed.  We started with the Calamari in sweet chili sauce which I thought was horrible.  It was a really easy way to ruin calamari.  Two of my friends liked it, and one thought it was edible.  I guess the deal with this restaurant is that Mr. Martorano knows Italian food and he makes it the way he likes it.  I am NOT rushing to eat dinner at his house.  It was a very Northern Italian style that was heavy on the meat.  His famous meatballs are a mixture of veal, pork, and beef.  I don't eat veal and I'm not really a pork eater so I was not interested there.  The rest of the menu was really lacking.  There was no gnocchi or risotto, only one fish option, and really no salad.  I think if I want some spaghetti, I can make that at home (and better).  So most of the entrees are around $20-$25.  When the waiter said that there was a special of Chilean sea bass, I decided to go for it.  It did come with some awesome spinach with huge chunks of garlic and the herb crust was good, but the sauce was drowning the fish.  It was really heavy.  Although it was my fault for not asking, I was REALLY surprised to see that the sea bass was $48.  The service was seriously lacking as well.  We told our server that we had show reservations and needed to be in and out quick, but he was really slow and often seemed confused about what was on the menu and maybe even just life in general.  He also did a weird crumb relocation rather than cleaning before the main courses arrived.  He started to scrape up the crumbs, but just left the piles he made on the table.  He also started to tidy up a little spill, but half way through just left it.  I've definitely had much better Italian food and would not rush back here anytime soon.

I came here to dinner for the first time last Saturday and it was AMAZING! Our server was fantastic; he was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and gave us drink, appetizer, and entree recommendations when we couldn't decide. The rest of the staff (manager/hostess) were also extremely nice and genuine asking about our time in Vegas.  The meatball salad and veal piccatta were both absolutely delicious!   Next time we're in Vegas, we will definitely be coming back. Top notch restaurant!

Service - A little stuck up. Reservations - We went late on Friday night but none was needed. Food - Hit or miss.  Overpriced. 1. Short Rib Bucatini Special - Salty 2. Penne Alla Vodka - Just not memorable. 3. Ricotta Gnocchi - Very dense.  The "gravy" was delicious. 4. Sauteed Greens - The spinach was perfectly cooked.

This place is preeeetttyyyy tasty. I was craving Italian food (meatballs specifically) and man am I happy I walked in this place.   I saw at the bar, and was immediately helped. The service here was pretty awesome. I started with the meatball appetizer, and it was soooo good. That is a meal in itself with the bread they give you. The chili oil is really good, too. I didn't finish it all to save room for my main course.   My 2nd course was the carbonara. They actually being out an egg to mix on top of the hot noodles like traditional carbonara. The noodles had a nice chew to them and the pancetta is really good. It's a rather heavy dish though... I could barely finish half. Needless to say, I didn't have room for dessert..... Even though I really wants to try the tiramisu.   Overall, I would definitely come back! It's priced like the rest of the restaurants on the strip, but it's actually really good for Italian food.

The food was good. But the menu is overly, almost obnoxiously, strict. I'm sorry but if I order eggplant parm or chicken parm I should be able to order a simple side of pasta. My friend wanted to order red velvet cake for dessert she was informed it's only an option on the price fix menu. She also asked for mozzarella cheese on top of her pasta and was told no. Like I'm sorry since when is the chefs ego more important than the customers prefrence. Like get over yourself. Also while the decor is aesthetically pleasing the music is way too loud you can not have dinner conversation. It's a restaurant not a club. Unfortunately the restrictions are what left the lasting, bitter, taste in my mouth and therefore I will not be returning nor recommending the resturant.
