Excellent food.  The wife and I shared the famous meatball and salad appetizer and eggplant stack and they did not disappoint. Very tasty and well seasoned. The main course of chicken parmigiana and seafood pescatore are both recommended.  Wait staff was very attentive and knew there courses.  Would highly recommend

Excellent vibe and cool decor. Their macaroni (aka pasta) is excellent. The veal Marsala here is fork-tender and flavorful. The Sunday Gravy is the owner's grandmother's marinara sauce and it is delicious.

This is a return visit as I was here last year and definitely wanted to come back. Martorano's never fails to please.  The food is superb as are the wonderful waiters.   They are attentive and cheerful without being overbearing. I will definitely make another visit here when I next come back to Las Vegas. This is my go-to spot for fine Italian dining.

Cool and fresh spin on an Italian restaurant. Located inside Paris Las Vegas, nearly between the Paris and Bally's casino floors.  This dinner spot is popular and busy! We lucked out with bar seating for our group of 4 around 645pm.   Our bartender and server was friendly, attentive and informative.   Started with the Angel cocktail. A sweet option.  Ordered the Chicken Cutlet Parmigiano. Delivered hot and fresh. Great seasoning and texture on the breading.   Menu is high end. Average entree is $40.  Best to call ahead or reserve a table in advance.

For some strange reason, our concierge recommended this place for family dining with a baby. WOW. That couldn't have been further from the truth.  The food was pretty sensational despite it's high prices. ($14 for still water, really?) I had the carbonara, where the yolk was broke and mixed in table side. Our server advertised it as the best pasta on the menu and his description was right on the money.  The environment, however, was extremely odd. In the light up iPad menu, there's an excerpt somewhat warning of the restaurant's unique style of operation. White tablecloths and embroidered napkins suggest fine dining however TV screens playing movies with explicit content, an obscene amount of disco balls and gaudy neon blue lights complete the interior decorations. Very loud music bounces from current hip-hop to 80s pop to 90s r&b, with the occasional pause and dimming of lights to focus in on 90 seconds of the most vulgar scenes of whatever feature film is playing.  All in all, an extremely strange yet delicious experience.

I must have to say. If you love Italian food this is not the place for you. Husband and I went here last night for our Vday dinner.  One it was not packed and hostess sat us near the outside of the restaurant as if the place was packed inside and that was the only choice. Mind you they knew my husband is a Diamond member. After sitting there and no one offering us any drinks or anything. Finally after 15mins the waiter saw I was upset and I asked him to move us so we can enjoy the restaurant vibe. Then after being moved inside. 3 mgrs standing there doing nothing bug chatting and waiters as well. Just as we were about to leave waiter finally comes over and offers us a drink menu.  So faster forwarding to our meal.  We ordered the meatball salad. It was decent. Wasn't dry but nothing great. I ordered penne vodka and husband ordered the chicken parm. My husband is italian from Brooklyn NY. He judges any italian resturant by your chicken parm. We get our food. Husband looks at his plate and asked the waiter where is the gravy(sauce). Waiter says its under the mozzarella. Husband looks under was like what italian eats dry chicken parm. Waiter brings over a tiny side of gravy and husband again says. Chicken parm is suppose to have alot of gravy. Waiter says we can give you a side of gravy but have to charge you. At this point husband just wanted to eat. So he agreed. Get to my penne vodka. TERRIBLE! Penne vodka is my all time fav and growing up with italians back home in NY. This place should be ashamed to call themselves a authentic italian resturant. My pasta was hard the sauce was filled with onions and garlic.  After a while. The manager comes over and asks how's it going. Husnand states about the Chicken parm. Manager says we serve chicken parm dry like that, just a little sauce under the mozzarella. Husband looked at him and couldn't believe that came out his mouth!  After all said and done. I left very hungry and with an upset stomach just for eating some of the hard pasta. So if you really want a good italian resturant. I suggest Pasta Mia across from the Palms, it's not on the strip per say but if you want some good italian good this is your place. Its authentic and delicious! Oh and very afforable!

Made a reservation for 6:30, tables were empty and they still made us wait. We sat at the bar and everything we asked for, they we're out of. Finally sat down, service was just okay. Food did not have flavor... I ordered the pasta with seafood and the pasta was not fresh. Shrimp were okay. Clams had no taste.. my husband ordered the sea bass and it was just bland... Will not go there again. Food is over priced. Save yourself money and go to the buffet instead.

It is more an experience than great food.  The risotto was crunchy and disappointing.  It's average Italian food, not great.  The wine somnelier was very helpful though in helping us select a great wine.  All in all, unless we just went for drinks, we would not return.

Love the combo of food, gangster movies and lively music! Service is always great, and the food is divine. My fave is the spicy seafood pasta (it's been presented as a special the times I've been). I had the Lobster Francaise on my last visit, which was a great option - light, flavorful, and the risotto was perfect. From the raves I heard from my friends about their dishes, there really isn't a bad choice on the menu. Lay back, relax, eat, dance in your seat, and try not to watch the gory parts of the movie playing while you eat!

I have eaten here about 5 times... the food is ALWAYS amazing.... get the cheesesteak and the scallops are as good as it gets however, this last trip there was much better due tothe AMAZING SERVICE we received by Ray and Francisco! we were a large group and they were rock stars! Thank you!

Excellent food!  Everything is made fresh. Raymond and Francisco gave us outstanding service. We found this restaurant when we were in Fort Lauderdale and loved it!!  So glad we found it here in Las Vegas!  Will definitely recommend!!!

Other than the hostess being a total snob upon our arrival, we had a great experience at Cafe Martorano (our server was much friendlier, so that took the bitterness out of the first impression.)  I went with the pre-fixe menu, which was actually a great price by Vegas standards - $45 for three wonderful courses. Started with the caprese salad (really fresh and tasty), then the tagliatelle with cream sauce, chicken and peas (rich and delicious), and ended the meal with a sweet cannoli.   Our waiter was really friendly and helpful with suggestions - everyone agreed the portions were HUGE (too much, really), but the food was delicious. It's a nice place in the Rio and I'd definitely go again.

What can I say about this place? I have been to this establishement 4 times, and each time it keeps getting better. I usually scoff at going to restaurants in casinos, but I highly recommend this restaurant if you're looking for excellent italian food, and don't mind it being a little bit pricey.  I had the spaghetti, and I know what you're thinking, just spaghetti? I don't know what they do to the pasta here, but its so good its addicting. I dream of going back to Cafe Martorano and having the spaghetti.  The meatball that I shared as an appetizer was huge! Its definately enough for two people, and like anything else I've had is excellent. Make sure to save some room for dessert! Might I suggest a cannoli?
This is by far the best ItAlian restaurant.  The service was impeccable and the food was the best. I recommend it very highly.

Attended a Birthday party at this restaurant.  One of the best experiences we had in Vegas on this trip.  Home style Italian food, like your mother or grandmother made.  Service was exceptional as was the Sommelier.  Only negative is the location in the Paris Hotel.  Definitely worth the trek through the lobby/casino area.

I'd give five stars but my long island was weak.  Pretty much enough said but I'll add on just for the thrill of it!  We did a "no penis allowed" girls trip to Vegas for my daughter's 21st birthday.  Birthday dinner was here, at Cafe Martorano.  Yo, don't bust my balls, man.  It's pretty upscale the whole way around, you know from the linens to the dishes to the service to the ambience to the nasty dude who was running his hand up the thigh of his "rode hard and put away wet" date.   Oh wait, that was just nasty, not upscale AT.ALL.  The bread and variety of dipping choices was yummy, the presentation of the food we ordered was beautiful and the complimentary scallop that the cute waiter brought my daughter for her birthday made me scratch my head.  I told my daughter to smile and say thank you, its not every day a girl gets a scallop for her birthday - even tho she is hella cute!  I find that when I dine at fancy Italian restaurants that I'm hungry not long after - the food is very good but they don't really give you hearty portions.  Or, perhaps I'm just a pig.  This place is expensive so don't be bringing your friends who would have rather had McDonald's here - I swear if I see one more person in my daughter's party roll their eyes at me over the price I'm going to throw a scallop at them!  Cafe M - work on your mixed drinks for me - my twins will be 21 in eight years and I'd like to actually catch a buzz over dinner next time I'm in town.

Who are you people?  Seriously.  Who are you people that are leaving 5 star reviews for this joint? Saying it's the best Italian food you've ever had? Seriously?! Are you from Iowa? Have you ever actually had Italian food at somewhere other than the Olive Garden? How can you possibly say this is the nicest restaurant you've ever been to?!  So many questions.  Look, maybe I'm a snob. Ok, I'm probably a snob, but what sort of witchcraft is happening in these reviews? Dangit, that was another question.   Tonight, I'm staying at the Rio, so a friend came by and we decided to hit up the most delicious place ever for dinner: Hash House A Go Go. Alas, the Rio Hash House isn't open at any reasonable hour (despite the lies Yelp spreads), so we had to improvise. Italian sounded good, so despite the kind of high prices, we decided to give Martorano's a shot.   First thing's first: it's a Monday night, not Saturday. I see open tables with my eyes. The girl up front asks if we have a reservation, we say no, and she says there's a 30 minute wait. But. . . there are open tables. . . right there. . . ok, fine.   We wait. We wait 45 minutes. They finally sit us down.  We order some waters and sodas. The waiter brings back our drinks. . . and tiny plastic soda bottles. You know the ones you put in like, a kid's lunch? The little shorty, half size soda bottles? That. No free refills, because our sodas came from tiny little bottles (THAT THEY CHARGED US $3.50 CENTS A PIECE FOR).   Fine. Whatever. We  go to order dinner. I tell the waiter I'd like the 'Chicken Downtown' and he immediately asks if I'd like to order something to go with it. I ask what he means. "It just comes with like, you know, a big chicken breast with stuff on it. Nothing else." Oh, so you're charging $30 for a literal piece of chicken with nothing on the side.   Needless to say, I switched over to pasta carbonara. The bread they bring is good, the olive oil is nice, but the pepper olive oil they bring is. . . not good. It was simultaneously needlessly spicy in a not flavorful way and kind of dull tasting (don't ask me how that makes sense). The Carbonara was alright. We both agreed that had our entrees been $15-$18, we wouldn't be complaining. . . but it was $27 for a bowl of carbonara.  The food isn't bad-- don't get me wrong-- but it ain't great.   The service was meh. The waiter gave off a definite 'bro' vibe and wasn't very attentive. The guy who handled bread and water though was phenomenal.  The decor is very. . . look, you can tell the owner used to be a DJ. Probably in the 90s. It's just a weird vibe. Flashing lights in dated colors, Godfather posters, disco balls, and then tv screens playing The 300 (???). Look, I can dig Vegas tacky, but if I want that kind of Vegas tacky, I'll hop my butt over to the Fireside Lounge in the Peppermill, thank you very much.   Now before you think I'm some sort of tasteless pleb, I assure you that I've got no problem paying much more than even that for diner. . . if it's worth it, but this place is NOT worth it. Not by a long shot. And in Vegas of all places? You have so many more options in that price range.   I'm Italian American and I love quality Italian food. . . but this place ain't it. Don't waste your time and certainly do NOT waste your money. Not in Vegas, not when there are some of the world's best restaurants (even at this price range!) right down the road.   You want some good Italian? Take a cab to Nora's on Flamingo (#1 on Yelp and half the price!). Or if you want the real good stuff, take a cab a little farther to the other side of the Strip and hit up Sergio's on Tropicana. It's kind of old and tacky and ridiculous. . . but holy mother of goodness, it'll be the best vodka sauce you'll ever have. Oh, and they even refill your sodas for free.   EDIT TO ADD: Sorry, I'm deducting a star. Both me and my dining companion ended up sick today (the next day). She actually threw up, I just felt like I was going to for the better part of the day. I literally ate nothing else yesterday but that dinner + some Starbucks in the morning, so it pretty clearly made us ill. Blech.

We truly enjoyed our dinner here. Our pasta dishes were full of flavor and freshness. My husband had Bucatini Carbonara a house specialty. Neither one of us had ever tasted anything like it. Needless to say he cleaned his plate and thoroughly enjoyed this meal. I had the Fusilli Pollo this was delisious. It does have a strong bell pepper flavor something im not used to in my pasta. Our waiter took on the style of the resturant making small tall with us. It was nice to enjoy a different dinning experience with different dishes. We eat out alot and it can get boring. So this was a refreshing fun evening. Oh you must top it ofc with the carrot cake, it is out of this world.

Martoranos.  This was the toughest review to write from my last trip, and not sure I'll convey what happened in this review but I'll try.  We visited the new location in the Paris Las Vegas hotel on 10/21/14.  We had walked by it during the day, thought it looked cool...liked the menu...so researched it a bit while sitting at the pool and decided that we had to go, seeing how SO MANY celebs and notable people ranked Chef Martorano's food SO high!  So we were pretty excited to check it all out and enjoy a great meal.  We were seated on time at a table on the 'outside' of the restaurant, so we didn't get that movies on the wall, disco ball in the center kind of experience...but did enjoy the al fresco style dining and people watching in the Paris shops area.  Right next to us was a group of 8 conventioneers, who were a bit loud from time to time and seemed to dominate the service as you will see below.  We were greeted by Georgio (hope I spelled that right) after a good 5-10 minutes of perusing the menu on our own.  He dropped off an iPad with the drink menu, took our "flat or sparkling" water order, and explained the specials for the night, which I took note of a seafood selection that he described as a "seafood party in your mouth"...something about that was both comical and odd...not sure why though.  We quickly found out that the iPad was malfunctioning, if you pressed on anything it would just freeze.  So we were unable to check out any kind of special drink selection (we were thinking martini style special followed by some wine with dinner).  Georgio then became a bit occupied with pouring wine for the conventioneers so we were able to flag down his 'assistant' Jason (I think he was an assistant, or in training or something) who quickly brought us a new iPad.  Georgio then came back and took our order...not asking if we'd like to start with an appetizer, not asking if we'd like a drink, but simply saying "are you ready to order"...which led to her saying "yeah I want the martini, the seafood special..." him looking at me so i had to say "I want a Manhattan up with Makers, we're splitting the eggplant parm and I'll take the Buitoni Meatball"...just not how you serve a couple in a high end establishment.  So then another 10 minutes passed.  The restaurant was about 70% full and the bar was not busy.  We had no drinks and had been sitting there for a total of 25 minutes.  Jason kept looking and then came over to say "didn't you guys order drinks?" to which he promptly went to the bar and resolved..bringing us our drinks moments later.  Our eggplant parm arrived shortly thereafter and I have to say it was AWESOME!!  Probably the best I've had..and was a perfect size to split with a date.  After clearing the plates and then taking a wine order (glasses, not a full bottle) the night seemed to be moving more smoothly....until the entrees.  My entree came out but her food did not.  Jason was kind enough to explain that the food was all cooked fresh to order and sent as soon as it was ready, that they didn't hold anything in the kitchen.  Ok, I'm cool with that.  But who knew a buitoni (think thick linguini) and meatball cooked 5-10 minutes quicker than some seafood (clams, shrimp, etc..seafood party) over linguni?  Throughout this whole process, Jason was super attentive to our needs and seemed to really try and keep things going...while Georgio was busy trying to be cool, pouring drinks for the big convention table, and coming up with cheezy Italian style lines to say to everyone.  The manager actually came over and apologized, and first offered another glass of wine (which we both had a full glass) so we declined..then said "well, just pick out a desert and we'll take care of it for you"...seemed to me a nice gesture and the right thing to do.  Her food finally came out and I do have to say we both LOVED our meals.  I had the best friggin' meatball ever and she had an awesome seafood dish.  The food at this place is worth every penny of the price.  Jason continued to check in on us, making sure things were going smooth...while Georgio continued posturing for everyone.  Ever see a person who thinks he's a special gift to everyone, and has no clue he is actually really cheesy and borderline annoying?  Anyway...  We went on to split a desert (thinking this was on the house)...tiramisu.  Now, I'm not even a fan of tiramisu but holy smokes..it was AWESOME!!  We were then brought the bill...which of course did not have the desert or anything comped...but at that point we didn't really want to make a big deal and just settled up.    Funny that on our way out, we asked to have our photo taken and who stepped up?  Yep, Jason!  We thanked him for taking care of us all night and actually tipped him separate, fearful that the tip on the bill would all go to Georgio.  My hope is that if anyone from the restaurant reads this, GIVE JASON A PROMOTION!  He was outstanding!!  Food: 5  Georgio: 2  Jason: 5  Mgr: 1

Worst Service Ever. I was with 3 friends and we decided to check this place out.  We were thinking we would have drinks and maybe see.  When we didn't order food right away the waiter obviously got upset.  Suddenly the manager was there asking if we were going to be eating.  We said we just wanted a drink we thought.  He told us the tables were reserved for people who were going to eat.  I looked around and there was maybe 2 or 3 other tables with people at them.  One of my friends began to protest but I was just in such shock I said let's go.  The manager said he was sorry.  No he wasn't.  Don't be rude AND lie to me.  We went to the French restaurant in the Paris and had a wonderful meal and spent over $200.  The service was wonderful.  Martorano's is not friendly.  The food may be good but I'll never get to find out because I was asked to leave.

Wow...this place should not have almost 4 stars.  First off this place was had to find, in the corner of the rio, and empty when we arrived.  Should have gone with our gut and left based on how empty it was.   Ordered a couple drinks to start, including a dirty martini and an old fashioned.  Two very standard drinks but could tell bar tender was an amateur.  Very poorly made.    Before dinner we ordered the Ceprese tomatoe salad with warm mozzarella.  This was the only redeemable value the restaurant had to offer.    For dinner my wife and I split the veal.  This entree was horrible.  It was a very thin layer of veal, topped with a huge amount of bell peppers covered in cheese.  It was like bell peppers with a hint of veal.  Just gross. We ordered a side of gnocchi but the brought spaghetti instead.  Realized there mistake and within 5 minutes brought out the gnocchi, which was disgusting.  Very chalking tasting if that makes sense.  After paying over $140 for two people....we were not impressed at all.  I also didn't like the fact that had bottle of wine and marinara sauce placed all over the bar that was for sale.  I hate when restaurants try to up sell.  Especially when it's not good.  Definitely wouldn't come back, one star all the way.

What restaurant tells you very short and plainly you cannot have any sauce on the side...being Diabetic less sauce is best and our waiter would not even ask kitchen!!  No service which seems to explain low reviews.  Bread good, salad good....

My husband & I were walking around in the Paris Hotel & we had reservation at another restaurant, but after seeing the menu & the wonderful story of Steve Martorano, we wanted to dine here.  We sat at the bar u til our table was ready & the bartender was great she was so efficient & nice.  We were seated at Yuri's section & he was absolutely amazing.  Yuri was very knowledgeable of hr menu, food, taste etc & proudly would say I've been with this great restaurant for almost 10 years.  We had a wonderful dinner, just simply the BEST of all the choices in Vegas to dine, guess what we came back the next night asking to be seated at Yuri's table.  He remembered us, our drinks, dinners & what else we had looked at the previous night to eat.  It was AMAZING, please Mr. Steve Martorano open a restaurant here in Los Angeles please Malibu

Absolutely,positively, without a DOUBT, the best food I have ever eaten! The Philly cheese steak and carbonara are a must try and then try again and again. We have driven from Newport Beach to Las Vegas just to eat! Pathetic, I know but it's that amazing!!   Steve is opening another location in the Paris hotel that will be open for lunch too! Yay, now we can eat it twice a day!!

Just went here last night for fight weekend and I was extremely disappointed. Nice venue, nice atmosphere, and good service but the food quality was not up to par. First off getting your food takes forever because everything is "made fresh daily". My husband ordered the carbonara which honestly just tasted like a fancy mac & cheese. I ordered the lasagna and I can honestly say I've had much better lasagna frozen from Costco. In addition the risotto we ordered was way over salted. Overall way overpriced for the quality and taste of the food. Save your money and go elsewhere.

I have been trying to reproduce this meatball for a while. Steve claims to give you the scoop on ingredients and the how to via several youtube videos. But alas there are holes (intentional) in his instruction. I don't blame him and yah, the damn meatball is that good!  The next time your walking the strip and are looking for a light meal and a drink, drop in to Paris, plop your butt on a barstool at Martorano's and order a nice glass of red and the Meatball Salad. Trust me.

This may be a little biased- I grew up on Italian food from a mother who was the most amazing cook. The food in my neighborhood was what we referred to as "red sauce" or "italian-american". Martorano's took his east coast-italian american food that we all grew up on and brought it to Vegas- and good for him. There is an entire population in Vegas who never had this. I should know, I was there Saturday night with 2 very "American" friends from California. They LOVED it. Their review would be 5 stars all the way. I just have had this food so much that it is not unique. Strictly local red sauce grub. I had to explain what "gravy" was to my friends - which was pretty funny. I also had to hold my tongue at the "mark-up" of Proseco ($15 I pay at the market - $40 at Martorano's) - They gave us a nice tasting of mortadella mouse- it was very tasty. I had the linguine vongoli. I thought it was really good. They are very generous with the clams. Usually, you get such a small amount. Very good meal. My friends got the pasta with fish and liked it and my other friend LOVED the eggplant stack and satueed spinach. Good restaurant for Las Vegas

Meatball with salad.  The best I ever had.  Homemade mozzarella. Delish.  Loud ass TVs, disco balls, pumping music with interruptions of scenes from The Godfather or Pulp Fiction.....it's weird and fantastic and oh so Jersey Shore.  Don't expect to be able to hold a conversation with the person across the table...make sure you sit side by side, even if you have to move your chair....and for God's sake....guys, feed your girls...and drink lots of red wine.  I love this place because it is SO unexpected...don't like it?  Yo cuz, don't break his balls!  In the words of Steve Martorano...Your sister's ass!

Martorano's couldn't care less about you - it's all about the 'thug' attitude of Steve Martorano who believes the food is better than reality. The staff has nothing good to say about him.  At the Paris hotel, I had a diabetic blood sugar crash. After starting to recover, I was escorted by the EMS of Paris Hotel to the nearest restaurant with the desire of getting simple carbs into my system. Slumped in a chair and sweating profusely, I had to deal with extensive discussions until the manager finally stated that he refused to let me order anything except exactly what was on the menu. It went so far that I requested a pasta dish from the menu and asked that no "gravy" be put on the pasta . . . but charge me full price. "Absolutely Not" was the response. It was stated many times that Mr. Martorano does not care about my issues and refuses to make any alterations to any of their dishes - regardless of circumstance. Period.  Aside from this inhumane treatment and outrageous behavior, I was forced to eat Martorano's pasta dish prepared according to 'Steve's' menu requirement. I'm an Italian from New York, my grand parents were from Italy and operated a successful catering business after immigrating to the United States. I know Italian food. I cook and have spent 33 years in the food industry myself, and let me tell you, this food is not authentic Italian. Bread is the most basic aspect of an Italian meal and it should be outstanding. Martorano's bread was absolutely horrible: dry, tasteless and without texture. No kidding, the best part of my meal was the water.    Even if the food had been good, which it was not, how can people tolerate supporting an individual who is so egocentric that he would rather see a patron in distress suffer than serve a pasta dish without his precious "gravy" slathered on top. The tone of everything Martorano is negative, offensive, insulting and stinks of a pompous individual who would rather intimidate his customers and staff than be a beloved restaurateur. Steve Martorano needs to grow up and respect the people that spend their hard-earned money on his over-priced, mediocre food served with an attitude.  "YO CUZ"!!!!!

The only thing that saves this place is the chicken parmigiano. The best I've ever tasted,  but just know it is served by itself, no sides. Spaghetti noodles were thick and very good as well. The meatball was average. Gnocchi - a waste, I've had much better.   First, decor was nice but really doesn't match the Paris Hotel feel.   Our waiter Mark...ugh...the only time he became somewhat "attentive/friendly" was when he realized we started questioning the bill and asked for his name. He was nowhere near friendly right from the start. When I asked if there was a kids menu he said no in a condescending tone, like I was asking a foolish question.  A more professional response would be "I'm so sorry, no we do not." He asked if we wanted wine.  When a few  (but not all) of us said no, he walked away while my father was still deciding what to get. When my mom said it was my birthday he dismissed it right away but then said a brief ("I really dont care" tone) "happy birthday" when she repeated it. Also, it was disheartening to see what I think was the manager (heavier set older caucasian man) check on everyone's table except for ours. The only pleasant person was our busser. The host at the entrance wasn't as friendly too.  For their HIGH prices (27-62 per plate) and "fancier/upscale" dining we expected more. Shame on you for having worse service than the Applebees down the street from my home. We eat at a lot of classy restaurants but this was truly one of the most disappointing places. Please do not even waste your time.

Great place to stop by the bar for a quick bite and a martini when on the strip. I tried the meatball salad and they do a great job creating a tender meatball. Friendly, attentive service too. Will have to stop by again on my next trip to Bally's or Paris.

Went for a late night dinner at the bar. It was a gorgeous and large space, sexy, open, low lighting.No blaring music, it was kept at a low-moderate volume. You can sit toward's the front or the restaurant and watch people pass by or toward's the back for more intimacy.   We ordered off the late night menu. -Caesar's salad was one of very best I've ever had. -Pizza was okay; fabulous thin crust but the cheese was...weak, flavorless. -Good wine list. I was debating wines and the bartender immediately bought me four to taste based on my stated preferences.  -I went big and had a couple glasses of the Brunello di Montelcino $24/glass. They also had a super Tuscan.

This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. Service was wonderful. We were really impressed by the freshness and flavors of all the food. Our pasta carbonara was decadent. Cocktails were great and there was a fun atmosphere in the restaurant. We really enjoyed our visit and look forward to returning.

This is on the second floor of the Casino area of the Rio hotel in the Masquerade tower. I liked the trendy atmosphere very much. We were by the window with a view of the Rio pool. They have TV's there which were showing old movies and the videos of the owner showing you (what looked like) cooking lessons. Our waitress was friendly. She showed us images of the specials on a tablet- which was a big help, and probably the first time I didn't space out when someone went over the specials of the day.  The food was great. The bread brought before the meal was excellent and since we got there right when it opened, it was nice and warm. I started with fried calamari (San Marzano version) and thought it was great.  I had chicken parmesan, and again, it was excellent. Though, after the bread and the fried calamari, I was stuffed. I might not have a starter next time.  I also bought some of his marinara sauce which is sold by the hostess desk.  Overall, I loved it and I'll be back.
Wonderful salad! So tangy and just perfect with a side of spaghetti. Service on point at the bar. Our bartender allowed us to taste a couple of wines...our favorite touch. Paris!

Meatball salad appetizer is incredible. Anything with the Sunday gravy (marinara) is worth getting. Veal picatta had a great sauce with a perfect texture. Chicken Parmesan was the best I've had. Wait staff are helpful and prompt. Worth trying.

Food = 3 star (good flavor over all) Service= 1 star (inattentive staff) Atmosphere = 2 star (it's like a disco club. ??, but was clean) Quality = 2 star (food was fresh, but seafood was over cooked. Lobster was like rubber) For such and expensive dish, blah and not worth the price tag(s).  Overall I would've given it a 2.5 or less. For a $$$, not worth it. They wouldn't serve us bread with oil and vinegar until we ordered dinner.....and that was sad. Better to spend the money on a cab and go to a better equipped restaurant for $50+ per person/plate without an alcoholic beverage. It's EXPENSIVE and financially and quality worthy of just going to In-N-Out.

Sure, my review is probably biased. I ate for free. Sure, my review is probably biased. I ate for FREE. Sure, my review is probably biased. I ate FOR FREE!!!  Then again, perhaps my review ISN'T so biased, as I would actually pay my own money to go back here.  Since I became old enough to gamble, I was a fan of the Rio. Why? I don't know, but I just had really good luck gambling at the Harrah's casinos (back when it was just Harrah's and Rio in the lineup).  Of course, with lady luck shining down on me with all her glory, I'd up my antes and win even bigger.  With that came the VIP treatment, for shizzle. After my second trip, I was somehow put in touch with a host, and thus began my long and beautiful relationship with the Rio.  Okay, so Rio sort of lost its charm as I got older, but my all-star host Derek was so great that I couldn't be disloyal and stay anywhere else.  Then again, he DID give me free rooms all the time.  Minor details, I promise.  Derek has moved on to bigger and better things, so I haven't actually been back to the Rio in awhile, but the last time I went, Derek treated me to an AWESOME dinner.  Usually, we go to the buffet (because I used to love the Carnival Buffet), but that particular visit, Derek was incredibly insistent on taking me to the new Italian place that had just opened.  Beggars can't be choosers, so I decided to just roll with it.  And boy, am I glad I did!  Again, I don't know how much any of the dishes cost, as I didn't pay for any of them, let alone look at the menu.  All the wait staff knew Derek personally (apparently, he dined here often), and were quick to serve us up with everything we could possibly need.  Derek just said, "Bring us all the good stuff," and like that, magic happened at our table.  Three different kinds of pasta, a little steak something for me, random meatball thingies, and I don't even know what else.  Here's the thing.  I don't like Italian food.  I generally find it too heavy.  And another thing.  Derek himself is of Italian heritage.  When Derek first sat me down, he said, "Look, I NEVER eat out Italian because nothing compares to my grandma's cooking. But this place is THAT good."  Did I believe him?  No. I thought this was some weird promo that he was pulling on me (which is unlike him).  But no. After my first few bites, I was TOTALLY SOLD.  Everything was scrumptious, tasty, and definitely not too heavy.  As Goldilocks once said after eating Baby Bear's soup, "This is JUUUUUUST right~"  The appetizers, entrees, and desserts were ALL amazing.  But the piece de resistance of this place is the DECOR AND AMBIANCE.  Holy cow!  At first, I was confused when the lighting changed from violet to blue.  Were my eyes playing tricks on me?  I was too busy savoring my meal to care if I was going blind.  Then the blue light changed to red.  What the???  That's when I realized that the lighting in the room continuously changes color, dissolving slowly from one color to the next!  It adds a totally colorful and fun element to the whole modern decor, and jeebus, the movies!  Okay, so I'm not a classics-enthusiast in general, but it was really cool to have the music and the lighting interrupted periodically for a short showing of classic scenes from classic movies like the Godfather and whatnot!  Totally a cool and unexpected touch!  The DJ played good (if loud) music, and the staff was totally friendly and enthusiastic!  The best part?  I got to go to the kitchen to see where the magic happens.  Derek introduced me to the chef (he looks incredibly like Vin Diesel - another Las Vegas impersonator?), and he was totally friendly and exuberant.  Just my kind of guy!  This place was freaking awesome.  The experience was freaking awesome.  The fact that it did zero damage to my gambling funds was freaking awesome.  When (and I don't mean IF, I mean WHEN) I go back, there is no way that I'll be able to afford such a varied sampling (I think we had like 10 different plates on our table at one point) of all the scrumptious goodness, but I will be sure to try something different every time, just to get my fill!  Are you thinking about dining here?  DON'T HESITATE.  DO IT.  DO IT. DO IT. DO IT.

I ordered what i thought was the sauce that had everything in it with pasta without looking at the menu and I got something totally different that had fat chunks of stringy pork. Was a bad experience as the manager didn't care at all. I went last month and ate with my Diamond preferred total rewards card and the food was great, they gave me a totally different meal and all i can say is i won't be back. Small portions, unfriendly manager.

First time eating here....and...LOVED IT. There are so many dining options in Vegas- but we will return here!  The service was great.   Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive.   I love the fact that they show you pictures of the specials. We had the pork chop special and the sea bass with lump crab meat. Outstanding!  They make their own mozzarella and it was wonderful.   Great experience!

First visit, I arrived as they were opening @ 4:30pm. Ordered meatball & salad. $20, one Meatball was good but not enough sauce., salad had to much dressing and only had lettuce and tomato. Waiter service was okay. Pricy.

I went here with a friend. The food was so good. It reminded me of the type of italian food i used to eat on the east coast. It was fresh and tasty. The only areas that could use a little improvement was the time it took for the order t come out and the presentation of the veal. Other than that this is the place to go for real " Sunday Gravy" and good food. It is a bit unassuming when you walk by. However, you need to stop! go in and try the food. I reco the cheesesteak sandwich and the meatball salad. A very generous and flavorful salad accompanies a gigantic meatball and plenty of ricotta cheese. The gravy is flavorful and good.   On the veal, i would have dressed it up with some gravy over the top of it and some fresh basil and oregano to give it some depth and color. The taste was good. It was tender and not chewy.   Will i be back, ABSOLUTELY!!!  Already booked a party there.   PS they have tis all around the rest. We were having a terrific meal whilst watching the God Father.  Cannot get better than that!!

It was ok overall. It's pretty and crisp and has good energy BUTTT they do NO SUBSTITUTES... Meaning you cannot even add chicken to your Cesar salad!!!! You can not substitute your favorite pasta. They cook al Dante but I prefer mine a little over cooked and softer, the ends on some strands were out right hard. But my carbonara sauce was delicious. But I was just especially disappointed that we couldn't add chicken to a salad!!!!!

This is seriously the only good thing we experienced at Paris. We were so disappointed with everything else, but this saved our evening there.  We didn't order anything to eat, but we came in for a drink at the bar and were pleasantly surprised. The bartenders were super nice, attentive, and knowledgable about their selections. It was nice being able to chat a bit about the different wines they carried and they offered me a few to try based on my preferences. We were impressed.  The decor is interesting with blue lighting and very modern. Not exactly what I'd expect from an Italian restaurant. We came in on a Sunday evening and it wasn't too busy. We were greeted right away when we stepped up and got a seat at the bar. The bartender came over right away to help us.  Although I don't see us ever staying at the Paris Hotel again, if we were in the area and wanted to grab a drink, we would totally come back here. I'd even be open to trying it out for dinner.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I sat down last night, it officially opens this weekend so we were sampling it pre-grand opening. We had fantastic service and the food was incredible! If you're looking for a great authentic Italian meal--THIS IS IT!  I liked the ambiance of restaurant blue light accenting the walls, pictures in black and white (one of the owner), tvs on walls playing movies with subtitles on, and music going. The menus are electronic, a little heavy.  But each table got an ipad that displayed drinks (wine list, cocktails), daily specials. It was very high tech!

Based on the reviews, it seems you either love or hate this place.    That's what originally drew me to it, i had just checked into my hotel some firends and family to celebrate my 21st, and in amongst some downtime and getting unpacked, i immediately started thinking about where to go prior to the nights out that were soon due to come.  So i opened "THE BOOK" in The Hotel and while flipping through the pages i noticed an add for an Italian Cafe that had the picture of a big guy (Vin Diesel Looking) and a 2 paragraph dissertation on how his cafe became.    The long and the short of the ad, is that he loved to cook since he was young, so he calls himself a cook not a chef, and does things his way.  Basically the story said;  A customer came in once and was insisiting that he turned down the music, and he politely said "Sir, this is the image that my restaurant upholds and what we are, so i'm sorry i cannot do that." The customer became extremely mad and began to demand and yell at the owner, and the owner told the man to get up and GTFO!  As soon as i was done reading that, i was sold, "This was a place i must check out", mainly becasue it's rare that people and restaurants now a days still have a backbone, and don't let people walk all over them.  The theme of the restaurant is his way or the highway, where from 5-7pm music like sinatra is played, then from 7-8pm it's 80's music, and then from 9-close is club style hip hop since the restaurant turns into a 1/2 club at night.  And throughout any of this, the music will pause, the lights will dim and all of the many plasmas on the walls will show one of his favorite scenes from one of his favorite moives (casino,the godfather, knockaround guys.....) and then quickly before anything gets too gory the music resumes and the lights come back up.   The food, is the best hands down italian food i have ever had and 1/2 of my family is from a little family owned city in northern italy called consa.  We ordered the chef's choice which is an (5 course) assortment of food both on and off the menu, and whatever the owner/cook feels like making.  It was a bit pricey ($125 pp for chefs choice) but i know there are other things for sub $30 and $40 on the menu, plus it's vegas, what isn't pricey if it's not good, i mean really good.  You get what you pay for and you're not in vegas all the time, so indulge a bit.  We also had a personal wine concierge that helped us select wine throughout the meal, and our waiter who's name was meatball was extremely helpful in preparing us for what we were about to experience (the most food in one meal i have ever seen).  One of my personal favorites was the crab and lobster stuffed shellfish (that was not on the menu).  Holy mother that was good!  They also have a more than capable bar, and you can take a photo with "the cook"  All in all, it was hands down my favorite place to eat in vegas, and i will definately be returning when i go back there.  If you want some killer italian food, and a memorable atmosphere, you must make a stop here.
This is the second time we've dined here. The first time was in Harrahs in Atlantic City and it did not disappoint ! Paul out server over at the Las Vegas location was awesome! Im so stuffed!

Family Style This was our convention group dinner.  They closed the restaurant to accommodate over 200 of us.   The restaurant is on the second floor of the masquerade tower at the Rio Hotel.  It over looks the swimming pool.  It has a nice long bar  They had 3 TV in the main dining area, two of which was playing Godfather II, Sweet.  Music playing and disco lights on.  A really nice place to have dinner.   Here's the rundown: The Best Meatball & Salad "Signature Martorano Meatball" I have to say, the meatballs are really good. It  was serve with ricotta which made it taste better. The salad it came with was just okay.   Fried Calamari w/ Sweet & Spicy Chili Sauce   This dish was my favorite of the night. Nice size calamari. Perfectly fried. That sweet & spicy chili sauce was dynamite. So good. Thinly sliced Serrano chili rounded this dish nicely  Fried Mozzarella Stack "Tomatoes, Prosciutto di Parma, Aged Balsamic Vinegar & Extra Virgin Olive Oil" This was another winner. A thick piece fried nicely and tasted great with the prosciutto and balsamic vinegar. Yum!!  Rigatoni Pollo "Diced Chicken Cutlet, Hot & Sweet Peopers, San Marzano Tomatoes & Reggiano Parmesan Cheese" the rigorous was a bit too Al dente for me. The taste was good, just not pasta part for me.   Chilean Seabass Scampi Style w/ White Wine, Garlic Butter, Peas & Cherry Tomatoes. The Seabass was just so buttery, melt in your mouth delicious. The white wine sauce complimented this dish   Chicken Downtown "Chicken Cutlet, Ricotta Cheese, Spinach, Mushrooms, Vine Ripe Tomatoes & Fresh Mozzarella" a nice well rounded dish. Crunch from the chicken cutlet and a very flavorful sauce.  Red Velvet Cake. The cake was very moist with a cream cheese frosting. A nice way to finish our meal.   The service was excellent. Sparkling mineral water was refilled constantly. Plates cleared efficiently. Dishes explained as they are served.   What an Italian feast!! Family Style!!
Food was excellent. Server took good care of us.  A bit pricey,  but it was a special occasion.  We would definitely come back when in Vegas again.

This place I have passed by any of trips to Las Vegas, decided to go and it was fantastic, from the waiter Paul & his busser Charles they were very helpful to make our dinner & nite memorable, the food was delicious from the caprese salad right down to the chicken permagian, we will definitely be back again.

I was stationed in Sicily for three years. I love carbonara and ate it all over Italy.  I'm not sure where the chef learned how to make it but it couldn't of been in Italy. It was an extremely heavy thick dish. It should be much lighter. It just sat in my stomach all night.  The manager came by and asked how we enjoyed our half eaten meal. I told him the truth and he had nothing to say and just walked away. I guess they only want to hear compliments. Definitely will not return. Even the waiter had an attitude. I will say the bread was pretty good though.

I have waited two weeks after eating at Martorano's to write this review, in order to take some of the emotion out of my review.  I left there disappointed, because I like Paris Las Vegas so much.  But if you're looking for Italian in Las Vegas, you can do so much better.  It was fairly simple to get a reservation the same day.  People on walk-up at 8PM were told about a 45-minute wait which, on a holiday weekend in Vegas, still seemed reasonable.  Greeter staff was nice.    Our server was polite, but was very busy in another part of the restaurant.  We waited almost 10 minutes after ordering drinks to get them, and it was only because our assistant waiter (the busboy) saw us looking around, and was alert enough to ask if there was a problem.  Martorano's boasts about their meatballs.  The meatballs get lots of hype.  And the meatball appetizer is OK, but not life-changing.  If you've ever eaten in Little Italy in any city, or at a decent Italian restaurant anywhere that makes its own meatballs as opposed to using those from their foodservice, you'll think the same.  The presentation is nice, but for $20, I expected more from a meatball.    The food was very good.  Please don't mistake the tone of my review, accentuated by what happened when ordering, for putting down their food.  It's pricey, but it's The Strip.  I had Veal Parmigiana which came with NOTHING for $42.   My problem came when I tried to order a side dish.  I wanted a side of pasta, but too much tomato is a very bad thing for me, and I was already having it in the veal. The waiter knew this, because I asked for very light sauce with the veal.    I asked if they could do the pasta with just butter or oil and garlic - very simple, staple ingredients in any restaurant kitchen, let alone an Italian kitchen.  I was told NO, right away.  No discussion.  The restaurant has a firm "no substitutions" policy.  I explained to the waiter that it was something akin to a food allergy, and he told me there was nothing he could do.  The answer was NO.  So I asked just for some plain spaghetti, no sauce.  I was going to be sneaky and just take the butter from the bread and put it on the pasta.  Guess they were two steps ahead of me, because that wasn't allowed either.  I was going to take the spaghetti with marinara and LIKE IT!  OK - no side dish.  And, it's not as though Tomato was going to kill me.  I wasn't going into shock...just some discomfort.  But, no dice.  The waiter sensed my displeasure, and the GM appeared later.  He apologized for not being able to accommodate my wishes.  He told me that the chef had full control over the kitchen, and he was adamant about there being no changes and no substitutions for anything on the menu.  I asked to speak to the chef, but was told "Oh, he's not here, he's in Dallas...but he reads feedback comments you leave when you sign your check".  For the record, as polite as my comments were, he never responded.  It was simply the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard of.  Celebrity Chefs everywhere make accommodations for guest requests that aren't outrageous. I mean, I wasn't asking them to make me gluten-free pasta.    We ate our entrees - which were good.  Nothing memorable, but good.  We skipped dessert and coffee.  The heavy word:  There are WAY TOO MANY CHOICES for great Italian in Las Vegas - and within a 10 minute walk of this place - for any restaurant to be less-than-accommodating.  I'm not saying you won't have a good meal here; but you can do better.
Great place for amazing food as always. Thanks to Steve for bringing this restaurant from Florida to Vegas.
The food tasted good but my stomach hurt shortly after...  My friends' tummies were OK so guess it was just me.  The restaurant claims to have famous meatballs and their meatballs are indeed tasty.
Service was great. The tomato mozzarella starter was wonderful. All 3 main meals were below average. There are much better Italian restaurants in Vegas and for half the price.

Definite 5 stars plus! Great food. Exceptional service. I had the meatball mozzarella appetizer and a dessert and I was stuffed. The server was knowledgeable and very pleasant. Convenient location right outside of the Paris hotel. The movies that were played made dining feel like I was at home. Beautiful decor as well.

This is supposed to be a fine dining restaurant however..... Do not expect to change one single thing on the menu, even if you have food allergies.  Too bad! Sorry for your luck!  Don't even ask for salt!  They will not even put the sauce in the side!!!! Eggplant stack was delicious, so was the mozzarella appetizer.   The pasta bolognese was over priced and was not worthy of a fine dining restaurant.  Yo cuz!  Get with the times,  people make changes to the food based on allergies and so that they can enjoy your food, you need to understand that and give a little on this harsh policy!.

I've seen the reviews and I have dined at many a restaurant and I can say that this place served me the best meal that I have had in Vegas.  We were hungry and lazy and decided to dine in the hotel and were quite pleased with our choice. Let it be known that we did not order off of the menu, the night that we were there there were two special, one sea bass in a white wine and butter sauce with polenta and the other was a linguini with lobster and prawns. I swear my pasta kept getting better and better as I got closer to the bottom of the bowl.  And my friends sea bass was melt in your mouth delicious.  Our waiter Chris was nice as well.

Nice atmosphere, excellent service, food was much better than I expected...I recommend ordering the meatball and salad combo; one their signature dishes, My wife ordered a cabanara dish that was just right...I had a pasta and meat dish that was delicious, would definitely visit another Martorano's
Place is empty and the they told me there is nothing available...dah i can see all the tables are empty

Always a great place for dinner or a drink with a quick bite to eat at the bar. I'm from the same neighborhood as owner Steve Martorano back in south Philly and friends with 2 of his family members. Martoranos is the only place you will find authentic south Philly Italian cooking. The staff are all very welcoming and friendly with Jeff the general manager and Steve an Bethany the bartenders. My first night there I remember ordering nearly $200 worth of food and drinks for myself and sampling the menu. All of which exceeded my expectations. If you're arriving there just for only a quick bite at the bar a must have whether its your first visit as a tourist or a regular is the homemade meatballs. It's well worth it. The cannoli deserts are amazing, as well as the pasta, risotto, and most importantly the friendly attentive service and overall dining experience.

Staff was very friendly and helpful with the menu. We sat on what would be the outside. We ordered what they call family share appetizers. It basically came with five full size appetizers but you only pick three. We had the salad, calamari, and meatballs. Just amazing. All three tasted great. I wanted gnocchi for dinner. So I had to order an entree in order to get that as a side. Turns out gnocchi is only a side not an entree. No you cannot order it alone. The gnocchi was big enough for a meal. I took my entree to go. Just remember...no substitutions allowed! But seriously great place and food. I definitely want to eat here again.

Basic Italian food nothing spectacular. Portion sizes are decent. The meatballs are sworn to be the best but they contain too much bread. There menu is limited. The ambiance is nice and the service is good. Most items are a la carte. Won't go back.

Italian food was tasty but alittle too spicy on some things ordered. Chicken had sauce alittle too spicy as well as my spinach. If you like spicy this is the place for you. I don't think I will come back here

This dude Steve Martorano knows his way around the kitchen.  I first visited his Ft. Lauderdale location a couple of years ago, and I ate there twice in one weekend.  I love Italian food and if you do too, do yourself a favor and check this place out.   This was my first visit to the Paris Las Vegas location, and it did not disappoint.  We started with the Homemade Mozzarella with olive oil and sea salt and it just melts in your mouth.  Then I had the Martorano Salad which was popping with veggies, something I love.  For dinner, I went with the Veal Cutlet Martorano which is topped with San Marzano tomatoes and this dish has an amazing combination of sweet and hot that balances your taste buds perfectly.  The table also split the Bucatini Carbonara, which is full of creamy goodness and the pasta is amazingly fresh.    This guy knows Italian food and he is a big guy so the portions are quite large.  I see a lot of people on this site reviewing this place as too pricey and that could not be further from the truth.  Each dish contains large portions, even the salads, so pack an appetite.  If you're looking for a $10 Chicken Parmesan, go to Olive Garden, this place is not for you.

I came here expecting this place to be over rated and it turned out to be some of the best Italian that I've ever had. Best in Las Vegas. The seafood spaghetti had so much flavor that just a tiny taste of the sauce had punch. The appetizers are divine, great vegetarian options and the dishes tasted traditional and homemade. I loved it and can't wait to go back.  I did find a hair in my red velvet cake and they accidentally gave me someone else's doggy bag but the food was so good I'm willing to overlook it. LOL!

We came here for a business dinner, a huge party taking up 2 huge tables. We ordered a family style feast that consisted of sausages, meatballs, mozzarella, pastas, and dessert. The waiters were very attentive and did a great job with our drinks and clearing up our table. Although, they did give my wife a Mojito instead of a Moscato. Easy mistake considering the place is  loud. Besides their efforts, everything else was awful! The sausage and meatball was ok. The sausage was dry and the meatball was really nothing to rave about.  The pastas were under cooked. I am not sure whether it is the way we ordered our food but I've had better at a fast food joint.  What makes things worse was the atmosphere in there. Very Guido! They were playing on the TV's Martorano cooking 2 meals which looks like something my 9 year old cooks. And in my opinion he looks like a bulky version of Mickey Rourke?.? Which adds to the Guidoness. What also adds to that is that they also showed and blasted scenes from the Godfather and Casino where they F-bombed every other word. That made part of our group who are devoted church goers very uncomfortable.
Delish!!! Top notch service and food. The meatball is to die for and can't complain about the chicken parmigiana, calamari or gnocchi either.
Raymond was awesome!!! Really good food and service! I got the carbonara mhhhhm goooood!

Great service from beginning to end. We started with an appetizer called Fried Calamari Bibzy which is out of this world delicious!!!  We ordered the Spaghetti Pescatore and the Spaghetti D.O.P. - both were very delicious!!!

Let me say the review has nothing to do with the food. Been to the one at rio food was awesome service just as good atmosphere amazing.   Service at Paris horrible and slow. They had no personality, just not friendly.  Waited for service a long time then no interaction at all, very different from Rio.   Food. I ordered exactly the same items as last time. Meatball and salad. It was the same, delicious. Bread with oil very good. Spaghetti Dob also very good.   Atmosphere....none there were tons of empty tables inside the restaurant where the theme and atmosphere are yet they sat us on top of a huge party outside in the walkway to hear and see all the drunks walk by, so no atmosphere on the patio....again way different than the cool setting at the Rio with Rocky movies and music.

Food was good, but over priced. 4 people, and we paid $180, no alcohol, just one apetizer and some pasta dishes.   Service was amazing. But the reason I am giving this restuarant 1 star is because they played SCARFACE while I was having dinner with my small chiildren! How can an "upscale" restaurant play a rated R movie, which portrays violence, in a setting which is supposed to be relaxing, romantic and classic We had to leave in the middle of our meal, no time for dessert and rush through a few bites My husband had to remove my children from the table during one of the killing scenes I addressed this with the manager, and he didn't seem interested in what I had to say  DO NOT GIVE THIS RESTUARANT ANY BUSINESS!
